loans.name: Blansia

texts.en:
Blansia is a 35 year old married woman. She owns a small shop, which she started in 1999. Every day she works from 7 A.M. to 6 P.M. at her business where she earns a monthly profit of about $380.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Reyna Amanda

texts.es:
Reyna belongs to the “Las Azucenas 2” comunal bank, which is located in the district of Calleria, in the department of Ucayali. She is 49 years old and is the mother of three grown children. Her husband is a vendor. With the first loan of S/. 300.00 that she received from Manuela Ramos, Reyna decided to invest in a small grocery store.

She rises every morning at 7:00am to make breakfast for her children and her husband. She then opens her store and tends it until 8pm.

With this loan of S/.1000.00, which will be paid back in 4 months, she will buy: 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, milk, soap, noodles, etc. Reyna is very happy because with the help of Manuela Ramos, she is able to work independently and help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Reyna pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Azucenas 2, ubicado en el Asentamiento Humano. 11 de Julio Psj. Fraternidad 189, Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 49 años y es madre de 3 hijos mayores de edad, su esposo es comerciante. Reyna con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña bodega. En la actualidad se levanta a las 7 am para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo, luego abre su bodega para atenderla hasta las 8 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, leche, jabón, fideos, etc. Reyna esta muy feliz, ya que gracias al apoyo que le da Manuela Ramos puede trabajar de manera independiente y ayudar a su familia.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her small grocery store

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is an experienced and versatile entrepreneur. She’s been selling wood, coal, fruits and vegetables, and also ice cream. Currently, Paulina sells tablecloths, window curtains, and bedspreads in her neighborhood.

This entrepreneur explains that, despite her advanced age, she doesn’t feel like closing her business. In fact, she’s requesting a loan to boost her business and to buy a large variety of goods to add to her stock. The entrepreneur would like to have enough money in order to enjoy her golden years.

loans.use: To buy household goods to sell in her community

loans.name: Salimjon

texts.en:
Salimjon A. is 40 years old and the father of 4 children. He lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. Mr. A. has been in the livestock business for 10 years. He has a good flock and rams that provide the general family income. His wife and children help him by selling milk and yarn products as well as meat.

Mr. A. is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of $625 US for 6 months so he can build a new barn. Mr. A. thanks KIVA for its work and wishes KIVA lenders all the best.

loans.use: To build a new barn

loans.name: Mara

texts.en:
Miss Mara C., 32, is single and lives with her elderly parents on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has three sisters who live in the same house; two of them are married and the other one is single and is a silk weaver.

Since she was sixteen years old, Miss Mara has been a silk weaver, a skill she learned from her mother. She and her sister sell their finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Mara is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

loans.name: Me

texts.en:
Mrs. Me S., 55, is a farmer in Chres Village in the Kampong Speu Province. Her husband, Mr. Suk Soeurn, is a palm juice collector who gathers juice to process into palm sugar or palm wine. They have one child who is employed at a garment factory.

Mrs. Me S. faces a problem because her field is infertile. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer to improve the soil and increase her crop output. Last year, Mrs. Me S. was ill and had to spend $125 for medical procedures. This is why Mrs. Me S. does not have enough money to buy fertilizer. Mrs. Me S. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer in order to produce a better crop.

loans.name: Dialki Djigue Group

texts.fr: Dans le cadre de la lutte contre la pauvreté, les femmes de notre groupement pour améliorer  la qualité de leur vie ont décidé de s'adonner à des activités génératrices de revenus en demandant un prêt à Kiva. Cette activité est la vente de fruits (pastèques, oranges, manques etc.) et légumes (carottes, choux, patates, courges, etc..) que nous récoltons de nos champs et allons vendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires qui regroupent des milliers de personnes mais aussi de transporter notre marchandise vers d'autres horizons d'où venir les vendre en ville particulièrement à Dakar là où le besoin se fait sentir le plus.
texts.en:
In the fight against poverty, the women of our group, in order to improve their quality of life, decided to devote themselves to businesses in applying for a loan at Kiva. This business is in selling fruits (watermelons, oranges, mangoes, etc.) and vegetables (carrots, cabbages, potatoes, squash, etc.) that we harvest from our fields and either go to sell in weekly markets where thousands gather or take it elsewhere to sell in the city, especially in Dakar, where there is great need.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to sell fruits an vegetables

loans.name: Khan's Group

texts.en:
Khan P. (the first from the left with her group members) was selected to be a group leader by members for a loan from Maxima. In the group there are four families including hers. The members are living along National Road Number Twom about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

1-Khan P., 42, and her husband, Heng H., were married in 1979 and have five children. One of their children is married and lives outside the family home, two daughters are garment factory workers and the other two children study in a local school. Khan and her husband have been fishermen for ten years. She is requesting a loan for $200 to purchase fishing nets for her fishing business.

2- Sopheap M., 34, is a widow with four children. Sopheap has been working at Ngo in Phnom Penh City for seven years. She travels to work by taxi and costs are very high. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $200 to help her  purchase a motorbike to drive to work.

3-Thorn H., 39, and her husband, Lois Ly, 45, were married in 1983 and have two sons and four daughters. Two of their children study in a local school. Thorn and her husband have been fishermen for ten years. Beside fishing, her husband is also a construction worker. Thorn is requesting a loan in the amount of $200 to purchase additional fishing nets.

4-Sophoin C., 25, and his wife, Sory Noun, 25, were married in 2003 and have one daughter. Sophoin and his wife have been fishing for five years. He is requesting a loan in the amount of $200 to purchase more fishing nets.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle and fishing nets.

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es: nDoña Dionisia tiene 50 años D. edad, es casada y madre D. 07 hijos, no estudio por que quedo huérfana muy pequeña, vive en el Jr. 28 D. Julio Nº 401 del Distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Yunguyo-Puno.nnEs socia del Banco Comunal “Señor D. Locumba”- Yunguyo hace 07 años, con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compro 02  porcinos para engorD., ella empezó a trabajar desD. los 40 años vendiendo chuño y papa los días domingos en el mercado Laguna verD.. Actualmente se dedica a la crianza D. animales y continua vendiendo sus productos antes mencionados.nnCon el préstamo  que solicitara D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles comprara  10 arrobas D. papa a S/.  150 nuevos soles, 01 saco D. chuño a S/.  200 nuevos soles, crédito que pagara en 04 cuotas.nSu sueño es seguir con su negocio e  incrementar su capital.n
texts.en:
Dionisia is 50 years old, married, and the mother of seven children. She did not study because she was orphaned at a very young age. She lives in the Yunguyo district of the Yunguyo-Puno province. She is a member of the communal bank for seven years. With her first loan of 300.00 soles, she bought two pigs to fatten. Since she turned 40 years of age, she has worked selling chuflo (dried potatoes) and potatoes at the market in Laguna VerD.. Currently, she dedicates herself to raising animals and continues selling the aforementioned items. With the loan of 500.00 soles that she is now requesting, she will purchase 10 arrobas (unit of weight, about 14 kg) of potatoes at 0.15 soles, 1 sack of chuflo at 200.00 soles. She intends to repay her loan in four installments. Her dream is to continue with her business and increase her capital.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase potatoes at wholesale.

loans.name: Gemilda Arcelli

texts.es:
La señora Gemilda es socia del BC. La Mujer Riojana, vive en el departamento de San Martín, provincia y distrito de Rioja, tiene un taller de tapizados para todo tipo de muebles y asientos de vehículos. El taller está ubicado en una de las calles principales d la ciudad.
Con este préstamo de S/.3,000, el cual será cancelado en 06 meses, comprará marroquines de distintos colores, pegamento en latas, hilo nylon en ovillos, lona y espuma para cojines, tijeras de acero y otros materiales necesarios para la confección de sus trabajos y poder quedar bien con sus clientes.
Gemilda Araceli tiene 44 años de edad, vive con sus 04 hijos, 03 de ellos ya son profesionales y sólo su última hija aún depende de ella. Gracias a esta actividad pudo solventar los gastos de educación de sus hijos porque ella es padre y madre para ellos. Más adelante quiere poner un negocio de venta de materiales para tapizados.
texts.en:
Gemilda is a member of La Mujer Riojana Community Bank and lives in the Rioja province and district, in the department of San Martín. She has an upholstery workshop for all kinds of furniture and car seats located on one of the main streets in town.

With this $975 loan, which she will repay in 6 months, Gemilda will buy a range of coloured upholstery fabrics, cans of glue, spools of nylon thread, canvas and foam for cushions, steel scissors and other materials needed for her line of business and to keep her customers happy.

Gemilda Araceli is 44 years old, and she lives with her four children, three of whom support themselves, and her youngest daughter, who is still dependent on her mother. She is a single parent, and her workshop has allowed her to pay for her children's education. In the future, she plans on setting up a business to sell upholstery materials.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy a range of coloured upholstery fabrics, cans of glue, spools of nylon thread, canvas and foam for cushions, steel scissors, etc.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cee, as she is popularly called by her numerous customers, is a 42 year-old local restaurant operator.  She is married and blessed with three children.  With income from her business, she has provided for one of her children to graduate from senior high school.

In her restaurant, she prepares and sells local foods like “banku” - rice with stew.  Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and is taken with hot pepper or soup.  Apart from this, she also prepares pastries like meat pies and cakes.  

Cynthia says that the prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to enable her to meet her production expenditures.  She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, flour, margarine, sugar, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood.

Cynthia is a member of a group called Success Trust Group.  In this group, members guarantee and provide support to one another to repay the loan.  Her picture was taking when she was visited at her business site.

loans.use: Cynthia wants the loan to buy raw materilas like flour, margarine, maize, firewood, meat, fish, etc.

loans.name: Naren

texts.en: Mrs. Naren E. is a villager in Pour village in Kampong Cham province. She is a fish breeder. In her business, she has a problem because she does not have enough money to buy fish food to support them. Thus, she has decided to request a loan to purchase fish food for her breeding fishes business. She hopes to increase her income to provide a better living for her family. Her husband, Mr. Pech Malin, is a farmer. Mrs. Naren E. is 40 years old and the mother of two children who are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To purchase fish food

loans.name: Nazira

texts.en:
Nazira E. is 32 years old. She is married with 3 children. Her husband currently is working in Russia. Nazira is a devoted mother who struggles day after day to provide the best for her family. Five years ago she got an idea to start raising cattle to contribute to the family finances, taking advantage of the space she had available in her house for this business. Slowly the number of cows increased and her clients started asking for more and more. With an endless list of requests she has finally decided to increase the number of livestock she keeps and for this reason she is requesting a loan. Be an important part of the growth of Nazira’s business.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture and Central Asian traditions. But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Roeun

texts.en:
Mr. Roeun S., 37, and his wife, Mrs. Sreymom Sorn, 29, live along national road number one about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1991 and have two daughters. One of them is a garment-factory worker and another one is still young.

Roeun has been a mason for 18 years. His wife has been a garment-factory worker for one year. Roeun is requesting his first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike to drive to work, to dig a water well for use in his family and to concrete a wall of his house.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to drive to work, to dig one well and to concrete a wall of his house

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda G. is managing a small farm. She grows rice and almost all her produce is intended for family use. The remainder of her produce is sold to rice traders for additional income for the family. She is 50 years old and has three children. Her husband is a farmer who has managed their 1-hectare farm since they are married.

Yolanda is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizer, seed,  and pesticides. The loan will help improve the soil in her farm and provide the whole family with a bountiful harvest.

CEVI provides Yolanda the credit assistance that she needs. Yolanda also receives training and insurance coverage to help her grow her farm.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, seed, and pesticides

loans.name: Nicoé

texts.fr: Né en 1980 à Badougbé, M. B. Nicoé est célibataire. Il est frigoriste de formation. Cette activité ne marchant pas il s’est tourné vers la restauration. Il a un petit restaurant spécialisé dans la viande du porc. En vue d’accroître son commerce, il sollicite ce crédit afin d’aller plus loin dans sa nouvelle activité de restauration. Il sollicite un crédit à cause de la hausse du prix des porcs et surtout du matériel dont il a besoin pour exercer son activité.
texts.en:
Born in 1980 in Badougbé, Nicoé B. is a bachelor. He is a trained refrigeration engineer. However, this business did not work out very well, so he switched to catering. He has a small restaurant that specializes in pork dishes. With the aim of growing his business, he is requesting this loan to make progress in his new catering venture. He is asking for a loan because of the increase in the price of pork and other wares essential to his business.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pork for his catering business

loans.name: Nasreen Khanum Mansor Lal Khan Group

texts.en:
Nasreen khanum baji is fifty-two years old and has resided in a city named Lahore, in Pakistan, for the last twenty-five years. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi foods. She is a widow with three sons. Her elder son operates a shuttering business and the others work as policemen. Nasreen baji operates a business sewing clothes, and she also embroiders dresses. She takes orders from her neighbors and charges them $2 per item. She is applying for a loan for her elder son because he wants to buy wood to increase his shuttering business. 

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Hajra baji wants a loan to buy material (tent, table covers and chairs) for her catering business. Farzana khatoon baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Anayatan baji wants a loan to buy bicycles' spare parts to sell. Faiz ilahi baji wants a loan to buy wood for her shuttering business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy wood for shuttering business.

loans.name: Ibodullo

texts.ru: Мамаюсупов  Ибодулло – мужчина  1973  года  рождения,  женат,  имеет  3  детей.  Занимается  откормом  и  куплей-продажей  скота.  Недавно  его  жена  Бобоева  Дилрабо  посоветовала  ему  обратиться  в  нашу  организацию  за  кредитом.  На  полученный  кредит  они  решили  купить  дойную  корову  с  телёнком.  Ибодулло  очень  любит  свою  работу,  так  как  занимается  этим  с  юных  лет.  В  будущем  он  хочет  продолжить  сотрудничество  с  «Микроинвест»  и  на  полученный  займ  он  планирует  расширить  коровник.
texts.en:
Born in 1973, Ibodullo M. is married and has 3 children. He is involved in livestock feeding and sales. Recently, his wife, Dilrabo Boboeva, advised him to request a loan from our organization. They want to use this loan to purchase a dairy cow with a calf. Ibodullo loves his work because he has been doing it since a young age. In the future, he wants to continue the collaboration with MicroInvest and plans to expand his cowshed with this loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow with a calf

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina A. is 32 years old. She is divorced and has three children – two sons and a daughter. One child is in junior high and the other children two are in primary school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Suhum in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She works very hard to provide for the family. Georgina runs a grocery store in her community. Her shop is by the road side. She buys groceries from Accra and other big shops in her community. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy provisions in bulk so she can increase her stock. She is hopeful to sponsor her children in school to higher levels.

loans.use: To buy groceries in bulk

loans.name: Medy

texts.en: Medy S. is from the village of Guinabot, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. Medy owns and operates a vulcanizing business in the local community. Medy has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Medy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 43 años, vive con su pareja y padre de su único hijo en su casa propia. Desde hace varios años atrás se dedica a la siembra y cultivo de papas y arvejas, pero por  consejo de sus vecinos ha empezado a sembrar flores, lo que le ha resultado muy rentable, sobre todo en los meses de mayo y octubre, de no terminar la cosecha de las flores, las deja en la chacra hasta que maduren y se convierten en las semillas, las cuales vende y también las usa para su próxima siembra. Desde entonces, Maria está priorizando la siembra de flores porque no tiene pérdidas, sin embargo, demandan de mucha agua, por lo que tiene que regar constantemente, ya sea de noche o de día para lograr que sus cultivos floreen rápidamente. De seguir rindiéndole sus siembras como hasta ahora, quiere comprar vacas para criar y vender mientras espera los meses de cosecha. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, a pesar de sus carencias económicas lo que resalta en María  es la responsabilidad de efectuar sus pagos. Asimismo asiste a todas las reuniones de su banco comunal y aunque no escucha muy bien, pide el apoyo de sus compañeras cuando es necesario. El dinero que viene solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para su próxima siembra de flores y pueda cosechar para el mes de octubre.
texts.en:
Maria is 43 years old and lives with her partner (the father of her only son) in their own house. For several years now, she has been planting and cultivating potatoes and peas. On the advice of her neighbors, she has also started planting flowers, which has been very profitable for her, especially during the months of May and October. If she doesn't get the chance to cut all of the flowers, she allows them to continue growing on her land until they begin to produce seeds, which she then sells or plants in the next season. Maria has decided to make planting flowers her top priority, since they don't incur any losses, though they do require extensive watering, and she has to water them day and night in order to make the plants produce flowers quickly. She plans to continue to grow flowers, but also wants to start raising and selling cows in the meantime, as she waits for the harvest months. This is her eighth credit with Microfinanzas Prisma, and despite her difficult economic situation, what stands out in Maria is her ability to responsibly make her loan payments. She also attends all of her village bank meetings, and since she doesn't have very good hearing, she asks for her fellow group members' support when necessary. The requested loan will be used to buy chemical fertilizers for the upcoming flower planting season; these flowers will be ready to harvest in October.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Thorn Y. is a farmer who owns a small rice field and cultivates rice for a living. She is also a grocer in her village. She is a widow with two children who are attending the local school. They live in Sambuor village in Takeo province.

Since the grocery business is doing well, Mrs. Thorn Y. wants to expand it. She decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods for the current business. She will use some of the loan to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods

loans.name: Zinhoue

texts.en:
Zinhoue lives in Porto-Novo, Benin. She is married to a tailor and they have two children, ages seven and three. Zinhoue sells meals consisting of eggs, rice, and beans in Porto-Novo. She buys her ingredients each morning from the local farms surrounding Porto-Novo. She has a small stand on the side of a busy street where has been working for over five years. Before this, she helped her mother with her business, in which she sells rice and vegetables.   

Zinhoue is seeking a loan from Alide, a Kiva field partner in Benin. She has already acquired an Alide loan, which allowed her to start selling eggs along with her meals. With the help of another loan, she would like to replenish her supplies so that she can better serve her clientele. In the future, if she has the financial means, Zinhoue would like to start selling clothing.

loans.use: Eggs, bread, beans, and other foods

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es: La señora Josefa Hernández de 49 años de edad, es una mujer esforzada que ha logrado salir adelante en su vida con su negocio. Tiene 49 años de edad, reside en el barrio anexo Villa Libertad en la capital de Managua, casada y con cinco hijos que procreo tres mayores de edad independiente y dos están estudiando, su esposo es albañil, su negocio es la venta de tortillas desde hace dos años se ha dedicado a la venta de tortilla, anteriormente vendía comida por encargo, pero cada día vendía menos lo cual cambio de negocio lo cual le daría mejores utilidades ya que el bastimento de todos los Nicaragüenses, para sastifacer las necesidades de su familia. Sus planes es poder ayudar a sus hijos  a que estudien para que tengan un nivel de vida mejor, ya que desde horas tempranas me levanto para ir a moler el molino, ya que por las noches dejo nesquizado el maíz y comienzo a palmear las ricas tortillas. Con este crédito comprara maíz, maseca, leña, gas y productos lácteos. Sus planes es hacer un bajarete  en donde palmea para dar un mejor servicio y una mejor a apariencia al negocio.  Da las gracias a la institución por la oportunidad de lograr el incremento de inventario y poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Sra. Josefa Hernández is 49 years old and lives in the neighborhood annex of Villa Libertad in the capital of Managua. She is a courageous woman who has managed to get ahead in life as well as in her business. Sra. Josefa is married and has five children, of which three are independent while the other two are students. Her husband works as a bricklayer.

Sra. Josefa has been selling tortillas for two years. She previously sold fast food, but her sales were decreasing so she changed her business in order to improve her income. She decided to sell tortillas because it is a staple for all Nicaraguans and it would help her provide for her family’s basic necessities. Her plans include helping her children with their education so that they can have a better quality of life. Sra. Josefa wakes up in the early hours to begin grinding the corn after it has soaked overnight. She then begins shaping the tortillas.

With her loan, Sra. Josefa will purchase corn, flour, firewood, gas and dairy products. She hopes to build a covered patio where she can make her tortillas and provide better service, as well as give her business a nicer appearance. She thanks the Institution for the opportunity to increase her inventory so that she can get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn, flour, firewood, gas and dairy products

loans.name: Hai

texts.en: Mrs. Hai H. lives in Dork Pour village in Takeo province. She is a housewife. Her husband, Mr. Nget Houk, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. This couple has four children, one of whom is a coconut seller while another is employed in a garment factory and the others are enrolled in the local school. Now Mrs. Hai H. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding and to buy a cart to transport the coconut to sell. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding and to buy a cart to transport the coconut to sell.

loans.name: Marlene Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Marlene de 45 años de edad se dedica a la venta de variedades, Marlene a administrado su negocio desde hace mas de 5 años, tiene clientes fijos, allí se vende todo tipo de accesorios, papeleria y hasta zapatos. Ella ha solicitado este prestamo con el deseo de incrementar su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos, ya que su sueño es poder tener una gran tienda de variedades donde pueda ofrecer de todo a los clientes, es madre soltera y vive con su unica hija, la cual es de gran apoyo para ella ya que mientras ella no esta le ayuda con el negocio,  sale a comprar al mercado para comprar a precios mas bajos ya que ella vende $1434.00 y compra $946.00 recibiendo una 
ganacia de $488.00  ella invertirá este prestamo para comprar ( Exhibidor, resmas de papel, tinta de impresoras, cajas de unico etc,..) doña Marlene inicio vendiendo confites y hoy en día tiene una bonita tienda y es muy querida por sus vecinos los cuales también son clientes, asi mismo fue agradable conocer un poco de doña MARLENE.
texts.en:
Sra. Marlene is 45 years old and sells a variety of products such as accessories, stationery, and even shoes. She has managed her business for more than 5 years and has an established clientele. Marlene is requesting a loan so that she can expand her business and improve her earnings. She dreams of having a large variety store where she can offer everything to her customers.

Marlene is a single mother and lives with her only daughter, who has been a great support to her and also helps with the business.

When Doña Marlene goes to market to buy products for her store, she always searches for the lowest prices. One time she purchased $946 worth of merchandise and was able to sell it for $1434, making a profit of $488. She will use her loan to purchase a display case, reams of paper, printer ink, gift boxes, etc. She also started selling bonbons and now has a lovely store that is a favorite among her neighbors, who are also her customers. It has been a pleasure to meet someone like Doña Marlene.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cardboard, paper, gift bags, pencils, markers, rulers, glue, calculators, erasers, folders, stickers, notebooks, colored ink, crayons, bonbons, etc.

loans.name: Joice Kavusi

texts.en:
Joice is 40 years old, married, and blessed with four children.

Her salon business is at the Junction in Eldoret.

She was introduced to KADET by another client. With the loan, she intends to buy more chemicals for her salon and also some equipment to assist her in running her business. In the future, she hopes to be able to improve her family's standard of living.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy more chemicals and equipment for her beauty salon business

loans.name: Simon Lindon

texts.es:
Simon es Chofer propietario de un Trufi de la línea 88, es soltero y vive en la casa de sus tíos ubicado en la Zona Obispo Bosque de la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de un Motor para la movilidad con el que trabaja así tener asegurado sus ingresos.

Es el tercer crédito en IMPRO, sus créditos anteriores fueron pagados puntualmente, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Simon.
texts.en:
Simon is an independent taxi driver for Trufi Route 88. He is single and lives in the home of his aunt and uncle, located in the Obispo Bosque district of the city of La Paz.

His loan will be used to buy a motor for his vehicle that is in working condition. This will enable him to have a stable income.

Simon is requesting his third loan from IMPRO. His previous loans were paid on time, and his evaluation indicated that he is approved for this new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a motor for his taxi

loans.name: Munkhbat

texts.en:
Munkhbat is 23 years old and lives with his wife and 3-year-old son in the Khovd province of western Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His wife is a university student, his son goes to a local kindergarten, and Munkhbat operates a cell phone repair business. He began his business in 2003 in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. When he and his wife moved to Khovd in 2006, he brought his business with him. In the past six years, he has become very experienced in his business field and has managed to save enough of his business profits to purchase a car for his family. Munkhbat says, “My business is growing quite well, but in the future, I would like to sell phones as well as repair them.” He is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase cell phone parts for his business. About XacBank: XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.
To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.
To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase cell phone parts

loans.name: Asmahan

texts.en: Asmahan is a 42-year-old married woman and mother of 2 unemployed children. She has owned a clothes shop since 1993 where she sells clothing to the neighboring villages. Today, Asmahan is requesting to borrow $1,000 to buy more clothes before the holiday season. She hopes to increase her sales and her business income.

loans.use: To buy more clothes.

loans.name: Gulgul

texts.en:
Gulgul is 30 years old and lives with her husband and two children in the Bayan-Ulgii province of western Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her two children, aged 7 and 6, both attend a local secondary school while her husband operates a transportation business.

Gulgul operates a dairy retail business. She began her business in 2006 and would like to rent a stall in the local market in the future so that she can increase her profits. She and her husband both work very hard to provide for their children and she would like to be able to build a house soon so that the family can live more comfortably.

Gulgul is requesting a 400,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase milk for her business.

loans.use: To purchase milk for her business

loans.name: Daniel Okuku

texts.en: Daniel Okuku Ong’ayo is 30 years old, married, and the father of three children. He is a businessman in Rongo, Kenya. Daniel is a former farmer who decided to venture into retail business, chiefly hawking small items. He buys his stock five times a month from neighboring Kisii town, and often from Nairobi, the capital city. Daniel is requesting a loan of 15,000 KES, which will go towards increasing his stock. His future plan is to start a retail shop business.

loans.use: To increase his stock

loans.name: Suong

texts.en: Mrs. S. is a 35-year-old farmer with many years of farming experience. She is a married mother of three teenage children, two of whom are students and one of whom is a garment factory worker. She has a partner in her husband, which allows her to plant crops. S. is requesting a loan to buy planks in order to replace the broken wall of her old house.

loans.use: To buy planks.

loans.name: Germán

texts.es:
El señor Germán O. H. trabaja en la universidad católica agropecuaria del trópico seco (ucatse) como celador tiene mas de cinco años de estar laborando y desempeñado bien su trabajo se le otorgo el crédito para la compra de un dinamo y calzado de pozo artesanal ya que la necesidad de agua que se  encuentra en su lugar es muy critica su trabajo es día de por medio ya que le toca cuidar también por la noche 
Antes de tener este trabajo el se dedicaba a hacer ladrillos como trabajador de otra persona. 

El espera que con la hecha de este poso no tendrá problemas del vital liquido ya que tiene un buen caudal y se mantiene en el verano. Don Germán es  casado y tiene tres hijos en edad escolar por lo que espera que ellos se preparen algún día y  pueda ver el fruto de sus hijos. Sus padres no viven con él porque formo su propio hogar pero los ayudas cada ves que él puede.

Este es el cuarto crédito que Germán tiene con ceprodel 
y trabaja desde el dos mil seis con la institución y nos expreso que los créditos con ceprodel han ayudado mucho  a mejorar su nivel de vida ya que a mejorado su casa y a comprado cosas necesarias del hogar por tanto desea seguir trabajando y espera no quedar mal con ceprodel.
texts.en:
Germán O. H. works as a watchman at UCATSE (a university); he has been employed there for over 5 years and has done his job very well. He was given a loan to buy a dynamo and to line an artesian well because his area has a critical shortage of water. He must do this work during the day because his watchman duties are at night. Prior to this employment, he made bricks as an employee of another person. He hopes that the digging of the well will end his problems with water supply because the well is well-fed and it does not dry up in Summer. German is married and has three, school-age children. He hopes that they will become prepared in the future and that he will see the fruits of his labor in his children. His parents don't live with him because he started his own family but he helps them out whenever he can. This is his 4th loan with Ceprodel and has collaborated with the institution since 2006. He stated that Ceprodel loans have been very useful in improving his living conditions because he has been able to improve his home and buy things needed in his home. He is, therefore, hopeful to continue working with and not disappointing Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To line a well and buy a dynamo.

loans.name: Chhourn

texts.en:
Chhourn S., age 57, is married and resides with her three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia.

S. has a business farming and raising animals, earning an income of approximately US$1 per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses, especially the children’s education. She has been with this business since 1985. Her husband is a skillful chef, earning an income of US$2 per day.

Their standard of living has been improved since S. is with this business, so she wants to have a loan to expand her business. S. is requesting a loan of US$1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work. This is her third loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her children to use for commuting

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
Esta señora se llama Rosa Isabel Urbina, tiene 53 años de edad, casada, dependen de ella tres personas, dos hijos que están en edad de secundaria, y su marido que está pensionado. 

El negocio lo estableció desde hace Veinte Años, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en el Mercado Municipal, aparte de atenderlo ella el negocio, también le ayuda  su hija mayor.
texts.en:
Rosa Isabel U.is 53 years old, married and is responsible for three people: two children who are in secondary school, and her husband who is retired. The business she established 20 years ago is in the Municipal Market. Apart from taking care of her business, she also helps her older sister.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies for the market (Coca-cola, juice, Gatorade, candy)

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: El señor Pedro Ríos Cárdenas es casado con la señora Mabi Isabel y son padres de un niño en edad pre-escolar, el labora para una empresa desde hace 7 años de antigüedad, su esposa vende ropa semi nueva y usada los fines de semana, la cual ya tiene su clientela, ya que vende producto en buenas condiciones; ellos están tramitando este crédito para la terminación de un cuarto en construcción, y así tener mayor espacio en su hogar.
texts.en:
Pedro Ríos Cárdenas is married to Mabi Isabel and they are the parents of a pre-schooler. He has been empolyed for 7 years and she sells used clothing on weekends; she has a regular customer base because she sells clothes that are in good condition. They are negotiating a loan so that they can finish building a room addition to their house in order to have more room.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish building a room.

loans.name: Fama

texts.fr: Fama S. est âgée de 47 ans, est mariée et mère de 04 enfants en charge. Elle a une expérience de 7 ans et demi dans le domaine de l'embouche et son nouveau prêt lui permettra d'acheter une dizaine de moutons qu'elle va engraisser et revendre au bout de 5 mois. Elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Fama S. is 47 years old, married and mother to four children who are in her care. She has seven and a half years' experience in the animal fattening business and her new loan will allow her to buy ten sheep, which she will fatten up and resell in five months' time. She helps her husband to support the family.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop her sheep fattening activity

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 46 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en la casa de sus padres. Hace mas de 1 año que tiene una tienda, en donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad, por lo que trata de mantener surtida su negocio para poder cumplir con la demanda de su cliente. Es así que trabaja todos los días, incluidos los fines de semana, que son lo días que más ventas tiene, quedándose hasta largas horas de la noche. Para ella este negocio le es rentable, y más cuando vende gaseosas, cervezas y condimentos. Adicionalmente a esta actividad, cría cuyes y cada 15 días realiza alguna venta, de acuerdo a la demanda del cliente. Su negocio le ha dado la oportunidad de mejorar económicamente, es por eso que desea suministrar su tienda con variados productos. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por tanto será muy responsable con sus pagos, además considera que éste aporte le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de cerveza y productos envasados.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 46 years old; she lives with her 3 children in her parents’ home. For more than 1 year, she has had a store where she sells basic household goods and tries to maintain her business stocked to be able to meet her customer’s needs. Elizabeth works everyday including weekends which are the days where she sells the most and she works long hours into the night. For her, this business is more profitable and she sells mostly soft drinks, beers and seasonings. Additionally to this work, she breeds cuyes (a hamster like animal) and every 15 days she has a sale according to the needs of her customers. Elizabeth’s business has given her the opportunity to improve financially and that is why she wishes to supply her store with a variety of products. This is her fifth loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner) and she will be very responsible with her payments and feels that this support will be very helpful to the development of her business. With the loan she will buy beer and bottled products.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beer and bottled products.

loans.name: Rossini

texts.es:
Rossini es socia del Banco Comunal Kallpanchik, palabra en quechua que significa Nuestra Fuerza. Rossini es conviviente y tiene 22 años.
Rossini tiene una tienda en la casa de sus padres en donde vende abarrotes en general, además Rossini vende chicharrones en el mercadillo de su distrito.
Rossini necesita un préstamo de 900 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de abarrotes. Rossini sueña tener su negocio surtido de productos.
texts.en:
Rossini is 22 years old married, and a member of the Kallpanchik (a word that means “Our Strength” in the Quechua language). She runs a grocery store from her parents’ home and also sells fried pork rinds in her district’s marketplace. Rossini needs a loan of 900 PEN ($325). She will use the money from this loan to buy more groceries. She hopes to be able to offer a wider assortment in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Ndieme

texts.fr: Madame Ndieme K. évolue dans la couture et le commerce de tissus et d’habits depuis 10ans. C’est une femme divorcée  de 54 ans qui est membre de l’U-IMCEC à la caisse de  Ouakam depuis 9 ans déjà. Elle a en charge un garçon  qui fait ses études  à l’extérieur. Elle a choisi cette activité  dans le but d’acquérir  un revenu qui lui permettra de soutenir son fils et subvenir a ses besoins. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 250 000 frs dans le but d’acheter des tissus pour la confection d’habits qu’elle commercialise. Elle a déjà  rembourse 3 prêts antérieurs  et ces crédits  lui ont permit  d’acquérir  une certaine indépendance  financière.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ndieme K. has been working as a seamstress and selling clothes and fabric for ten years. She is divorced, 54 years old and has been a member of the Ouakam branch of U-IMCEC already for nine years already. She has to support a young boy who is in a school out of town. She has chosen this activity in order to be able to obtain an income permitting her to support her son and herself. She is seeking a credit of 250,000 West African Francs, with the goal of purchasing fabric for sewing clothes which she will then offer for sale. She already repaid three prior loans; these loans have helped her obtain a certain degree of financial independence.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business investment

loans.name: Chieu

texts.en: Chieu T. N. was born in 1963. She has two sons. She is a farmer. She not only grows rice, but also raises pigs. She has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 VND. She has participated in SEDA since 2003 and repaid punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND to breed the pigs and poultry.

loans.use: to breed pigs and poultry

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: Maribel E. is a 28 year old married woman who supports her family by operating a general store. She lives in Barangay Lomboy, Tanjay City, Negros Oriental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000. Maribel is now borrowing PHP 21,000 so that she can buy more stock for her general store. This will be her 8th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Maribel aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: For Additional Working Capital

loans.name: The Lord Is My Shepherd Group

texts.en:
Miatta D., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called The Lord Is My Shepherd. She is 65 years old, widowed and has five children who range from 30 to 50 years old. 

She was not privileged to attend school through to completion due to poverty. For 15 years now she has been selling charcoal in Redlight Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more bags of charcoal. She describes herself as a friendly woman. Her goal is to improve her business and to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Tito

texts.es: Tito, de 32 años, es un padre de familia muy alegre y trabajador, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposa Blanca y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Todos los días muy temprano por la mañana, Tito sale a trabajar sus campos, para él no existen los días de descanso, ya que tiene que trabajar continuamente su chacra, para tener una buena producción. Sus principales productos de siembra son: el café y el plátano; los cuales vende al por mayor en la ciudad de La Merced. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene trabajando en sus cultivos, ya que puede disfrutar libremente de sus verdes campos, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden aquejarlas. Para el futuro, desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es una persona muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras, ya que es muy alegre. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Tito, age 32, is a happy and hardworking father. He lives in a rented house with his wife, Blanca, and their 3 beloved children, to whom Tito hopes to provide a better quality of life. Early every morning Tito gets up to work on his farm. For him, there is no such thing as a day of rest since he has to work nonstop on his land to obtain a good harvest. His major crops are coffee and bananas, which he sells wholesale in the city of La Merced. What Tito likes best about his work is the freedom of working on his farm and enjoying the lush scenery. He has farmed for 5 years and thinks the biggest challenge is protecting his crops from pests and diseases. In the future, he hopes to buy more land to expand his farm. This is Tito's 3rd loan with MFP. He has been very timely in paying his loan installments, and expects to continue his good repayment record. In his community bank, Tito is well-liked by his group members since he is a very happy person. With the 9,000 PEN he requests, Tito will buy fertilizer to improve his farm yield.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora pertenece al Banco Comunal Obreras.
Dora es conviviente, tiene 47 años y 4 hijos que estudian, Dora viaja 2 veces por semana a las ferias en donde vende panes, frutas y de las ferias compra cereales que vende en los mercados, además Dora viaja a la selva ayacuchana donde vende frutas de la costa y abarrotes.
Dora necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar y pescado.
Dora sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener un negocio estable en su casa.
texts.en:
Dora pertains to the Communal Bank Obreras. Dora is 47 years old, lives with her partner, and has got 4 children that are studying. Dora travels two times a week to fairs where she sells bread and fruit and where she buys cereal that she then sells in the markets. Also, Dora travels to the Ayacuchana jungle where she sells costal fruits and groceries. She needs a loan of 1000 soles, money that she would invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, and fish. She dreams of her children becoming professionals and having a stable business in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, and fish.

loans.name: Toch

texts.en:
Mrs. Toch P., 50, is a widow with two sons and three daughters. One of them is married, another is a garment factory worker, and the other three attend school. The family lives in a small village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Toch has been selling vegetables in Takhmao market for ten years. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase more vegetables to sell and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to sell and to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
En la Ciudad de Carapeguá  en la Compañía Potrero, uñas señoras de escasos recursos se enteraron del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y decidieron reunirse para recibir una información sobre el mencionado programa. 
Estas Señoras son activas muy trabajadoras y se dedican a las  actividades ya mencionados más arriba. 
Ellas buscando un poco más de apoyo para fomentar a través del crédito sus ingresos familiares y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Necesitan de esta operación crediticia para invertir en sus respectivos trabajos y así poder lograr un crecimiento sostenible que les haga crecer como grupo y en forma individual.
La Sra. Mirtha  es una de las integrantes y se dedica al tejido y confección de ropas artesanales, así también cortinados, mantas, manteles y adornos en tejido de hilos.
Posee buena clientela, gracias a la calidad de sus productos y tiene bastantes pedidos, siendo que son prendas artesanales con variados diseños y son excelentes para regalos y recuerdos de algo muy tradicional del Paraguay.
Desea incrementar sus ingresos mediante la adquisición en cantidad de hilos de variados colores, así como los apliques que se utilizan en las prendas.
texts.en:
In the city of Carapegua, in the Potrero district, a group of poor women met with the program named Enterprising Women (Kiva Field Partner) and they decided to become members to gain more information about the program. This group of women is very active and hard working and they have various kinds of businesses. They are in search of more support to promote the growth of their family income through a loan, to improve their quality of life. They require a loan to invest in their businesses and to achieve the sustainable development of them as a group and each as individuals. Mirtha is one of the members of the group and she knits and makes traditional clothing, as well as drapes, table cloths and decorations. She has a good client base thanks to the quality of her products. She has a good number of orders especially because her items are in various designs and are excellent as gifts and souvenirs. These are very traditional crafts in Paraguay. She wishes to improve her earnings by acquiring large quantities of threads and yarns in various colors, as well as appliqués used in the clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase threads, fabrics, and appliques for traditional clothing.

loans.name: Serafin

texts.en:
Serafin E. is from the village of Poblacion, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. He is 42 years old. Serafin is single. Serafin owns and operates a tailoring business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing general alteration & tailoring services to local community members. Serafin has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2010, Serafin joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to do business. Serafin is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics & materials. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Serafin from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
Ezekiel I. is 40 years old, married to Esther Indesia, and they have one child called Favour Ongotse  who is one year old. They live in the Mahanga area in Vihiga town.

Ezekiel is a tailor and has been in this business for the past two years. He has thus created a huge clientele. He needs to buy textiles for making clothes as he has orders from his clients. His monthly income comes to Kshs 14,000. He has high hopes, knowing that the loan will help him to make his business grow. 

His desire is to employ one person to help him run the business and to see it expand.

loans.use: Buy textiles to add to his stock

loans.name: Khamis

texts.en: Khamis K. is a 32-year-old "boda boda" (motorbike) operator in Changamwe, Mombasa. He is married to Brenda, who supports his income. K. has been in this business for the last four years and has done great. With this second loan from KADET, he would like to add to his cash in hand and purchase another motorbike. He will use the anticipated profit to purchase a third motorbike. In the future, he would like to own a tuk tuk (tri-cycle).

loans.use: add to his savings and purchase a new motorbike

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam C., 30, is married with two young children living at home in Takeo province. She sells wood, typically making 1 USD each day. Her husband, Kat Sal (pictured here), typically makes about 2 USD each day selling coconuts.

Sam C. would like a loan of 600 USD to purchase a motorbike and a trailer to transport coconuts.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike and trailer

loans.name: Emily Jemutai

texts.en:
Emily C. is a 48-year-old widow. She has been blessed with three children, age 22, 16 and 10 years respectively. Emily runs a cereals store at the Emsea trading center in Kabarnet town. Most of her clients are residents of Emsea and nearby villages.

Emily has been in this business for the last eight years. From this business, she gets an average income of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (Kshs) a month. She has borrowed a fourth loan of Kshs 60,000 from Kadet Ltd. to expand her business by purchasing maize worth Kshs 30,000, beans worth Kshs 20,000 and 10,000 Kshs for millet and transportation cost.
 
She anticipates to use her profits to repay the loan, pay her workers and pay fees for her children and save the rest. Her dreams and hopes are to be able to save enough to build rental houses on her plot in Eldoret and be able to start another store in Eldoret.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Moses Mungai

texts.en:
Moses has operated a boutique shop in the town of Naivasha for the last year. He is 34 years and is married to Nancy Gathoni. They are blessed with two school children. 

Moses was introduced to KADET by his friend. This will be his third loan, and he paid his previous loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings in full and in good time. He plans to use the loan boost his stock of clothes in his shop to cater to the high demand during the festive season. In the future, Moses hopes to expand his business and stock clothes and shoes of all fashions.

loans.use: To boost his stock of clothes in his shop to cater to the high demand during the festive season.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Solidaridad Cachimayo” cooperative bank, which is located in the Cachimayo district of the province of Chinceros.

Her name is Victoria, and she is 61 years old.  Victoria is a widow and has nine children (most of them out of university and working).  She is requesting the loan to invest in her food sale business.  She makes breakfast in her home and brings it to construction sites around Cusco to sell. Victoria commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: To invest in a food  business

loans.name: Sabenti Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Sabenti” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are small business owners who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, in order to seek a loan of SLL 800,000 for each person in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Abdul K.. Abdul was born forty-one years ago in Makump, a village in northern Sierra Leone. He is married and has five children. His wife is a businesswoman.  Two of his children are attending primary school, two are in secondary school, and the last is not yet of school-going age. 

Abdul has been selling soaps, batteries, butter, drinks, etc. for the past nine years. With his share of this loan, he will buy the above mentioned items in large quantities to add to his business.

loans.use: To buy soaps, batteries, butter, drinks, etc.to resell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 45 years old.  He is married and has four children.  They live in Kyenjojo, Uganda.  

Joseph has been dealing in grains for the last ten years. He started as a peasant farmer and saved some money which he used to start his business trading maize and beans. Joseph wants a loan to buy beans to resell.

loans.use: To buy beans to resell

loans.name: Nehemiah

texts.en:
Nehemiah, 33, is married and has 4 children whose ages range between 1 and 9 years. Two of the children are currently attending school. Nehemiah is a farmer in Kitale town, western Kenya where he has been farming for five years. He sells his milk, vegetables and tomatoes to the local market.

Nehemiah has requested for a loan of KES 41,600 through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that with the dairy cow he will acquire with this loan, his family will be guaranteed enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. He plans to acquire at least 5 more dairy cows and a motorcycle in the next 5 years.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mey

texts.en:
Mey is a married woman who has three children, two of whom are seamstresses in garment factories, and the other a construction worker.  She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she grows rice.   She sells some of the rice yield and uses the rest for her family.  Her husband is a construction worker. 
Recently. she decided to start a new business.  Mey is asking for a loan to buy a cow.  Her husband is present in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: C 4905 Twumvikane Group

texts.en:
Jean Paul is 34 years old and married. He has two children, aged between 4 and 7 years old. He is the president of the group which is called "TWISUNGANE" in the local language. Jean Paul is the first person on the left side. He owns a business selling foodstuffs such as sugar, rice, salt, etc.  This group contains six members: four women and two men. 

Jean Paul and his group have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding his businesses through purchasing more goods such as: sugar, soap, rice and salt. Through this expansion, Jean Paul will be able to earn more profit, which will allow him to save in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more goods such as: sugar, rice, soap, biscuits, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 24-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and a newborn baby. He has been working in the car mechanics field for the past six years. 

This young man learned every detail related to this business and opened his exhaust and car oil  shop in 2007. He repairs all types of cars. Over the years, he was able to develop his business and expand his operations. He works hard to be able to pay his family expenses. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional car oil and exhaust systems at a good price. He hopes that with the new merchandise, he will meet his business needs and be in frequent demand with his customers. In the future, he hopes to enlarge his shop and add a new service specialized to sell car spare parts.

loans.use: to purchase additional car oil and exhaust systems.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a married woman with 4 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Alma is 41 years old and has one child who is in school.

Alma has a general store business in the Philippines. Alma requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy products and school supplies to sell in her general store.

Alma has been in this business for 2 years.  In the future, Alma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase general store items and school supplies to sell

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is currently in a business of selling bread. She is 40 years old and married with eight children, all of whom go to school. Anna borrowed a loan to stock more bread to sell. She hopes to expand in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more bread to sell.

loans.name: Sinceridad Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Sinceridad inicia su ciclo numero 6 con 16 socias, las cuales se dedican a diferentes negocios como la venta D. abarrotes en general, salón D. belleza, lapidas en piedra D. Huamanga, elaboración D. molidos y venta D. papa seca.
Maximiliana es la presidenta del banco Comunal en el presente ciclo, tiene 62 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos. Maximiliana y su esposo tienen una carpintería donD. elaboran puertas, ventanas, pasamanos, roperos reposteros, etc. Maximiliana solicita un préstamo para invertir en la compra D. madera, está en FINCA Perú desD. hace cuatro ciclos, ingresó por la invitación D. la promotora, le gusta su Banco Comunal porque aprenD. muchas cosas y pueD. ahorrar, pasa momentos gratos con sus compañeras.
Esta ahorrando para que pueda viajar al Argentina, pues ahí se encuentra su hija.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Sinceridad" is starting their 6th loan cycle. There are 16 members and they all have different businesses, including general grocery store, beauty salon, Huamanga gravestones, milling services, and dried potato sales. 

Maximiliana is the president of the communal bank for the current loan cycle. She is 62 years old, married and she has 4 children. Maximiliana and her husband have a carpentry business where they make doors, windows, railings, dressers, hutches, etc. Maximiliana requests a loan to invest in the purchase of wood. She has been with Finca Peru (Kiva Field Partner) for the past four loan cycles. She joined following an invitation by a promoter. She appreciates her communal bank because she learns many things and she is able to save money. She enjoys some pleasant moments with her colleagues.

She is saving money to travel to Argentina to visit her daughter.

loans.use: to purchase wood for her carpentry shop.

loans.name: Sop Serigne Mansour Sy Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Serigne Mansour est créé le 10 mai 2010. Il est composé de 22 femmes qui font les mêmes activités de petit commerce et d'embouche bovine. 


Madame Ngoné la responsable est âgée de 30 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants, elle mène une activité d'embouche ouvine depuis dix ans; elle achète ses moutons au marché central du village et les revend là bas. Elle est debout à droite sur la photo habillée de wax jaune sombre.



Son prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité en achetant plus de moutons et de foin afin de gagner plus de revenus.


Elle souhaite avec les bénéfices réaliser soutenir ses enfants dans leurs divers besoins et gérer le quotidien.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sop Serigne Mansour was created on May 10, 2010. It is comprised of 22 women who have the same occupation working in small-scale commerce and in the fattening of livestock.

Ms. Ngoné, the group's leader, is 30 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She has been running a business fattening sheep for ten years. She purchases her sheep at the central market of the village and resells them there. She is the one standing at the right in the photo and dressed in a deep yellow Wax cloth. 

Her loan will enable her to bolster her business by buying more sheep and fodder in order to earn more income. She would like to use her profits to meet her children's various needs and to manage the day-to-day.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening and then selling

loans.name: Lotolagi

texts.en:
Lotolagi is 54 years of age and married with seven children. Lotolagi owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business. Lotolagi needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 240 talas or US $100 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2005, Lotolagi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Lotolagi's 8th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Santiago Desiderio

texts.es:
Santiago Desiderio tiene 52 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama VRC SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Sibimbe, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta  ventanilla tiene 20socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembran maíz y arroz.

Santiago se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, actividad que la viene realizando por mas de 20 años. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es tener dinero para cuando sea mas viejo y ya se enferme.

Le gusta ir de pesca con la familia.
texts.en:
Santiago Desiderio, 52, is married and lives with his wife and children in the Ventanas Canton in the province of Los Ríos.

This communal bank is called VRC SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE and located in the Sibimbe District which belongs to the Ventanas Canton.  It is comprised of 20 members who are short-cycle corn and rice farmers.

Santiago has been growing corn and rice for over 20 years.  Every month he makes his purchases in Ventanas and sells his produce at the fair in the same town.

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.  With the help of the loan he will be able to buy everything he needs.  His dream is to save enough money for when he is older and starts to have health issues.

He enjoys fishing with his family.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Bertrand Renaud

texts.fr:
Client de 32 ans, marie et père d'un enfant de 6 mois,a la fin de la guerre qu'a connu le Congo, il ouvre une petite alimentation pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Des le matin , il a des recettes de 10.000 a 30.000 fr par jour, ses clients potentiels sont ses voisins et passants de son quartier.

A l'octroi de son pret , il va acheter des  5 cartons de bougies , 5 cartons de conserves,5 cartons de spaguetti, et tous le necessaire dont les clients ont besoin, il s'approvisionne dans les grands dépôts de la place.

Tres entreprenant, il a des stratégies de vente très efficaces , baisser les prix ,récompenser les 5 premiers clients de la journée.
A l'avenir il veut devenir grossiste et construire un grand magasin.
texts.en:
This borrower is 32 years old, married, and the father of a 6-month-old child. At the end of the war in Congo, he opened a small grocery shop to support his family. His revenues average 10,000 to 30,000 francs per day. Potential clients include neighbors and passersby from the area.

He will use this loan to buy 5 boxes of candles, 5 boxes of canned goods, 5 boxes of spaghetti, and anything his customers may need. He buys his merchandise from the main depots of the locality.

He is very enterprising, and has effective sales strategies such as lowering prices, and rewarding the first 5 customers of the day.

In the future, he wants to become a wholesaler and build a large store.

loans.use: to buy boxes of cookies, bags of sugar, boxes of soap, canned goods, powder detergent, etc.

loans.name: Bayarmagnai

texts.en:
Bayarmagnai is 53 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Sansar area of Ulaanbaatar city. His older son, age 24, helps with the family business while his younger son, age 19, works as a welder. 

Bayarmagnai manages a shoe-making business with the help of his wife. He started his business in 2000 and gained much experience. He learned how to make shoes on his own, and then taught his older son. Now he rents a stall with a monthly payment of 40,000 MNT.  Bayarmagnai's working capital has reached 1,500,000 MNT, with daily earnings of 50,000-100,000 MNT. 

He is a polite man who wants to renew his old equipment in order to expand his business. He says, "I'll have the advantage to conduct my business successfully if I can renew my equipment." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase equipment and some materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase equipment and some materials

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 35 years old and married with 4 children, ages 6 to 18. He runs a General Merchandise store in Waterloo near Freetown.

Samuel has been in this business for 10 years and sells drinks, milk and toothpaste at his shop. His business is the main source of income he has. He says that the main challenge to his business is price fluctuations.

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more drinks, milk and provision items. Samuel says that the extra income from this loan will help him improve his standard of living. In the future, he would like to be a supplier to partners.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, milk and provision items.

loans.name: Mkombozi Group

texts.en:
Shazil, who is in his late 20s, is married and has one small child. He has been running a fruit and vegetable business for eight years now. He works from 5:00 AM to 8:00 PM daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his second motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania in the middle of the main loan. It is intended to motivate a borrower with a good credit rating who pays back his or her loan smoothly by allowing him or her to receive half the amount of the existing loan before the original loan term has ended. Shazil used his previous loan to increase his business's stock and has paid back his loan successfully. He wants a loan to increase his fruit stock. His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

Shazil will share this loan with his loan group "Mkombozi," which has a total of nine members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase on fruit stock.

loans.name: Sieng

texts.en:
Sieng, who is 59 years old, sells groceries with her husband at their house in the village.  Their income is $10 per day. She has two children who are 26 and 28 years old.  All of her children have their own careers and can make $10 per day each. 

Every month, Sieng has to spend $80 on food, $10 on electricity, $5 on rental house fees, and $15 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy chicken and chicken feed for her son’s career.

loans.use: To buy chicken and chicken feed for her son's career.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah works hard to support her family. Leah is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Leah requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat and other equipment.

Leah has been in this business for 6 years now and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

In the future Leah would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat and other equipment.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: La cliente,CATALINA, tiene un hijo, es casada, provienen D. familia humilD., la cliente se dedica a la producción D. la leche cruda, actualmente cuenta con 7 cabezas D. ganado lechero en producción, y 3 cabezas D. ganado lechero preñadas. El destino del crédito es para comprar un tanque D. enfriamiento, donD. un grupo D. personas están haciendo ese esfuerzo D. comprar un tanque D. enfriamiento, ya que la producción que sacan les queda muy lejos para ir a entregar, en ese sentido, será D. mayor beneficio para la clienta y sus demás compañeras.   Actualmente la clienta vive en la localidad D. Esquilan Chico que se encuentra en la Provincia D. Quillacollo del Departamento D.  Cochabamba.
