texts.en: Catalina has a son and is married.  She comes from a humble family and her business is producing raw milk.  She currently has 7 head of dairy cattle which are producing milk and 3 head of dairy cattle which are pregnant.  The purpose of her loan is to buy a cooling tank.  There is a group of people who are making this joint effort to buy a cooling tank because the milk they produce must travel a long way to be delivered.  The cooling tank would be of great benefit to our client and her friends.  Our client currently lives in the village of Esquilan Chico which is located in Quillacollo province, in Cochabamba department.

loans.use: to (jointly) buy a milk cooling tank

loans.name: Burulush's Group

texts.en:
Burulush is 59 years old and is married to a farmer. She is the leader of this group. Together with her husband, Burulush has raised two sons and three daughters. Her older son is married and works in Bishkek, her second is in Russia, and her two younger daughters study at university. In order to earn money to meet their daily needs, the family cultivates agricultural products. They started this activity ten years ago with an initial investment of 8,000 KGS and now their monthly profit from selling their harvest is about 3,000 KGS.  

Burulush is requesting a loan to purchase 20 liters of fuel and hire labor for the harvest.  In the future, she hopes to use the profits gained with her loan to purchase cattle for breeding.


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan.
 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and hire farm labor

loans.name: Mirta Beatriz

texts.es:
La Sra. Mirta tiene 25 años de edad, esta acompañada con el Sr. Ruben de 31 años de edad, ellos tienen 1 hija, llamada Elvira de 2 años de edad.
Doña Mirta posee junto con su marido una carpintería en su domicilio, realizan cajones para exportación, se dedica a este rubro hace 5 años, aproximadamente desde el año 2005; comenzó con un capital que obtuvo con la ayuda de sus familiares, ya que en su familia todos se dedican a este rubro. Ella comenta que siempre tiene muchos trabajos con que cumpllir, por ello solicita el crédito para la compra de materia prima, como ser maderas, rollos y así satisfacer los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en: Ms. Mirta is 25 years old and is the partner of Mr. Ruben, 31 years old.  They have 1 daughter, Elvira who is 2 years old.  Ms. Mirta owns, along with her husband, a home carpentry business.  They make boxes for export and have been in this field for 5 years, approximately from 2005.  It started with capital obtained with the help of their families, as her family is engaged in this field.  She says that she always has many jobs which they fulfill and, therefore sought credit for the purchase of raw materials, such as wood, rolls and thus able to meet the orders of their clients.

loans.use: To purchase wood and rolls.

loans.name: Iddi

texts.ru: Идди проживает в районе Варзоб. Он женат. Ему 48 лет. У него четверо детей. Он имеет средне - специальное образование, плотник. Он арендует помещение, где занимается изготовлением деревянных дверей и окон. Этим видом деятельности он занимается шесть лет. Кредит берет для приобретения досок.
texts.en: Iddi lives in the Varzob district.  He is 48 years old, married and has four children.  He has a secondary-specialized education and is a carpenter.  Iddi leases a space, where he makes wood doors and windows.  He has been involved in this business for six years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of wood planks.

loans.use: to purchase wood planks

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Rosenda works hard to support her family. She has a manicure/pedicure business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her sari sari store. Rosenda is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy items for her manicure set such as nail care, polish, etc.

Rosenda has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF, and hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items for her manicure set such as nail care, polish, etc.

loans.name: Has

texts.en:
Has (in the photo) is 46 years old. Her husband, Seng, is 44 years old. They live in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have one daughter who is in school. 

Has sells coffee and Chinese noodles with soup at home in her village. Her husband is assisting his wife in the business. Has is requesting her first loan in the amount of $1,000 USD to put an addition on her house.

loans.use: to put an addition on her house.

loans.name: Sergelen

texts.en:
Sergelen is 37 years old and lives with her husband and three kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. One of her kids is a school student and the other two kids are in college. Sergelen has a meat retailing business that her husband helps with. 

Sergelen started the business in 2001 by renting a counter in the market. Her income has been about the same since she started the business. Because she has many regular customers and trusted suppliers, she rented another counter in the market. She needs more supplies in order to run another counter, therefore she is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to buy them. 

She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "My two kids are in college, therefore I need to act aggressively in order to pay their college fees."

loans.use: To buy meat for her butcher stall.

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr:
Salimata est une femme mariée de 43 ans et mère de 4 enfants qui vit avec son époux et leurs enfants dans  une grande famille traditionnelle à Fama, le centre ville de Sikasso.
Madame Salimata après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès  s’est initiée à la fabrique de savons traditionnels (savons noirs) il y a environ six années, qu’elle a appris auprès d’une voisine. Elle mène son activité dans son domicile conjugal à Sikasso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de 3 ans. Après 5 prêts tous correctement remboursés, elle est à son 6ème prêt individuel. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, 20 futs des déchets d’huile de coton (pâtes noires), 10 sacs de soude caustique et 6 chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe. Après fabrication des savons à base de déchets d’huile de coton et de soude caustique, elle les revend en détail à une clientèle composée généralement de femmes de sa localité..
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 275 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Salimata is a married woman of 43 and a mother of four children. She lives with her husband and their children in a large traditional family in Fama, the downtown area of  Sikasso. 
After having unsuccessfully tried many businesses, Salimata learned how to make traditional soaps (black soaps) approximately six years ago, from a neighbor. She runs her business out of her family home in Sikasso where her products are highly sought after by her clients for their quality. 
To satisfy her ever-growing clientele, she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso three years ago. After successfully reimbursing 5 loans, she is applying for her 6th individual loan. 
With this loan, she will purchase 20 barrels of cottonseed oil (used oil), 10 bags of soda ash and 6 wheelbarrows full of firewood. After making soap from used cottonseed oil and soda ash, she sells them retail to a clientele of mostly local women.
With this loan, she hopes to earn a monthly income of 275 000 XOF, which will be used mainly to grow her business capital, contribute to family expenses, and pay the interest on her loan.

loans.use: to purchase used cottonseed oil and soda ash

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 31 years old and lives in Sapang Ama, Sapang Dalaga Dalaga. She is married with three children.
 
Elvie has a lumber business and earns approximately PHP 15,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase a chainsaw for her business. 

Elvie has been a member of PMPC for five years.

loans.use: To purchase a chainsaw for her lumber business

location.town: Calamba-Sapang Ama Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 33 years old, a single mother of one child.  She has been running a beauty salon for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 10,500 which she uses to cater for her child’s basic needs. 

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member.  Eunice will use the loan to buy a dryer machine and beauty products.  With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her child. 

Her hopes and dreams are to venture into clothes selling.

loans.use: to buy a dryer and beauty products.

loans.name: Chhin

texts.en: Mrs. Chhin, a 32-year-old married mother of three, resides in Prey Chor District where she works hard in her rice field. She has a life partner in her husband, who provides a motor-taxi service to local people. Recently Chhin’s husband has encountered business difficulties due to frequent mechanical problems with his old motorcycle. To solve the problem, Chhin is requesting this loan from HKL to purchase a motorbike to support his business.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to support her husband’s business.

loans.name: Muattara

texts.ru: Муаттара 22 года. Она скромна и вежливая девушка. С Муаттарой приятно общаться, она общительная и отзывчивая. Она живет вместе с родителями в городе Душанбе. Муаттара дома занимается шитьем одежды и берет заказы. Свою профессию она выбрала 2 года назад. За эти 2 года, она смогла научиться хорошо шить. Муаттара уверенная в себе и знает чего хочет. Чтобы развиваться дальше, ей нужно купить более современные швейные принадлежности и стать профи своего дела. Но так у нее нет достаточных средств, она обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en:
Mavzuna is 22 years old and an unpretentious and polite young woman.  It's a pleasure to interact with Mavzuna because she is outgoing and kind.  She lives with her parents in Dushanbe.  Mavzuna works from home making clothes to order.  She chose this profession two years ago and in this time she has learned to sew very well.  Mavzuna believes in herself and knows what she wants.

In order to develop her business further, she needs more modern sewing equipment to become a real professional in her field.  Since she doesn't have the necessary funds, she has applied for a loan.

loans.use: to buy sewing equipment

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en: Shirley is 58 years old, a widow from Calamba, Misamis Occidental with three adult age children. She pushes her abilities to be more productive on her chosen business so that she can provides the needs of her family. She is also an active member of Paglaum MPC where she access financial assistance for her business. Recently, she avails a loan to restock store with consumable goods such as canned goods, noodles, condiments, confectioneries and others.

loans.use: to restock store with consumable goods such as canned goods, noodles, condiments, confectioneries and others

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Responsibility, strenght and proactiveness are the characteristics that define Guadalupe, that is married and is mother of two children, still minors. Her husband holds a casual job, for which the income is never stable in their home. It is for this difficult situation that for Guadalupe started to sell shoes by catalogue, already four years ago, and this way help have a little more income to cover the costs of the education for her little ones. But to be able to meet the strong demands she has during this season, she requires a loan of $250, of which she plans to repay in a term of 3 months.

Her primary concern is to secure the well-being and education of her little ones, it is this why she now needs your support, become part of the successes of Guadalupe and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Responsabilidad, fortaleza y proactividad, son características que definen a Guadalupe, quien es casada y madre de dos hijos aun menores de edad. Su esposo posee un trabajo eventual, por lo que lo ingresos nunca son seguros en su hogar. Es por esta difícil situación por la que Guadalupe, hace ya 4 años comenzó a vender zapatos por catálogo, y así poder tener un poco más de ingresos para poder hacer frente a los gastos de educación de sus pequeños. Pero para poder cubrir el fuerte pedido que tiene en ésta temporada, ella requiere de un préstamo de 250 DLLS, mismos que planea regresar en un plazo de 3 meses.

Su principal preocupación es asegurar el bienestar y educación de sus pequeños, es por ello que ahora necesita de tu ayuda, se parte de los logros Guadalupe y su familia.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Mrs Lien and her husband have 9 children between 22 and 3 years of age. Her husband suffers from schizophrenia, therefore he just assists his wife at home. In addition, Khanh, her son, spent $2250 for his cardiac disease. They have no land so 4 of their eldest children stopped going to school. They were very short of money so Anh, Nhat, Toan, Trang had to work as day laborers to earn money to pay for their father and brother’s treatment.

Although they are poor, Mrs Lien tries to support 4 children to go to school. Mrs Lien sells food every the morning at a small market. Mrs Lien received a loan of $50 with no interest and income increased by $1/person/month. Average income is $9/person/month. She repaid the first loan. Now she asks to borrow $50 for her business.

loans.use: Sells food in the morning at small market

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a 35-year-old is married woman. She has three young children. She lives in the Azucena neighborhood in the city of Coronel Oviedo. She buys food in the Brazilian city of Foz de Yguazú, and then she markets it to businesses in the city of Coronel Oviedo. Among her products we can name chacinados (varieties of sausage), chicken and oil which she delivers to her clients’ premises in a motorcycle.

The loan will be used as capital to buy enough basic products since her clients are quite demanding and they don’t like delays with their orders. The profits will help to support her family and to pay for the schooling of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Virginia es una señora casada con 35 años de edad, y tiene su vivienda en el barrio Azucena de Cnel. Oviedo. Es madre de 3 hijos, todos menores de edad, y se dedica a la compra de artículos comestibles en la ciudad brasileña de Foz de Yguazú, para luego comercializarlos en los negocios de la ciudad de Cnel. Oviedo. Entres sus productos podemos citar los chacinados y pollos en general, ademas de aceites, que los transporta en motocicleta hasta el local de sus clientes. El destino del crédito sería capitalizarse para la compra de sus artículos de primera necesidad, ya que su clientela es exigente y no aceptan demoras en sus pedidos. La utilidad generada será utilizada para subsistencia de la familia y costear el estudio de sus hijos.

loans.use: To purchase goods for her store

loans.name: Esmel

texts.en: Esmel A. is a divorced woman. She is 37 years old and has 4 children. She lives with her children in Yopougon, a township in the north of Abidjan. She sells cassava paste and grilled fish in the Yopougon open market. She provides for her children's education and household expenses from her micro business. She is dynamic and courageous. She wants to expand her activities in food cooking and grilled  meat. She is a good performer and has always reimbursed her loans in good manner.

loans.use: Esmel Adel will use the loan to purchase goods

loans.name: Andrés

texts.es:
Claudia and Andres have form a family out of sacrifice and hard work in agriculture which they have been able to make a profit and saved some money, and now they have a small side business close to downtown Yuracmayo. Claudia spends most of her time and effort into this new venture.

Everything was going fine for this family, but a misfortune happened during their happiest time. One day, while the parents where working, the little one was at home playing and all of the sudden the baby suffered a terrible fall. He suffered trauma to his head, and they had to take him to the local hospital. The little one spent long months at the hospital at the care of his worried mother.

Just when they thought the worst was over and before the little one was completely heal, his older brother started suffering from strange blood evacuations through his ears. The pain and suffering the parents are going through is inexplicable, and they have since fallen into a deep depression. The small amount of money they had saved is not enough to pay for the hospital bills.

They can no longer spend time and money into their side business, and now they must work the fields to make ends meet. Andres has gone back to work the land because this is the only source of income for his family. They are requesting a loan in the amount of $425 to purchase vegetable seeds and to be able to make money and pay for the hospital bills for their two children. Let us reassure Andres that his hard work and dedication is not in vain. Let's help this family get some tranquility.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Claudia y Andrés han formado una familia que a costa de esfuerzo y sacrificio en el desempeño de su actividad agrícola han podido invertir también en la constitución de un pequeño nuevo negocio cerca de la plaza principal de la ciudad de Yuracmayo; al que Claudia le dedica ahora la mayor parte de su tiempo y esfuerzo. Hasta hace poco tiempo las cosas habían transcurrido de manera muy especial para los miembros de esta familia pero el infortunio se hizo presente en el momento de mayor felicidad. Un día de mucho sol mientras los padres desarrollaban sus actividades; el niño menor jugaba muy contento dentro de su hogar y al menor descuido sufrió una terrible caída que le ocasionó graves heridas en la cabeza por lo que tuvieron que internarlo en un nosocomio local por largos meses al cuidado de su preocupada madre. Cuando ya pensaban que había ocurrido lo peor y antes de que la recuperación sea del todo satisfactoria; su hermano mayor empezó a sufrir de extrañas evacuaciones de sangre, a través de los oídos, el dolor y preocupación de los padres por este inexplicable mal los ha sumido en una inmensa depresión y el poco dinero que habían ahorrado no ha sido suficiente para culminar con el tratamiento de su pequeño. El negocio acostumbrado y la nueva pequeña inversión que habían realizado no hace mucho tiempo también se han visto perjudicados a causa de estas circunstancias; en vista de que la necesidad los está apremiando y ya no cuentan con ningún sustento adicional. Andrés a decidido no abandonar sus labores agrícolas porque es la única ayuda con la que cuentan en este momento. Por ello solicita un préstamo por 425 dólares con el propósito de incrementar la siembra de vegetales en sus tierras para distribuirlos por las zonas aledañas a su localidad con el propósito de incrementar sus ganancias y poder continuar con el tratamiento y recuperación de sus dos pequeños hijos.Hagamos que el esfuerzo de Andrés le otorgue tranquilidad a su familia

loans.use: To purchase vegetable seeds

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Mrs. Joy O. has been in the business of selling cooked food and drinks since 2005.  She is 45 years old and married with 2 children.  She lives in Benin City and is currently a LAPO member.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of $325 to enable her buy a deep freezer, which will help her to cool her drinks and preserve her food stuff.  She thanks you.

loans.use: For the purchase of a deep freezer

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Mr. Seng S. and his family live in a small village along the Mekong River about twenty kilometers north of Phnom Penh. Seng (age 45) and his wife (age 47) have three children, one of whom attends school in their village. The two oldest live at home and work in a nearby plywood factory. Seng has been farming for about ten years. He learned with the help of a neighbor. His main crops are two varieties of greens – one similar to mustard greens (see photo), and another that is a type of lettuce. They also have a small grove of banana trees. A local middleman buys their produce and sells it at one of the large markets in Phnom Penh.

Seng and his family are requesting this, their third loan from MAXIMA, to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides for their farm. They are requesting a loan of $100.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides

loans.name: Blanca Nubia

texts.es:
The city of Leon is characterized by its hard-working men and women, amongst whom we can find Mrs. Blanca M.. Mrs. Blanca has been selling hot dogs and sodas for 8 years in a street stand she owns. Everyday, Mrs. Blanca moves the cart from her home to the outskirts of the central market which is far away.

The harsh economic situation she has been through for a long time has taken her to work this difficult business since she does not receive help from anyone being single and having no children to look after.

Since three years ago, she has smartly gone through the loan process 10 times with Ceprodel. She explains that the loans have helped her extraordinarily since she has bought a new cart where she can carry her products, and she has bought a greater quantity of sodas and ingredients with which she prepares her delicious hot dogs.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


La ciudad de León se caracteriza por tener hombres y mujeres muy trabajadores, entre estas personas encontramos a la señora Blanca M. quien desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de hot dog y gaseosas en un carretón propio al que diariamente debe de trasladar desde su casa a las afueras del mercado central que por cierto es un alarga distancia.

La difícil situación económica que ha atravesado por mucho tiempo la ha llevado a que se dedique a este pesado negocio ya que no recibe ayuda de nadie por ser soltera y sin hijos a su cargo.

Muy inteligentemente ha realizado 10 créditos en Ceprodel desde hace Tres años los que comenta que le han beneficiado extraordinariamente ya que ha comprado un nuevo carretón donde portar sus productos, además ha comprado mayores cantidades de gaseosas y los ingredientes para elaborar sus deliciosos hot dog.

loans.use: Purchasing supplies

loans.name: Elí De La Cruz

texts.es:
Eli L. is a gentleman who for six years has had a home business providing grinding services, which he takes great effort to attend to every day, from very early morning hours to late afternoon.

His wife and son are the reason he works day to day, to satisfy all their needs and further to complete his role as responsible father, giving food, sound shelter and education to his young son.

It is important to note that since he began his business, he has searched for a way to acquire new grinders but due to their high cost he has been unable to obtain them. For this reason, today he requested that CEPRODEL allow him to be granted a loan which he will invest in the purchase of the grinders so that he can continue giving his family sustenance every day.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Holmes, Kiva Volunteer

Eli L. es un caballero que desde hace 6 años posee un negocio propio en su hogar de habitación como lo es el servicio de molino que muy esforzadamente atiende todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana hasta el atardecer.

Su esposa e hijo es el motivo por el cual se preocupa día a día por satisfacer todas sus necesidades y además por cumplir su rol de padre responsable brindando alimentación, techo digno y educación a su hijo menor de edad.

Es de importancia señalar que desde que inicio su negocio ha buscado la manera de cómo adquirir nuevos molinos pero por su alto costo no lo ha logrado es por esto que hoy en día acude a CEPRODEL consiente de que será beneficiado con créditos que los invertirá en la compra de los molinos para así continuar brindándole a su familia el sustento de cada día.

loans.use: Purchase of machinery

loans.name: Budumbuli West G A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Rose T.. She is currently in the business of selling motor cycle spare parts and is requesting a loan to increase her capital stock. Rose is 35 years old and is married with a husband who is a mechanic for work. She has 4 children ranging from ages 8 to 19 and her children go to school. Each week, Rose makes approximately UGX 120000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children and cater for the household necessities. Rose has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Rose is joined in her small group by Betty K., Martha K., Mariam N., and Robinah N.. Betty K. has a business selling edibles and wants to put up a kiosk. Martha K. is currently operating a beauty salon business and wants a loan to purchase a hair dryer and a public pay phone. Mariam N. operates a salon business and wants to purchase more salon equipment. Robinah N. is currently in the business of selling vegetables and is requesting a loan to start a business selling matooke.

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts to sell

loans.name: Petrona Ermelinda

texts.es:
For 15 years, in the municipality of Condega, Nicaragua, Mrs. Petrona Calderon has been dedicated to the business of selling natural medicines, which she offers straight from her home, meaning that she maintains a humble home.

It is necessary to note that this woman is single, and for that reason, she has no help from other people to help her subsist, therefore only through her business of natural medicine is she able to progress. Today, she is in immediate need to purchase medicines for her business. For this reason, she is asking for Ceprodel for credit which will allow her to purchase more medicines to commercialize to her loyal clients, and in this way, she will be able to enhance her standard of life, using her own economic resources.

loans.use: compra de medicina natural

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Zainab is very grateful to Kiva for the previous loan of $175. With the loan she increased her stock of peanuts and was able to purchase 15 bags per month. She purchased beds and beddings for her children and was able to pay for their school requirements. Because of the increase in stock, her husband assisted her with the business, and they are working very cooperatively for the family's better future. Zainab has savings, and she is planning for the family to have their own house in the future. Zainab is very thankful to Kiva and is requesting a loan of Le.800,000 to further increase her stock for more income.

loans.use: Zainab would like to increase her stock of peanuts.

loans.name: Senada

texts.en:
Senada is a married woman from the town of Derventa. Her husband earns 300 KM (Bosnian Marks) a month, and she works in agriculture. She has 2 children.

This is her first loan in the amount of 1,200 KM ($950). She will use this loan mainly to buy fertilizer, minerals and nutrients for her soil.

She is growing corn in her field, which she then sells. She would like to sell corn to bakeries to make flour and to farmers to feed their animals.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and nutrients.

loans.name: Djabrayil

texts.en: Djabrayil was born in 1958. He is married and has 3 children The O.'s family lives in Khachmaz town. He has been in the clothing sales business for 3 years. Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy clothes to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en: Elshan (his brother is pictured) is 38 years old, married, and has four children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Agdam in Azerbaijan. He has settled in the Absheron region. The brothers have sold building materials with their truck for nine years. Now Elshan and his brother need a loan of $1,200 to buy spare parts.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
La señora María Elena, tiene 42 años, es madre soltera, estudió enfermería técnica en el Instituto Trujillo, no sacó titulo, posteriormente el instituto desapareció,  después ella viajó a la sierra para trabajar en primeros auxilios, luego vino a Trujillo para cuidar a su hija.  Tiene 01 hija de 15 años, vive en el Distrito de El Porvenir en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad.
Para ayudarse económicamente, empezó hace 04 años a vender comida, papa rellena, después  también vendía productos cosméticos, al mismo tiempo trabajaba en la ciudad de Trujillo en un grifo, pero renunció porque no tenía tiempo para cuidar a su hija. Tiene 03 años trabajando en el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su tía la recomendó en el Banco Comunal “ESPERANZA DEL MAÑANA” ella decidió pertenecer a  este Banco porque era un apoyo más y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 que recibió compró esmaltes, colonias, cremas, gaseosas.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1500.00 que cancelará en 04 meses, tiene pensado invertir este dinero en la compra de fideos, azúcar, verduras, arroz, harina, atún, etc.
La empresaria sueña con tener un minimarket, techar su casa, y ayudar en la educación a su hija.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Elena is a 42 year old, single mother. She studies technical nursing at the Trujillo Institute. She did not receive a title and later the institute disappeared. Later she traveled to the mountains to work in first aid, then came to Trujillo to care for her 15 year old daughter. She lives in the El Porvenir District in the Trujillo Province in the La Libertad Department (like a state). In order to support herself economically she began selling prepared foods, like fried Rellenas (peppers), and cosmetic products. At the same time she worked in Trujillo, but left the job because she did not have enough time to take care of her daughter. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for three years. Her aunt recommended the community bank, "Hope of the Morning," and she decided to become a member because it was another support for her. With her first loan of $100 she purchased, nail polish, colognes, creams, and carbonated drinks. With this loan of $500, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase noodles, sugar, vegetables, rice, flour, tuna, and the like. The businesswoman's dream is to have a minimarket, roof her house, and help her daughter get an education.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of general products.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah A. Hannah is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a trader. She has achieved a junior-high level of education.

Hannah has been selling groceries and fabrics since 2004; she is also a seamstress by profession at Kissi near Elmina. She is responsible for helping her husband pay the children's school fees and their utility bills.

Hannah will use her loan to buy more groceries and fabrics to sell, along with sewing materials and tools for sewing. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy an additional machine for her assistant.

loans.use: To buy more groceries and fabrics to sell, as well as sewing materials and tools for sewing.

loans.name: Enma

texts.es: La señora Enma pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Fernando II”, ubicado en el Jr. Sinchi Roca Nº 132, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 51 años de edad, es madre de 6 hijos mayores de edad, es casada y su esposo se dedica al manejo de un carro, es  chofer. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de ropa. Tiene 4 años trabajando con el banco comunal.n.nEn la actualidad cuenta con la venta de verduras, ropa y zapatos usados. Emma viaja a vender su mercadería a sus clientes, lo cual le brinda ganancias que le permite pagar su préstamo con puntualidad.nnCon este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará una docena de blusas y faldas, 3 docenas de polos, 2 cajas de tomates, 2 cajas de cebolla y 20 pares de zapatos.nnEnma es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que lucha día a día para mejorar su estabilidad económica.nn
texts.en:
Senora Enma is a member of "San Fernando" communal bank located on Jr. Sinchi Roca #132, Callerueda District, Colonel Portillo Province, Ucayali Department. She is 51, married, and the mother of 6 grown children. Her husband is a chauffeur. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos for $100, she decided to invest in clothing sales. She has been working with the communal bank for 4 years now, and she currently sells vegetables and used clothing and shoes. Enma travels to sell her merchandise to her clients, which brings in the earnings to make her loan payments punctually. With this loan of $325, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy a dozen blouses and skirts, 3 dozen polo shirts, 2 boxes of tomatoes, 2 cases of onions, and 20 pairs of shoes. Enma is an enterprising and hard-working woman who keeps on fighting to improve her economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase blouses, skirts, polo shirts, tomatoes, onions, etc.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
La Señora Lorena es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Creativas”, vive en la región San Martín provincia y distrito de Moyabamba. Se dedica a la venta de verduras. Su negocio está ubicado en el mercado central de la ciudad, lugar donde acuden diariamente a comprar sus clientes quienes son los visitantes del mercado.

Con este préstamo de S/.800, el cual será cancelado en 6  meses, comprará abono para la tierra donde siembra, semillas como tomate, lechuga, cebolla china, también comprará verduras como el huacatay, chincho que aún no esté en época de cosecha y atender las exigencias de sus clientes. 

Lorena tiene 38 años de edad, vive con sus 02 hijos que aún están estudiando y su esposo que se dedica a trabajos eventuales sobre todo en construcción. Está agradecida por el apoyo brindado por Manuela Ramos que le permite crecer en su negocio así como también a las demás mujeres trabajadoras.
texts.en:
Lorena is a member of the Community Bank “Mujeres Creativas”. She lives in the San Martín area, province and district of Moyabamba. She sells vegetables. Her business is located at the central market of the city, where the market customers purchase her products every day. With this loan of $275 (800 PEN), which will be paid back in 6 months, she will purchase fertilizer for her land, seeds such as tomato, lettuce, green onions, and other regional vegetables such as huacatay, chincho even though its not planting season, so her customers can find what they need. Lorena is 38 years old. She lives with her 2 children who are still at school and her husband who has a temporary job as a construction worker. Lorena is very grateful for the support she received from Manuela Ramos who has encouraged her to improve her business as she has done with many other working women.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer, seeds and regional vegetables such as huacatay, chincho

loans.name: Fatima Group

texts.en:
I am Fatima and I am 42-years old, a widow, and I reside in a city which famous for its shrines, Pakpattan, Pakistan. My husband left me with four sons. I completely lost my senses when I became widow just after 12 years of marriage. I worked very hard to survive with my children. First I sewed clothes for my neighbors. Than I started making stripes (women use these to tie their hair) and selling them in markets. I collected a good number of customers who love to use my stripes. I found a good institute where my elder son learned electrician skills. Now he is an electrician. The next oldest works in a sweetmeat shop. The others are getting an education in a local school. My stripe-making business is 15-years old. I have successfully repaid my first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now I’m requesting a loan to buy thread for business so I can increase production. 

I am a group leader with 4 other members in my group. Zahida baji and Ayesha baji each request a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Nusrat baji requests a loan to buy beams for her shuttering business. Sana baji requests a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy thread for making stripes

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Lim T., 58, lives in Kampong Chhnang with her husband and her children. Since 1999, she has been selling rice to earn a living and is able to make about $5 (USD) of profit each day. Her husband, Sim Son, is a cow dealer and earns around $8 USD in revenue each day. Two of their daughters are employed in a garment factory. 

Mrs. Lim will purchase rice, take off the husk, and resell the rice to earn a profit. She is confident that this will be a good business venture and sees it as a tool to increase her income and raise her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase rice to sell

loans.name: Khalik

texts.en:
Khalik R. is a 53 year-old married man who lives with his daughters and owns a small farm. Khalik is a teacher of school by profession, but he earns very little so he also runs a business of raising and selling cattle. He has 11 years of experience in this field. Since cattle raising and selling is a profitable business, Khalik has become a very successful businessman. Khalik has a friendly family who always try to help each other. Thus, his wife and daughter help him with the cattle raising business. He works very hard and spends his weekend time with the cattle, cleaning, feeding and pasturing them. Now Khalik wants to expand his business and buy more cattle, so he applied for a loan. He promises to repay the loan on time and thanks all lenders for their support. With your help, Khalik can get ahead.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture and Central Asian traditions. But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle in order to expand the business and to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok O., 48, is married and lives in the Prey Veng province with her husband. She works in a grocery store, making around US$1 daily to support her large family. Her husband is a farmer and earns US$2 every day. He grows rice two times a year. Sok O. would like to take out a loan to purchase more grocery products. She wants to diversify her products so she will have a lot of customers.

loans.use: To diversify her products.

loans.name: Kemi

texts.en:
Kemi sells provisions, drinks, and foodstuffs. She acquired the skill from her mother beginning in childhood, and she now has more experience in selling her provisions and drinks. Kemi has been in the business for the past 20 years. She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 2 years, and she has been able to invest the loans in her business.

Kemi is 42 years old and married, with four children. Kemi lives in Dopemu. She is requesting a loan of N140,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, drinks, and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: Agée de 50 ans, madame M. Julienne est une couturière très habile dans son métier. Avec quatre personnes  à charge, elle n’arrive plus à répondre aux besoins de ces enfants. Ainsi, elle s’est lancée très tôt dans le commerce des denrées alimentaires qui l’aide à assurer sa survie et celle de sa famille. N’ayant pas les moyens de financement, elle sollicité un financement qui lui permettra de relancer son commerce
texts.en:
Julienne M. is fifty years old and is a very skillful seamstress. With four people to support, she is no longer able to properly provide for her children. For this reason she has begun selling perishable food products, a business which ensures the survival of her and her family. As she does not have sufficient finances, she is requesting a loan which will allow her to relaunch her business.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The sale of perishable food products

loans.name: Sanovar

texts.ru: Сановар Каримова 1950 года рождения, замужем  имеет 4 детей. Имеет среднее специальное образование. Торгует на рынке  детской одеждой. На рынке она почти 10 лет. За товаром ездит  2 раза  в месяц. В Истаравшане есть оптовик у которого она закупает товар, в настоящий момент закупила товар на весенний летний период. Кредит получила на  расширение ассортимента.
texts.en:
Sanovar K. was born in 1950; she is married and has 4 children. She has a specialized high school education. Sanovar sells children’s clothing at the market. She has been at the market for almost 10 years. She travels for her products twice a month. In Istaravshan there is a wholesale supplier from whom she purchases products, right now she purchased products for the spring-summer period. She received a loan in order to grow her assortment.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase product assortment

loans.name: Selina's Group

texts.en:
Selina G., 32, currently sells bread and tea and is requesting a loan to open up a bakery. She is married to a businessman and has three children who all go to school at St. Bakhita primary school.  With the extra profits from her loan, Selina hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open up a bakery.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en:
Ernestina A., age 49, is divorced and the mother of two children. Currently, one is in the university and one is a teacher in training. Ernestina is a seamstress. She has been sewing for 25 years now. She specializes in women's clothing and funeral dresses.

Her skills and designs are of the highest class. She sews clothing in styles that give her customers a unique look, creating apparel such as church attire, kaba and slit clothing, children's school uniforms, wedding dresses, and funeral clothes.

Ernestina wants to use this loan to buy increased supplies of sewing materials such as linen, threads, and thimbles, in order to increase her output and efficiency. Thanks to her dedication and hard work, Ernestina has two apprentices, to whom she is providing quality training so that they may develop valuable career skills.

She hopes to increase her savings to provide her university-going child with a quality education. She belongs to the village bank called ‘Emmanuel.’

loans.use: To buy increased supplies of sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc. to increase her output and efficiency.

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: Hem M. was born in 1962 and is a widowed mother blessed with nine children; almost all are employed in different jobs and provide their income to support the family's living expenses. Hem M. currently works as a bricklayer in the brick-field. Because the family's incomes are not enough to contribute to daily expenses, because foods and merchandise are expensive, Hem M. would like a loan of $800 for capital to begin selling sugar cane juice in the community. This will provide her with additional profits to better meet her family's needs.

loans.use: To begin selling sugar cane juice in the community

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes es socia del Banco Comunal Compartir, vive en la comunidad de San Martín de Paraíso.
Lourdes es conviviente, tiene 28 años, Lourdes tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo.
Lourdes necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite.
Los sueños de Lourdes son mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Lourdes is a member of the Sharing Community Bank. She lives in the community of San Martín de Paraíso. Lourdes is married and is 28 years old. Lourdes has a store in her house, where she sells general groceries with the help of her husband. Lourdes needs a loan for 2000 soles, which will be invested to buy rice, sugar, and oil. Her dreams are to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Mila Angelica

texts.en:
Mila is 33 years old. She is married and has three children. Mila sells juice and cooked food. Her husband works as a motorcycle taxi driver.

Mila has been working with Manuela Ramos, a Kiva field partner  for 1.5 years and is a member of the "Las Doncellas" communal bank. She plans to use this loan of 1200 soles to purchase spare parts for the motorcycle taxi that her husband drives, and also to purchase fruit and other necessities for her juice business.

With her loans from Manuela Ramos Mila, has been growing her own business as well as helping her husband with his work. Mila has been able to purchase two motorcycle taxis with her loans. Eventually, Mila would like to generate more income by running a small grocery shop out of her home. She hopes to continue helping her husband and children.

loans.use: Spare parts for a motorcycle taxi; fruits and other ingredients for making juice

loans.name: Nancy Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres progresivas”, ubicado en la el distrito de Asillo, provincia de Azangaro, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 40 años de edad, es conviviente y es madre de 02 hijos, ella estudió educación primaria completa.  Vive en la comunidad Casa Blanca.


La señora Nancy es socia nueva, ella requiere un primer préstamo es de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvirá para comprar ganado menor (ovinos).  Esta actividad la realiza solo una vez a la semana en las ferias regionales.

Su deseo es comprarse una casa en Juliaca.

A ella le gustan y las reuniones entre Bancos Comunales.
texts.en:
Sra. Nancy is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Progresivas” (Progressive Women), which is located in the District of Asillo, Azangaro Province, Department of Puno. She is 40 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 2 children. She completed her elementary school education and lives in the community of Casa Blanca. Sra. Nancy is a new member and is requesting her first of loan of 500 soles to buy small livestock (sheep). She conducts her business once a week when she travels to the regional fairs. She hopes to buy a house in Juliaca. Sra. Nancy enjoys her Communal Bank meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep for fattening

loans.name: Raquel De Los Angeles

texts.es: La señora Raquel de los Ángeles R. , tiene la edad de 39 años , habita en el barrio Los Ríos , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposo , el cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen tres hijos , los cuales estudian actualmente estudian y le apoyan con las actividades agrícolas en sus tiempos libres , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , doña Raquel desde hace 26 años se dedica a la agricultura  ella inicio está actividad con el apoyo de su mamá ya que ha sido su medio de vivir y de salir adelante pues trabajar la tierra es difícil por que se necesitan muchos recursos el cual abecés no los tiene es por eso opta por el financiamiento y poder mejorar la siembra con los químicos que requiere, los planes futuros hacia el cultivo es diversificarlo con la solicitud de préstamo comprara los materiales y químicos necesarios para obtener mejores resultado en sus cultivo.

loans.use: Comprar abonos para mejorar la siembra

loans.name: Rudy

texts.en: Rudy S. is from the village of P-1, Barangay 25, Pandan, Gingoog City. He is 44 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Rudy owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Rudy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support his children’s education. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Barangay 25, Pandan, Gingoog City, Mis. Or.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La sra. Anita es una cliente antigua de la institución, es muy responsable y cancela sus cuotas puntualmente, ella tiene su bazar-librería además de una fotocopiadora, su tienda está ubicada cerca de un colegio, ubicado en la zona de Pampahasi, lleva ya ocho años en esta actividad, su esposo es especialista en gerontología, trabaja en dos institutos donde enseña esta profesión, además de tener pacientes particulares, sus dos niños están en el colegio. El crédito será invertido en la compra de mercadería para navidad y comprará paquetes de hojas bond para la fotocopiadora.
texts.en:
Mrs. Anita is a long time client of the institution. She is very responsible and pays her quotas on time. She has a marketplace bookstore and a photocopier. Her store is located near a school, in the Pampahasi zone. She has almost 8 years of experience and her husband is a specialist in gerontology. He works in two institutes were he teaches this profession and has private patients. Anita’s two children are currently in school. The loan will be used to buy Christmas merchandise and buy filler paper packets for the photocopier.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Christmas merchandize and filler paper packets.

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van M. is from the village of Southwestern Poblacion, Calamba Misamis Occidental. He is 39 years old. Van is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Van owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling of dried goods in the local community Van has been engaged in his business for more than 10 years. In 2007, Van joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.Van is requesting a new loan of 20,000.00 PHP which will be used to purchase additional capital of his existing business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Van from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family.
 About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital of his existing business

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es:
Milagros tiene 26 años, es soltera, vive en casa de una tía, con ella y sus primos. Desde hace 2 años cuenta con pequeño puesto en el mercado donde vende ropa variada. Allí atiende durante todo el día y de lunes a domingo.
Lo que más le gusta a Milagros de su trabajo es dar una buena atención a sus clientes, ella trata de perfeccionar su habilidad como negociante cada vez más, pues sabe que vender roda es un negocio muy rentable, además que su puesto en el mercado tiene una buena ubicación.
Su deseo a futuro es tener una tienda de ropa donde pueda vender con mayor tranquilidad y sea más cómodo para sus clientes.

Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de su grupo es que todos los integrantes son personas muy responsables y puntuales en sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más ropa y de esa manera seguir incrementando su negocio.
texts.en:
Milagros is 26, single, and lives at the home of an aunt and her cousins. For the last two years she has had a small stall in a market where she sells a variety of clothing. She works there all day Mondays through Sundays. What Milagros likes most about her work is to give good service to her customers. She tries to greatly improve her skill as a salesperson every day since she knows that to sell clothing is a good business. Besides her stall has a good location in the market. Her dream for the future is to have a clothing store where she can sell clothes to her customers in a calmer and more comfortable setting. This is her 4th loan with MFP and what she likes about the group is that all the participants are very responsible and punctual about their payments. The money that she is requesting will be used to buy more clothing and thus increase her business. .

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Kisa Kya Mukama Group, Mityana

texts.en: B. Teddy is the leader of her lending group in Mityana. She is a hardworking and devoted lady with a poultry farm business that she has been running in Wabigalo for 1 year. She is also a teacher by profession, hence being able to have a double income every month. Since her poultry business is still small, she is able to get 20,000/= as profits and she hopes for this to increase. She keeps mostly egg laying chickens and she would like to begin raising broilers to expand her business. Teddy is a married woman with 3 children aged 5, 3 and 2 years and she takes care of 1 additional dependent. She is a friendly lady and she needs a loan to help buy more chickens for expansion.

loans.use: Buying more chickens for farm expansion

loans.name: Galbaatar

texts.en:
B. Galbaatar is 49 years old, and lives with his wife and two children in Gobi-Altai province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a traditional Mongolian housing tent, which is called a "ger." Both of his children (a son and a daughter) attend university.

To earn a living, Galbaatar, with his wife's help, operates a firewood and coal-trading business in his town. They use their own truck to transport the coal and firewood, and they rent a small stall from which they sell their products. Galbaatar started his business in 2004 with a loan of 500,000 MNT (~$350) from Xacbank, Kiva's Mongolian MFI partner. Over the years, his business has been quite successful, and he has proven himself to be a trustworthy borrower. Galbaatar is focused on the future; in particular, he hopes to generate additional income so that he can pay for his children's tuition. He is now requesting a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 MNT (~$2,750) to purchase another truck to use for his business.

About XacBank: XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first Kiva loan in January 2009. It is the largest micro-finance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale, and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers in the form of a savings account upon the maturity of their loans. By doing so, XacBank not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia. And to lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here:http://www.kiva.org/app.phppage=businesses&queryString=Mongolia&status=fundRaising&gender=All§ors[]=All®ions[]=All&sortBy=Expiring+Soon.

loans.use: To expand his business by purchasing another truck

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita B. is from the village of San Manuel. She is 63 years old. Nenita is married and has six grown children. To make a living, Nenita owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling balot and other delicacies in the local community. Nenita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

Nenita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nenita is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Quinter Aluoch

texts.en:
Quinter Aluoch O. is married and is the mother of one child. She owns a tailoring business which she has run for three years and which is a result of the training she received at one of the tailoring institutes in Kenya. It was a way of raising school fees for the two orphans she is the guardian of.

Quinter Aluoch would like a loan of Kshs 20,000 which will go to obtaining more sewing machines and expanding her business premises.

loans.use: To buy more sewing machines to expand her tailoring business

loans.name: Kov

texts.en: Mrs. Kov M. is a widow and she lives in Popeal Khae village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns one-hectare field to cultivate rice. She faces an obstacle because her field is not very fertile and she can't grow much, so she does not enough money to support herself or her family well.  Thus, Mrs. Kov M. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, and would use the rest of the loan to buy pesticide to use on her rice field. Mrs. Kov M. is a mother of two children, one of whom is employed in the public sector and the other is employed in an organization.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for a small rice farm.

loans.name: Rasim

texts.en:
Rasim H. is married with three children and he has always been a hard-working man who has made sure, from a young age, that his family never goes without their daily bread.

Rasim has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuffs. With a small starting capital, thanks to his perseverance and dedication, he began this enterprise eleven years ago. Over time he expanded his business and today his business has become domestic as his family is also engaged in it.

Today, Rasim needs to buy additional foodstuffs to increase the range of his goods. For this purpose he is requesting a loan of 1,600 AZN. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.

We believe Rasim’s perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to increase his range of goods

loans.name: Put

texts.en: K. Put is 38 years old and lives with her husband in the Siem Reap province. Since 2005, she has been selling fish in her village and is able to make about US$3.50 per day. Her husband, pictured here, is a farmer and has a business buying rice from individual growers and reselling it to market wholesalers. K. Put is asking for a loan of US$700 to purchase cows.

loans.use: to purchase cows

loans.name: Nora Bertha

texts.es:
La señora Nora Bertha D.,  esta nuevamente esta solicitando su cooperación para este crédito ya que desea tener a la venta aparatos eléctricos, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión que quiere realizar a su negocio. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias de las ventas del negocio, ya que tiene a su responsabilidad a dos hijos y quiere darles lo mejor y que no les falte nada.
Nora está muy agradecida  por su cooperación ya que su negocio ha tenido muy buenas ventas
texts.en:
Miss Nora Bertha D. is again asking for your cooperation for this loan since she desires to sell electronic appliances, but she does not have the necessary money for the investment that she wants to make in her business. She plans to pay back the loan with part of her earnings from the business’s sales, since she is responsible for two children and she wants to give them the best so that they don’t lack anything. Nora is very grateful for your cooperation since her business has had very good sales.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchas of merchandise (electronic appliances)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: Samir is a 37-year-old married man and the father of two children. He has been working as a home painter. He works on a freelance basis, upon the request of the clients. He works hard to satisfy the demands of his job in order to pay his daily expenses and provide a better life for his family. His previous loans allowed him to purchase new and better tools to improve his work. For the third time, he is requesting a loan to purchase paint tools. For the future, he plans to keep on improving his work, as well as his financial situation.

loans.use: To purchase new and better tools

loans.name: Maricel's Group

texts.en:
Maricel P. is from the village of Tru-Cut Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old. Maricel is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Tundan 1.

Maricel is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Maricel owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fruit products like watermelon, mangoes, bananas, rambutan, etc. in the local community. Maricel has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Maricel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maricel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Maricel is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Maricel from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en:
Nazia, a resident of Borewala (famous for its shrines), Pakistan, is the wife of N.. She owns a small house of two rooms and has been living in it with her family for the past 20 years. 

A very caring and talented lady, Nazia manages the domestic chores and prepares food for her family, then she goes to the grocery shop of her husband and helps him by dealing with the customers. They are in this way helping each other in order to generate good income.
  
They have four children, three sons and one daughter. All of them are enrolled in school except the younger son, who is not of school-going age yet. 
 
Nazia is applying for a loan from Asasah, a Kiva partner, to invest the capital in their grocery shop so they can purchase groceries in bulk, maintain their customers and generate a good profit.

loans.use: Purchase groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase hair treatments and conditioners for her salon

loans.name: Voeung

texts.en:
Voeung S., 38, is a single man living with his older mother in a wooden house located in a commune of Kompong Tom Province. His mother is a widowed woman who appears in the photo. She earns a living by selling various cakes and desserts to her neighbors. 

Voeung S. has learned a skill of turning gold block into jewelry. He is called a goldsmith, and he currently uses his knowledge to generate a daily income. Voeung S. always faces difficulty traveling to his workplace or anywhere else, because he has no vehicle for his riding needs. Thus, he would like to ask for a loan from Kiva’s field partner, HKL, to be used to buy a second-hand motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a second-hand motorcycle.

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita G. is a 63-year-old married woman who supports her family by her pig-fattening business. She lives in Barangay Binaliw, Danao City, Cebu City with her 62-year-old husband, Wilfredo, who is a foreman, and their five children who are between 26 and 43 years old.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her pig-fattening business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of $330 a month.

Isabelita is now borrowing 10,000 PHP to use as additional working capital for her business. This will be her 8th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 20,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Isabelita aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Kwezimba Bugalya, Mubende Group

texts.en:
With hard work and high self esteem traits, M. Joshua (aged 52 years) has tried beyond any limits to maintain his general merchandise retail shop. He has been operating his shop for over 10 years from Bugalya trading centre, after abandoning his former farming enterprise. Being one of the most active businesses here in Uganda, many business entrepreneurs have tried to invest in general merchandise retail shops as they normally cut across all domestic appliances. Joshua is among the lucky ones benefitting from operating this type of store. 

With this loan, he hopes to be able to purchase more stock for his business, as his drawback has been in having little capital input. He also hopes to be in a position to transform the business into a wholesale one to improve his income. This will make him live up to his goals of educating his children and building a home for himself. 

He belongs to a group with other members who insure and hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of home products especially utensils for resale

loans.name: Daylinda

texts.en:
Daylinda G. is from the city of Prenza Tangub City. She is 51 years old. Daylinda is widowed and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Daylinda owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motor transport "habal-habal" services. Daylinda has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Daylinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Daylinda has successfully repaid a previous loan 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Daylinda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to repair her existing vehicle to provide better service. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Daylinda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle to provide better service.

loans.name: Vicenta Del Socorro

texts.es: Vicenta del Socorro es mujer casada, tiene 60 años su actividad es una pequeña pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, en la cual vende granos básicos y otros artículos. Por lo que siempre ha disfruta de obtener financiamientos que son necesarios para el desarrollo de su negocio. Siempre está pensando en la forma de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. La inversión con este crédito será para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, detergentes, leche y otros productos. Siempre sueña con obtener otro negocio para diversificar su experiencia.
texts.en:
Vicenta del Socorro is a married woman who is 60 years of age. She has a small store located in her home from which she sells basic grains and other products. As always, Vicenta enjoys obtaining loans which she needs to develop her business because she believes they will help improve her family’s quality of life.

This loan will be invested in the purchase of basic grains, candies, detergents, milk, and other products. She always dreams of starting another business so that she can diversify her experience.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, candies, detergents, milk, and other products

loans.name: Meena's Group

texts.en:
Meena lives in a small, historic city in Pakistan called Pakpattan. She is 40 years old and has given birth to two daughters. Both of them are illiterate as she couldn’t afford to educate them. They are still very young and it is Meena’s desire to enroll them in school.

Meena supports her family by selling shawls (worn over the shoulders, upper body and arms). She purchases the shawls from Faisalabad, a city which is famous for its textile industry, and sells them in her own city at a profit.

Meena’s husband operates a business selling wheat and rice. He buys his stock wholesale and sells it to his clients for a profit. He has been doing this business for past ten years. Meena has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy wheat and rice in large quantity.

Meena is confident that her husband has a great sense of business and he will be able to improve his business by making this investment in it. She does hope that, with the increased income, she will be able to send her daughters to school soon. She is a new loan applicant. She is expecting that this loan will be a good and profitable experience for her family.

In the photo, Meena is the lady who has her hand raised.

loans.use: To enable her husband to purchase more wheat and rice to sell

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José de 62 años, vive en una zona urbana llamada “Suburbio” caracterizada porque la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales. Es zapatero en su propio taller de calzado. 

Aprendió hacer zapatos con la ayuda de su papa desde muy joven, hasta que tubo su familia y pudo comprar maquinas para hacer su propio taller de calzados, poco a poco con esfuerzo a podido distribuir zapatos en distintos almacenes. Trabaja desde muy temprano haciendo sandalias, zapatos casuales y reparándolos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar materiales para hacer mas zapatos como pegamento, correas etc. En el futuro quiere que las sandalias que hace lleguen a ser conocidas y comercializadas por todo el país.
texts.en:
José is 62 years old and lives in an urban area called Suburbio, which is characterized by the fact the majority of the people living there are informal merchants. He is a shoemaker and has his own shoe workshop.

He learned to make shoes as a child with the help of his father and when he had his family, he was able to purchase machines to create his own shoe workshop. With effort, little by little, he has distributed shoes to different stores. He starts work very early making sandals and casual shoes, as well as repairing shoes.

With this loan he wants to purchase shoemaking materials such as glue, straps, etc. In the future he would like for his sandals to become known and sold throughout the country.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Shoe straps and glue

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Jeniffer Jebotip

texts.en:
Jeniffer Jebotip A. is 38 years old, married to Musa A. who is a farmer, and this is a source of additional income for the family. They have two children, aged six years and four years old. Their residential place is in Ngenyilen Eldoret-Kenya. She sells milk and has been in this business for the past six years with a monthly profit of Kshs.12,000.
