Jeniffer learnt about KADET LTD through marketing awareness done in the area and so she is applying for her second loan of Ksh. 40,000 from KADET LTD, which she intends to use to buy a cow. With the anticipated profits, she plans to expand into the agriculture sector.

In future Jeniffer wishes to expand her business and support her family. Her deeper desire is to see her children realizing their goals in life through better education.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret J. is currently in the business of selling green vegetables at the market, and is requesting a loan to stock fish to sell. She is 30 years old and married. Her husband is a government staff member. She has no children yet. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

loans.use: To stock fish to sell

loans.name: Sarorng's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarorng C. is the group leader who is 25 years old and has been selected by five members who will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their family living. The members are all from the Trapeang Thlan village in the Takeo province. 

She is a beef and fish seller in the local village where she is able to earn large profits to support her family. She is also a farmer who owns a plot of land more than one hectacre to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Sam Art Im, is a construction worker. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand. So to improve production, Mrs. Sarorng C. is asking for a loan to buy more beef to sell. She is a mother of two children whom all are too small to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more beef to sell

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.fr:
Il a une cabine qui a très bien marche , car ses revenus journaliers étaient de 35000f par jour, son objectif était après le premier prêt vendre les cartes prépayées en gros et il devait aussi multiplier ses point de ventes, il a débuté cet activité et commence à récolté quelques fruits

Le deuxième prêt  sera là pour continuer ce qu’il a débuté, en achetant les cartes de tous les réseaux téléphoniques de la ville comme MTN, AIRTEL,WARID..
Il compte aussi s'abonner a Congo Telecom pour avoir une ligne directe pour communication a bas prix.

Il est père d’une fille unique et veut s’investir dans son éducation en l’envoyant dans une école de métiers (coupe et couture).
Il pense aussi construire une maison dans sa parcelle pour sa future progéniture.
texts.en:
Jean Claude M. M. has a phone booth which is making money, as his daily profits have been 35,000 francs a day. With his first loan, his goal was to sell prepaid phone cards wholesale, and also increase the number of his retail outlets. He has started this business and is beginning to see some fruits of his labor.

The second loan will be used to continue what he has begun, by buying cards from all of the city's networks, such as MTN, Airtel, Warid, etc. He also plans to get an account with Congo Telecom in order to have a direct line for low-priced communication.

He is the father of one daughter and would like to invest in her education by sending her to a vocational school (to study tailoring/dressmaking). He also plans to build a house on his land for his future offspring.

loans.use: Telephone booth and sale of phone recharge cards

loans.name: Gulnara's Group

texts.en:
The average Kyrgyz family has three children.  Since old times, Kyrgyz  families tended to have six or seven children. The reason for that is the strong family ties and sense of family identity of a Kyrgyz family.  And, they simply just love children. Urban families now usually stop at a third or fourth child, but rural families still follow the old Kyrgyz culture and like having big and friendly families. 


Gulnara I. is the treasurer of this group.  She is a forty-seven-year-old resident of Kochkor, a small town in northern Kyrgyzstan.  She has a big asset:  six children. The youngest child is now a senior in high school. Gulnara proudly claims that raising six children was her greatest accomplishment. She feels fulfilled in helping them find their own place in life. 

Gulnara and her husband are skilled farmers. They say land is always the only source of income and they cannot imagine life without farming, because it’s what they have been doing their entire lives. Along with farming, the family raises and sells cattle. The family started the business fifteen years ago with only 10,000 soms. Now they have 10,000 in monthly profit.   But because of inflation, this amount is not enough to purchase additional cattle and to advance the business. Gulnara hopes to get a loan in order to promote her business. Time will show if she will be able to build the house of her dreams. 


  --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Maudiel Marina

texts.es: Maudiel Marina tiene 26 años y un hijo a su cargo. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos para su negocio.  Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a esta actividad económica como es la venta de carne, por lo que sus inicios se dan por la necesidad de proporcionar a su familia el alimento diario, pues no tenía mucho apoyo de sus familiares. A pesar de las situaciones que enfrento ella ha salido adelante  con su actividad. Este financiamiento es para la compra de una gran variedad de carnes debido a esta época festiva que son muy solicitados por sus clientes.
texts.en: Maudiel Marina is 26 years old and has one child in her care.  This is not the first time that she has taken out loans for her business.  She has been in her business, selling meat, for more than 8 years.  She started her business because she needed to put food on the table for her family as she didn't have much support from her family members.  In spite of the difficulties that she faced, she has managed to get ahead in her business.  This loan will be used to buy a large variety of meat since she has a lot of demand from her customers during the festive season.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a member of Kibera Upendo group in Faulu Kenya. He makes beads using animal bones which are a raw material for making necklaces, bangles and earrings.  In his business, he has two employees.  It’s been ten years since he started the business and has seen a lot of growth.  He hopes to open other outlets for his business in the future.  He has requested for 25,000 Kes to buy bones.

loans.use: To buy bones

loans.name: Nver

texts.en:
Nver P. was born in 1951. He lives in Geghamavan village, Sevan area, with his wife. Nver's two sons are already married and they live separately from their parents. 

Nver and his wife are both teachers. Now Nver's wife is teaching English at Geghamavan village school. For about 18 years Nver taught Armenian in different schools and now he continues with his work at his village's school. 

At the same time Nver and his wife are engaging in farming: they have land, where they raise cows, sheep, pigs and cultivate potato plant as well. 
Nver is Nor Horizon's 4th cycle borrower and now he is asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy potato seedling.

loans.use: To buy potato seedling

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 54 years old, married and supports her family by operating three business ventures: a ticketing outlet, an internet café and broadcasting. She lives in Escalante, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 30,000. Helen is borrowing PHP 29,500 to fund operations. This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 23,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Helen aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: Taing

texts.en:
Mrs. Taing was born in 1964.  She is married to Mr. Heang.  This couple supports four children, three of whom are seamstresses in garment factories, and one is a student. She is a duck eggs seller who is able to earn some profit to support her family.   Her husband is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land where he grows rice on some parts of the field to sell, and on other parts to feed his family. 

Although they try to work hard, they can earn only a small income. So to improve income, Mrs. Taing is asking for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business. Her husband is present the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Esmilce Jamileth

texts.es:
La Doctora Esmilce Jamileth  de 31 años de edad, su compañero de vida lo ayuda con el pago de las cuotas ya que son bien unido y aun no tienen hijos por lo tanto solamente sus gastos personales y los gastos de sus estudios, ella trabaja como medico general del Minsa desde hace 4 años, actualmente esta estudiando una maestria , ella es una joven que ha luchado por culminar sus estudios universitarios, muy responsable y bien querida, proviene de una familia humilde pero con comodidades que han mejorado atravez del tiempo con creditos.  

Solicita su cuarto crèdito para realizarle un anexo a su vivienda ya que es muy pequeña, esta agradecida con Kiva ya que gracias al credito anterior pudo poner piso y reppelar su habitacion.  

Su mayor sueño es acondicionar su vivienda y mejorarla que no le falte el trabajo para el sustento del pan de cada dia.
texts.en:
Dr. Esmilce Jamileth is 31 years old and lives with her partner who helps her cover expenses.  They have no children yet and only have personal expenses and education costs.  She has worked for four years as a general doctor at Minsa and is currently studying to be a teacher.  She struggled to complete her college education and is very responsible and well-loved.  She comes from a modest family but has been able to improve her lifestyle thanks to loans.

She is requesting her fourth loan to pay for house expansion since her house is very small.  She is grateful to Kiva for the previous loan that helped her put in flooring and plaster.

Her dream is to make home improvements and continue working to put food on the table every day.

loans.use: To pay for house expansion

loans.name: Youth Development Association Group

texts.en:
Kimeze W., 28, is a hard working businessman who has been operating his butcher shop for three years now in Kasanda-Mityana. 

Kimeze was still farming at the threshold of 2008. Earnings from his farming business enabled him to establish himself in this butcher business. He dispensed with the farming business the moment he realized that he could make more profit from his butcher shop.

Weekly this business generates him 150,000 UGX as profit. With this loan, Kimeze, who is still single, says he is going to open new horizons for his business in terms of expansion and the purchase of more meat to resell.

loans.use: to expand his butcher shop and purchase more meat to resell

loans.name: Shakeela's Group

texts.en:
Shakeela comes from to Faisalabad which is located in Punjab, Pakistan and known for its textile industry. She has been living there with her family in the area of Madina Town in a 2-room brick house for the past six years. She is a working woman and does sewing work for her neighboring clients to share the financial burden with her husband. She has got that skill from her mother before marriage and it earns her good profits. 

She is also a very good housewife and manages her household responsibilities very well. She has given birth to three daughters. Two of them are studying while her youngest daughter is only six years old and has not started her education yet. 

Her husband’s name is A. M. and he operates a schoolbag-stitching business. He receives orders from different factories and fulfills their orders to earn income for the family. 

Shakeela has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to financially assist her husband’s business. Using the loan, he will buy a new machine for school-bag stitching. His current machine has become rough and needs replacement which is affecting his business. 

Shakeela is hopeful that her husband’s business will get well established after the loan investment and he will be able to provide his family better living facilities. She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application with Asasah.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Shakeela.

loans.use: To buy a new machine for schoolbag-stitching business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 35-year-old married woman from Lebanon living with her husband and one young child. She started her own business in 2004. She bought a big generator to provide electricity to her town. She has chosen this type of business after seeing a need for such services in the region. Over the years, her business operation was exceeding. And she has found an opportunity to expand her business into other areas. This woman works hard in cooperation with her husband who works as an electrician to satisfy the family needs. Today, she is requesting to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy new tools and supplies in order to fulfill her project and expand her work. This will be her third Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy new tools and supplies

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is 29 years old; she has two children who are nine and six. They are both in school. Nadia's husband is a driver. 

Nadia owns a general store in which she sells spices, candles, matches, soap and some foodstuffs such as Irish potatoes and sugar; she has had this business for two years. It has allowed her to pay school fees for her children and feed her family as well. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more foodstuffs and make more profits. With the profits she plans to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy food items for her general store

loans.name: Niza Esther

texts.es: Niza desde hace más de 20 años aprendió a ser comerciante porque acompañaba a su madre a que desempeñara esta actividad y aunque nunca pensó vivir de ella, decidió acudir a esta experiencia cuando su cónyuge quedó sin empleo y necesitaban generar ingresos para los gastos del hogar, en el cual existen 3 hijos en las edades de 9, 20 y 15 años. Así que ahora Niza trabaja en su propio negocio de vender ropa, cosméticos, colonias y  toda mercancía que encarguen sus clientes. Ella vende a crédito  a amas de casa, trabajadores independientes, empleados que permanentemente le refieren nuevos y buenos clientes; su mayor desafío es hacer que le alcance su capital de trabajo para poder responder oportunamente a sus clientes y esta es la razón por la cual  se acercó a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para solicitar un crédito; el credikiva es el primer financiamiento y lo aprovechará para responderle a sus clientes, que han solicitado ropa, calzado, colonias ye general mercancía masculina, pues se acerca el día del padre y cada familia quiere halagar a su progenitor haciéndole un regalo. En la actualidad sus hijos estudian y su hijo mayor está en la Universidad y sueña con que él, logre alcanzar su objetivo de ser un comunicador social prestigioso y que sus otros dos hijos también, puedan acceder a una educación de calidad. Mientras Niza construye su sueño, continua trabajando persistentemente para aumentar su capital, generando una rentabilidad no menor del 25 % la que planea incrementar, dirigiendo todos sus esfuerzos hacia ello, porque está entusiasmada y dispuesta a alcanzar sus metas personales y familiares con tal de sentirse feliz con su esposo y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Niza learned how to be a merchant over 20 years ago when she would accompany her mother who was also in this kind of business even though she never thought she’d support herself by it.  She decided to call on it when her spouse lost his job and they needed to generate income to cover household expenses where there were three children whose ages were 9, 20 and 15.  

So now, Niza works in her own business selling clothes, cosmetics, colognes and all sorts of merchandise that her customers order from her.  She sells on credit to housewives, independent workers and employees who permanently refer new and good clients to her.  Her greatest challenge is stretching her capital  to be able to respond in an opportune way to her customers.  This is why she approached Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to request a loan.

The Kiva loan will be her first loan and she’ll use it to respond to her customers that have requested clothes, shoes, colognes and general merchandise for men because Father’s Day is approaching and every family wants to flatter their father by giving him a gift.

Currently her children are studying.  Her oldest son is in the university and she dreams with him that he’ll reach his objective of becoming a prestigious social communicator and that her other two children also will be able to access a quality education.

While Niza builds her dream she continues to work persistently to increase her capital generating a profit margin of no less than 25% which she means to increase aiming all her efforts toward this end.  She is excited and willing to reach her personal and family goals in order to be happy with her husband and children.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, colognes and general merchandise for men.

loans.name: Koeun

texts.en:
Koeun is a 23-year-old man who makes a daily income by running a motor taxi in Siem Reap Province. From this occupation, he can earn around US $3 each day. His wife manages household work and plants a few vegetables to generate some additional income. 

Koeun is worried about his old motorbike, which needs to be fixed very often. For this reason, he has applied for a loan to buy a new motorcycle to replace the broken one. He will use a few parts of his loan to plant vegetable crops.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle to replace the broken one.

loans.name: Yeimi

texts.es: Yeimi de 25 años es una joven que decidió generar ingresos para pagar sus estudios  a través de una idea emprendedora  con la que ha logrado obtenerlos mediante la disciplina y persistencia en esta actividad. Ella vende productos mediante guías especializadas de negocios como cosméticos lociones, ropa femenina y accesorios, que distribuye entre sus clientes a  través de créditos y en su punto donde los exhibe en una vitrina y los comercializa de contado. Entre sus vecinos, amigos, familiares y referidos ha logrado un grupo de clientes fijos, que hoy forman parte de su registro de compradores permanentes. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que recibe de  la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comparará  una vitrina, pues gran parte de su mercancía la tiene en una maleta y además invertirá en  ropa y accesorios, productos encargados por sus clientes. Su sueño más adelante es tener un local donde funcione únicamente su negocio, separando así el espacio productivo del familiar. Su mayor desafío es el insuficiente capital de trabajo con el que cuenta para responder la demanda y este es justamente el motivo por el cual solicita su financiación mediante la línea de Kiva.
texts.en:
25-year old Yeimi decided to earn enough money to pay for her studies through an enterprising and successful idea. She sells products from specialist catalogs such as cosmetics, lotions, women’s clothing and accessories. Her customers buy on credit, and if the items are satisfactory, she puts them on display and then sells them for cash. Her customers are neighbours, friends, relatives, and people who have been referred to her. Together they form a permanent customer base. 

This is Yeimi’s first loan with Kiva partner Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the money to buy a display case as at the moment most of her products are housed in a suitcase. She also wishes to buy the clothing and accessories that have been ordered by her customers.

Yeimi’s dream is to have a fixed place for her business separate from where her family lives. Her biggest problem is the lack of capital to buy what her customers have asked for. This is why she is seeking a loan from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a display case as well as the clothing and accessories ordered by her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in Uganda. She is married and has six children, four of whom are in school. Ruth lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, medication, school fees and food for the family.
Ruth has a business selling women's handbags. She has been in this business for ten years, and she works seven days a week. Ruth sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. She has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy to buy more bales of bags. She also generates additional income through selling clothes and jeans. The main business challenges for Ruth include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing bags herself and also to sell wholesale only.

loans.use: to buy more second-hand women's handbags.

loans.name: Solidaridad De Jicamarca Group

texts.es: Angélica tiene 34 años de edad, pertenece al grupo de Solidaridad de Jicamarca con 8 integrantes, este grupo tiene un año y medio, ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos todos menores de edad, que es el empuje para ella y su esposo en salir adelante. Ella trabaja en  una  moto taxi, tiene en el trabajo ya 4 años, inicialmente ella alquilaba la moto taxi, pero con el tiempo se compro su propia moto taxi y  todos los días sale a trabaja. Gracias a su esfuerzo y ala de su esposo ellos han podido lograr darles estudios a sus hijos y poder construir su casa. Ella comparte su trabajo con otro trabajo haciendo servicios de confección de polos, sus planes hacia el futuro es formar un taller de polos y que este sea conocido, con el préstamo reciente ella quiere regularizar los documentos para iniciar la confección de polos y para la compra de telas.
texts.en:
Angélica, 34, belongs to the “Solidaridad de Jicamarca” group which has 8 members.  This group is a year and a half old.  She’s married and has three minor children which are her and her husband’s impulse to get ahead.

She has been driving a mototaxi for four years.  Initially she leased the mototaxi but in time was able to buy her own and she goes out to work daily.  Thanks to her and her husband’s efforts they have managed to provide their children with an education and to build their house.

She has a second job manufacturing polo shirts.  Her plans for the future are to set up a polo shirt making shop that’s well known.  She wants to use the present loan to regularize the documents to start making polo shirts and to buy fabric.

loans.use: to buy fabric and to get the necessary permits for her business.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Heng is a farmer who lives along National Road Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She is a widow with seven children - four sons and three daughters. Heng is asking for a loan of $1,000 to help support her son by buying additional cows for sale. She will also use a part of the loan to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticides to maintain her farm.

loans.use: To help support her son by buying additional cows for sale.

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared is 24 years old and married to Esther. They have two children who are in school.

Jared has a barber shop and has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD  to  buy a shaving machine to enable him serve his clients better. The profits made from the business will enable him to pay school fees for his children.

He hopes to open up another barber shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy another shaving machine.

loans.name: Asymas

texts.en:
Asymas (in the photo) assists in her husband’s fishing business. Her husband is a fisherman. They live in a village along National Road number 6, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have six children, three sons and three daughters. Four are in school and other two are still young. 

Asymas is asking for another loan of $500 to buy additional fishing nets for her husband.

loans.use: To buy additional fishing nets for her husband.

loans.name: Josefa Genoveva

texts.es: Josefa Genoveva tiene su negocio que es la venta de cosméticos, ha sido una mujer muy emprendedora desde que inicio esta actividad es por medio del negocio que ella logro que su hijo saliera adelante. El motivo de este crédito es para la compra de talcos, cremas, perfumes, shampoo, lápiz labial, polvos, mascarillas entre otros, la variedad de sus productos es lo que atrae a sus clientes. Ella sale a ofrecer y algunos clientes que conocen su vivienda y llegan a comprarle.
texts.en: Josefa Genoveva sells cosmetics for a living.  She has been a very enterprising woman who has been able to provide for her son through the business she launched.  The loan will be used to buy talcum powder, creams, perfumes, shampoo, lipstick, face powder and facial masks, among other items.  The variety of products she has is what attracts customers.  She works both as a street vendor and from her home, where some customers go to shop.

loans.use: To buy talcum powder, creams, , shampoo, lipstick, face powder, and facial masks, among other items.

loans.name: Pok

texts.en:
Pok (in the photo) is 55 years old and her husband, Noun, is 57 years old. They have been married for almost 35 years and have three married daughters. Two of their daughters live in separate homes and another still lives in their family home. The family lives in a village outside of Phnom Penh City. 

Pok is a rice farmer. She is asking for her first loan of 200 USD to purchase spare parts for her motorized hand tiller (wheels).

loans.use: To purchase wheels for her motorized hand tiller

loans.name: Chanh

texts.en:
Chanh is a 54-year-old married man. He lives with two children and his wife in Ho Chi Minh City. For 16 years, he and his wife have operated a food stall to sell food, beverages and fruit juice for peopL. in their community.

Chanh would like a loan to purchase many kinds of fruits to make different juices and a greater range of cakes to sell. He hopes this will enabL. him to better meet the needs of his customers and attract additional customers.

He also hopes that through his loan he will be abL. to increase his income and save money for any future difficulties facing his family.

loans.use: To buy fruit and cakes to sell

loans.name: Wesley

texts.en:
Wesley is 29 years, married, has two children. He is a farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land, which he has been doing for the last six years.

Wesley is requesting his first loan, which he will use to prepare land for maize and wheat planting. The two crops has been doing well in his area due to good climatic conditions. He learned about KADET LTD from the registered KADET groups.  

Wesley hopes to use the profits from the proceeds of this loan to improve the living standards of his family, to provide for the education of his children, and to expand his business. His dream is prosper in the business of tomato farming. He is a hard working man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: to prepare land for maize and wheat planting.

loans.name: Mary Fe

texts.en:
Mary Fe is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. 

Mary Fe has a shop that sells canned goods, detergents and beverages. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy detergents, canned goods and beverages.

Mary Fe has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Mary Fe hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy detergents, canned goods and beverages.

loans.name: Gilyn's Group

texts.en:
Gilyn is 40 years old and lives in Sangay Daku, Ozamis City, Misamis Occdiental. She is married and has 5 school-aged children. Gilyn has a shop where she sells canned goods, soap, toothpaste, noodles, etc. She has had this business for 6 years. She has requested a loan of PHP3000 to buy more canned goods, soap, toothpaste, noodles, etc. 

Gilyn is a newly member of PMPC. In the future, Gilyn hopes to save money for her children’s education. Gilyn is the leader of a four person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods, noodles, toothpaste, etc.

location.town: Ozamis-Sangay Daku, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Analy

texts.en:
Analy is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with four children. 

Analy has a shop that sells canned goods, eggs and beverages.  She has been in business for five years.  She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy canned goods, eggs and beverages.

Analy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Analy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, eggs and beverages.

loans.name: Agripa

texts.en:
Agripa is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with eight children. 

Agripa has a poultry farm that sells grown & matured chickens She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy animal feed for the chickens.

Agripa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Agripa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy feed for the chickens

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en:
Bridget is a mother of 2 children, aged 18 and 15 years. She has been active in farming for 5 years with her produce of cabbages and vegetables going to the local market.

Bridget has requested for a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy piglets and to venture into pig farming. She says pigs reproduce faster and are likely to earn her more income since pork has also become more marketable due to the high cost of beef. She plans to use the income to educate her two children.

She adds that Juhudi Kilimo loans have given great help to farmers.

loans.use: to buy piglets.

loans.name: Mahugnon 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUGNON 2 est composé de quatre personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Laure (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 48 ans. Laure  est mariée à un pêcheur du nom de Kocou. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Laure et son mari. Pour cette raison, Laure vend des plastiques de façon ambulante depuis sept ; ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Laure s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Laure sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe MAHUGNON 2, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des plastiques.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is a 41-year-old farmer who is also hardworking, humble and responsible. Since she was a child, she learned the tasks involved in farming, thanks to her parents' support. She lives in Nandihills, Kenya, a town near the great Rift valley, with her husband and four children. 
Josphine has been a farmer for more than ten years and raises poultry, eggs, cows for milk, and maize and vegetables. She also engages in small businesses on the side whenever an opportunity arises. Despite rapid prices changes for the goods she sells, Josphine is very passionate and optimistic about the future of farming in Kenya. She is seeking a loan to expand her farm by buying farm implements. This move a big deal for her because with this loan, Josphine can grow a variety of crops, but on a larger scale. The demand for vegetables and other greens in Nandihills and other parts of the country is very high. Income from this venture will help her overcome the high farming expenses she has to deal with and satisfy her family’s basic needs. She puts it this way: “In the future, I will be able to provide food for my family and also educate my four children.”

loans.use: to buy farm implements.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita has always the enthusiasm of farming. She has cultivated their rice land in Calamba and has yield good earnings doing this type of work. Recently, she applied a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Anita knew that she has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations

loans.name: María Lorena

texts.en:
Maria Lorena is mother of 4 children, all stil under age. Her husband is a labourer and he works casually, only when people need him, as he has not been able to find a steady job with some construction company that will assure his income. Following this difficult situation she, four years ago, started to sell used clothing, with her only goal is to provide her children with what they need to live and not have to depend solely on the casual income of Mr. Roman. The love of her children and her devoted duty to her husband have motivated Maria Lorena to realize this project and with the support of her own she has maintained it to date.

However, she now requires a loan of $475 to be able to purchase loads of clothing to incrase her sales. You have the option to help her. With your generosity you can help Maria Lorena\'s children have a better quality of life an a better future, following the completion of their studies. Make your decision and help them. They thank you for it.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

María Lorena es Madre de 4 hijos, todos aun menores de edad. Su esposo es albañil y trabaja eventualmente, sólo cuando la gente lo requiere, pues no ha logrado encontrar un empleo seguro en alguna constructora que le asegure su ingreso. Ante esta situación ella hace cuatro años comenzó a vender ropa usada, con único propósito de brindar a sus hijos lo necesario para vivir y no depender únicamente del sueldo eventual de Don Román. El amor por sus hijos y el fiel compromiso con su esposo ha motivado a María Lorena a realizar éste proyecto y con el apoyo de los suyos lo ha mantenido hasta el momento.

Sin embargo, ella ahora esta requiriendo un préstamo de $475 DLLS para poder comprar pacas de ropa e incrementar así sus ventas. Tú tienes la opción de ayudarla, con tu generosidad puedes hacer que los hijos de María Lorena tengan una mejor calidad de vida y un mejor futuro, tras la culminación de sus estudios. Decídete y apóyalos, ellos de lo agradecen.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.en:
Zuhro is a resident of Khujand. She sells office supplies in the main market, “Panjshanbe”. She is married and has three kids. She has 7 years of experience in her business.

She considers herself lucky because she has a good business site. From the beginning she had enough capital to buy a big volume of goods and rent space at the most visited market of the town. She became member of the group to start receiving loans from MicroInvest. One member of the group makes trips to wholesale market and the other members work as retail sellers.

Her goal is to buy a shop for her business and stop paying rent. Currently she would like to use her next loan for adding souvenirs to her goods. She noted that very often her customers look for presents and express a need to buy something for their co-workers, manager, etc. Therefore she is sure that there will be good demand for various souvenirs and office supplies given as gifts.

loans.use: Adding souvenir products

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en: Sorn S. is 38 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their 2 children.  Sorn works as a tailor, and earns about $7/day, while her husband earns $3/day running a small lottery business.  Sorn currently works for a wage, but she feels she has the skills to start her own business.  With this loan, she will buy clothes and a sewing machine to get her own tailoring business started.  In the future, she will use additional income to buy a larger shop, and possibly hire a few employees to help her business grow.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and a sewing machine to start her own tailoring business

loans.name: Noemi Marlene

texts.es:
My name is Noemi Cabrere. I have made my living selling tortillas for the past five years. I run this small business out of my home. I have good sales, since my neighbors buy their tortillas from me, as do people from other parts of town and some restaurants. Now I want to purchase more corn and lime and another fryer so I can make more tortillas. This business is my only source of income and how I help my family.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Mi nombre es Noemi C., me dedico a la venta de tortillas hace 5 años. este pequeño negocio lo tengo en mi casa. Tengo muy buenas ventas ya que mis vecinos me compran y tambien parte de la comunida y algunos restaurantes. Ahora quiero comprar mas maiz y cal y compar otro comal para poder a gregar a mi fogon y poder hacer mas tortillas ya que no doy avasto con el que tengo. Este engocio es la unica fuente de ingreso que tengo y a la ves ayudo a mi familia.

loans.use: Purchase salt, lime, corn and a fryer

loans.name: Ni Wayan Cenik

texts.id:
Ni Wayan Cenik is a hardworking women figure. In her busy day as a mother, Wayan Cenik has to help her husband increase the family income. Pig farming, and also selling animal feed is her daily activity. With a capital of Rp5000,000 (US$550) obtain from Dinari, Wayan Cenik would provide several animal feed needs for nearby farmers. From rice shells, wheat shells, concentrate to medicine for animals. From selling animal feed Wayan Cenik could obtain a monthly profit of about Rp700,000 (about $77). This profit is used to pay for her 3 children still studying. Wayan Cenik hope that the extra capital to be obtained could add her income so that her children could finish schooling.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Wayan Cenik merupakan figur wanita pekerja keras .Ditengah kesibukan sebagai seorang ibu rumah tangga, Wayan Cenik harus membantu suami dalam menambah pendapatan keluarga.Beternak babi sekaligus berjualan pakan ternak merupakan aktifitas usaha dalam keseharian hidupnya. Dengan modal Rp 5.000.000.- yang diperoleh dari Dinari Wayan Cenik menyediakan berbagai kebutuhan pakan bagi peternak yang ada disekitarnya. Mulai dari dedak padi, dedak gandum,konsentrat sampai obat –obatan untuk ternak.Dari usaha berjualan pakan ternak ini Wayan Cenik memperoleh keuntungan rata-rata perbulan hingga Rp 700.000.- Keuntungan ini dipergunakan untuk membiayai 3 orang anaknya yang semuanya masih kuliah .Wayan Cenik berharap dengan tambahan modal yang diperolehnya bisa menambah pendapatannya supaya anaknya tetap bisa menyelesaikan sekolahnya.

loans.use:
To buy animal feed

Membeli pakan ternak

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pork at wholesale prices

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is married with two daughters. She and her family live in Vasilyevka. Elvira sells nice, quality clothing in a big local market. Her family is actively helping her with her business which she started about 3 years ago, and her current gross income is about $2000.

Elvira would like to ask for a loan of $1000 to increase her inventory stock which will help supply her until the spring season. She believes this timely investment will help her generate additional income and increase the family budget. We think Elvira’s responsibility and strong character will assist her in the current loan repayment.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
We find Paulina inside her small sewing workshop. She conducts this work with only one sewing machine right now. As a result of the large quantity of orders, she needs to acquire another machine so she may satisfy the orders. Fortunately, the good service that she offers and the good materials with which she works helps her to progress her small factory. Thanks to this job, which she performs well from 8AM until the late hours of the night, she can cover the costs of her home and of the education for her four dear children. Paulina’s loan is projected to be invested in the purchase of another sewing machine. Paulina needs your help in order to continue progressing.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Encontramos a la señora Paulina al interior de su pequeño taller de confección de buzos, ella se dedica a esta labor con tan solo con una máquina de coser ahora; debido a la gran cantidad de solicitudes requiere adquirir otra máquina y así cumplir satisfactoriamente cada uno de sus pedidos. Afortunadamente el buen servicio que ofrece y los buenos materiales con los que trabaja la ayudan a progresar con su pequeña fábrica, gracias a este oficio que desempeña hábilmente a partir de las ocho de la mañana hasta altas horas de la noche puede cubrir las necesidades de su hogar y los estudios de sus cuatro queridos hijos. La solicitud que hace doña Paulina es debido a que tiene proyectado invertirlo en la compra de otra máquina de coser. Doña Paulina requiere de tu apoyo para seguir progresando.

loans.use: Purchase an additional sewing machine.

loans.name: Marilú

texts.es:
Marilú belongs to the communal bank “Jesús María” and thanks to this bank she has made structural improvements to her home. She makes living selling fish (bocachico, maparate, ractacara among other regional varieties). In order to diversify her business, she also sells bananas. Marilú is 40 years old and is the mother of five children all of whom are students. One of her children has special needs and is of particular concern to her, requiring her time and attention. For Marilú, the most important thing she can offer her children is a good home and, of course, an education. It is for this reason that she works so hard and why she wants her business to continue to grow. In order for her business to grow, she is in need of building materials to construct a kiosk in site that is appropriate for expanding her sales of fresh and salted fish. Marilú awaits the selfless assistance of your kind heart.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Kenney Molloy, Kiva volunteer

Marilú pertenece al banco comunal “Jesús María”, gracias a este banco ha arreglado las estructuras de su vivienda. Se dedica a la venta de pescados (bocachico, maparate, ractacara entre otras variedades propias de su región), para variar su negocio de también vende plátanos. Ella a sus 40 años de edad es madre de 05 hijos los mismos que estudian, siendo uno de ellos su principal preocupación por lo especial de su padecimiento.Para Marilu lo más importante que puede brindarles a sus hijos es una buena vivienda y desde luego educación, es por eso que trabaja arduamente ya que quiere seguir incrementando su negocio y para ello requiere materiales para construir un kiosco en un lugar apropiado para expandir la venta de sus pescados frescos y salados.Ella aguarda la ayuda desinteresada de tu bondadoso corazón.

loans.use: Business Improvements and Construction of a Kiosk

loans.name: Emanuel K.

texts.en: Emanuel is 32-years old and married.   His salary does not meet the family expenses and he can not save enough to assist his wife to expand her business.  Emanuel therefore requesting a loan of $175 to expand his wife’s shoe-selling business and will pay the loan installments from his monthly salary to enable the business to grow.

loans.use: To expand shoe-selling business

loans.name: Lim

texts.en: Mrs. Lim S. is 52 years old, and she lives in Champey Village in the Kampong Speu Province. She is a farmer with two children, both of whom help their parents on the rice field. Her husband, Mr. Yorn Yeim, is also a subsistence farmer. Not surprisingly, when they experience a drought, their rice production declines dramatically, thereby making it extremely difficult to maintain a decent standard of living. Moreover, in December 2007, Mrs. Lin Snguong‘s husband got tetanus, and he was sent to the local hospital. Presently, Mr. Yorn Yeim is ill again, which makes the family's budget even tighter than it was before he was sick. Facing poor living conditions and a lack of money, Mrs. Lim S. is seeking a loan to buy cows to plow the rice field to exploit the profitable rainy season.

loans.use: To purchase cows to plow the rice field to capitalize on the profitable rainy season.

loans.name: Marìa Marcelina

texts.es:
My name is María Marcelina B. C.. I´m 31 years old and from San Pedro Sacatepéquez, Guatemala. I started 10 years ago by business selling children´s clothing on the street. Now I´ve diversified my products. I sell t-shirts, plasticware, basic goods, and I sell alongside my husband in the towns of San Raymundo, Chuarrancho y San Juan Sacatepequez.

Since I still don´t have a fixed location, I take advantage of the market days in the pueblos we visit. I also make aprons, blouses, traditional dresses and I sell tortillas--for these activities I need more capital to increase my production. Right now I´m seeing good demand and it´s important for me to satisfy what the customers want. My plan is to increase sales, but I can only do this by having more products to offer. I always work hard since I have five girls and three of them go to school. I want to give them the opportunity to study and get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva volunteer.

Mi nombre es María Marcelina B. C., tengo 31 años de edad; soy de San Pedro Sacatepèquez Guatemala, soy comerciante. Inicie mi negocio vendiendo de forma ambulante, ropa para niños, ya tengo 10 años en el negocio. Actualmente he diversificado los productos que vendo, ya que vendo playeras, recipientes plásticos, productos de consumo diario, los que vendemos junto a mi esposo en los municipios de San Raymundo, Chuarrancho y San Juan Sacatepequez. Ya que mi negocio es de forma ambulante aprovecho los días de mercado en los pueblos que visitamos, por lo que también me dedico a la elaboración de delantales y blusas, costuras de cortes típicos, y venta de tortillas, por lo que necesito más capital para incrementar los productos que vendo, actualmente estoy teniendo bastante demanda de mis clientes, por lo que es necesario que pueda cumplir con lo que ellos me piden. Mis planes son incrementar las ventas que tengo en los diferentes negocios, pero solo lo puedo lograr teniendo suficientes productos que la gente pide. Sigo trabajando duro ya que tengo 5 niñas y 3 de ellas ya van a la escuela quiero darle la oportunidad de que estudien y se superen.

loans.use: Invest in more merchandise: clothes and kitchenware

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.en: Adjowa A. extracts palm oil. She sells her oil to a local soap manufacturer. She is married, but her husband's income from farming is not sufficient to cover the expenses of Adjowa and her eight dependents. Demand for her palm oil is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business extracting palm oil.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Mrs. Kim E. owns a grocery store in Au Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She has borrowed from AMK before and used the money to start her current business. Since her business has improved, Mrs. Kim E. would like to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Kim E. decided to ask for a loan to purchase grocery goods for her customers. Mrs. Kim E. is a 43-year-old widow with three children, all of whom are attending school.

loans.use: to purchase grocery goods for her customers.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a 42-year-old married woman with two children aged 23 and 15. She has owned a small curio shop since 2006. Every day,she works from 8am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $US450 from her sales.

In the past,Catherine has taken out two successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her shop.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Gloria Luz

texts.es: Doña Gloria Luz M., tiene 35 años de edad, es casada, tiene una bebe de meses de nacida, su esposo es comerciante, la actividad economica de la señora es la venta de ropa nueva y cosmeticos actividad que desarrolla en conjunto con su esposo ya que ambos estan sin empleo y al ver esta una opcion de autoempleo a la fecha se ha constituido como su fuente de ingresos familiar. Su negocio lo lleva a cabo por encargo y en su domicilio ya que tiene clientes que le buscan en su casa, su idea de nogocio se da como una necesidad de poder salir adelante, por lo que su sueño es poder ofrecer un mejor futuro a su hijo, acondicionar su vivienda y con un poco mas de apoyo instalar una tienda en su casa de esta manera ella atenderia directamente el neogcio en casa y su compañero de vida atenderia los pedidos a sus clientes externos como son personas de los mercados, y del sector domiciliar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gloria Luz M. is a 35-year-old married mother of a newborn girl. Her husband is a businessman. She and her husband sell clothing and cosmetics for a living because they are both unemployed and this opportunity for self-employment has thus far constituted their source of family income. They carry out their business by taking orders from home because their customers seek their services at their house. The idea to have her own business came out of a necessity to get ahead in life, which is why she dreams of being able to offer her child a better future, remodel her house, and with a little more support, set up a store in her house so that she and her spouse can run their business directly and serve their outside customers, such as the people from the markets and from the home sector.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Berta

texts.en:
Berta L. N., 25, is a member of the community bank known as Minka. Currently studying in a two-year cosmetology program at San Cristobal de Huamanga University in Ayacucho, Peru, Berta will complete her degree in one year. To pay for school she works on Sundays as a telephone provider, one of many people paid to stand on the busy corners of Ayacucho to provide cell phones, "public phones," for the public.

Berta is requesting a loan to invest in her education and to purchase more phone cards for the cell phones. She dreams of finishing school and having her own boutique.

loans.use: To invest in her education and to purchase more phone cards for use in the cell phones.

loans.name: Sothy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sothy S. is a villager in Ta Preas Village in Takeo Province. She owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. However, she faces an obstacle because the soil on her field is infertile.

Her husband Mr. Him Thy is a construction worker, but does not earn a large salary.

In order to help her field, Mrs. Sothy S. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers so she can support her field and grow more crops.

She is 31 years old and the mother of three children. Two of the children attend the local school. The youngest child is too young to work or study.

Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support her field

loans.name: Sara Catalina

texts.es:
La señora Sara G. habita en la ciudad de Masaya donde se desempeña en sus labores de elaboración de zapatos de cuero habiendo obtenido esta habilidad desde muy joven y ahora este es su negocio con el cual le permite subsistir.

Esta habilidad la adquirió desde muy jovencita y hoy en día tiene basta experiencia en la elaboración de los zapatos tanto para damas como para caballeros y niños. Ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito que le permita la compra de  los materiales como lo son el cuero, pega entre otros. Al haber solicitado el crédito espera que le sea otorgado para continuar elaborando los zapatos y llenar sus estantes porque están vacíos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sara G. lives in the city of Masaya, where she is very successful in her job making leather shoes, a skill which she learned at a very young age and now provides her with a living. She acquired this skill as a little girl and now she has plenty of experience in making shoes for women, as well as for men and children. She has sought the help of Ceprodel to ask for a loan which will allow her to buy materials such as leather and glue, among others. Now that she's asked for the loan, she hopes it will be granted so she can continue making shoes and fill her shelves, because they are now empty.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials to make shoes

loans.name: Exito Group

texts.es: El grupo "Éxito" esta representado por la señora Dony Mery quien reside en el mismo barrio que sus compañeras de grupo es de ahí que se tienen la confianza como para participar de un grupo juntas por la responsabilidad que demuestran todas en el trabajo. En su mayoría los socios (as) se dedican al comercio de diferentes productos como la ropa, comida, a la elaboración de prendas de vestir y al transporte público. Dentro del rubro del comercio existe mucha competencia en especial dentro de la oferta y la demanda ya que si uno no posee productos de calidad para ofrecer al publico no tiene competitividad, y por ende los ingresos declinan, es por eso que requieren el crédito para incrementar sus insumos y mejorar la calidad de sus productos así como realizar algunas mejoras en sus puestos de trabajo para otorgar una buena imagen al cliente exigente. Por lo que han demostrado los socios (as) tiene experiencia en grupos solidarios y una gran responsabilidad para con sus compromisos por lo que la Fundación Agrocapital les da la oportunidad de obtener un financiamiento para lograr sus metas y mejor su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The "Success" group is represented by Dony Mery who lives in the same neighborhood as her group partners. It's because they all live in the same neighborhood that they have the confidence to participate together in a group united by the responsibility that each member demonstrates toward her work. The majority of the partners work selling different types of products, such as clothing, food, handmade pieces of clothing and public transportation.Within the commercial sector there exists a lot of competition, particularly in supply and demand, since if you do not have quality products to offer the public, you are not competitive, and your earnings decline. It's for this reason that the partners of this group require a loan in order to increase the quality of their products, by making improvements in their work spaces, for example, in order to present a better image to demanding clientele. The partners of this group have demonstrated that they have experience in supportive groups and a great sense of responsibility to their commitments. Recognizing that, the Fundación Agrocapital is giving them the opportunity to obtain financing to achieve their goals and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Neyseang

texts.en: Mrs. Neyseang S. is a villager in Andoung village in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband, Mr. Phet Phat, are laborers who make little income to support the family, but it is not enough to support the family well. To provide a better life for their family, Mrs. Neyseang S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband to use as a motor taxi. Mrs. Neyseang S. is 47 years old and the mothers of five children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the remaining two are attending the local school. Her husband is presented at the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to use as a motor taxi.

loans.name: H. Cécile

texts.fr:
Née le 22/11/1955 à Parakou, dame H. est originaire d'Agonli. Mère de 4 enfants dont 3 filles et un garçon tous majeurs. Son mari du nom de AHOUANGONOU Georges est un mécanicien velo moteur de profession. Elle mène l'activité de la vente de l'huile d'arachide et de palme, de charbon en détail, des balaies, des paniers. Elle sollicite pour son 5ième crédit. 


La signification d’ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique d’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux a 0% d’intérêt aux gens très vulnérables et il est dans un groupe qui lancent bientôt un programme de la microassurance santé.
texts.en:
Ms. H. was born on November 22, 1955 in Parakou and has roots in Agonli. She is the mother of four children (three girls and a boy), who are all of age. Her husband’s name is Georges AHOUANGONOU, a motorbike mechanic by profession. Her work involves selling peanut oil, palm oil, and charcoal at the retail level, plus brooms and baskets. She is applying for her fifth loan.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy three sacks of charcoal, two 50-liter drums of  peanut oil and palm oil and some brooms and sponges

loans.name: Um

texts.en: Um S. is 52 years old and resides with her husband in the Prey Veng province. She grows and sells rice to earn a living and is able to make US$3 per day, while her husband typically makes US$5 per day as a motor-taxi driver. This couple has two children, one is a student and the other is employed as a garment factory worker. Um S. would like a loan to purchase fertilizers and a water pump. The remaining money will be used to dig the well to irrigate her farm.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and a water pump.

loans.name: Bibi Kallan Group

texts.en:
Bibi Kallan is the group leader of this group. There are five members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for their businesses.

Zarghona and Bibi Kallan want to take a loan for their quilt business.  They want to expand and advance their business. Also, K. Khalad and K. S. want to take a loan for their butcher business.  They want to enlarge their shop. And Faryba wants to take a loan for her tailoring business.  She wants to buy a new machine and buy necessary materials for her business.

With this loan they can enlarge their businesses and support their families and make a better future for themselves and for their families in the future.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Teopista Nalwadda ‘S Group

texts.en:
Teopista N. is 45 years olod and a single mother of 2 children, aged 13 and 18 years old. Both children are in school. She owns a two room house where she lives with her family. She does not take care of additional family members. She has access to electricity but no piped water at home. The family eats three meals a day. 

Teopista earns her living by selling matooke (bananas) in Kawempe market, a city suburb. She buys bananas from villages and supplies them to other market vendors. She sells at her stall and receives about 15 customers a day and sells to a variety of people. Teopista incurs extra cost for transport to and from the villages. She works seven days a week and has been in this business for 30 years. She also owns rooms and has tenants. Teopista is faced with a challenge of high transport costs and the rainy season, which makes roads impassable.

This is her 14th loan since joining MCDT and has been with MCDT for 7 years, working with the same group for a loan. Teopista wants to use this loan to buy more bananas and is aspiring to build a permanent place for her business.

loans.use: To buy more bananas

loans.name: Sinoun

texts.en:
Ms. Sinoun U., 33, is single and lives with her parents and her brother, who is an electrician. The family lives in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sinoun has been a silk weaver for fifteen years; it’s a skill she learned from a neighbor. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who then takes them to sell at the market in Phnom Penh. Her mother is a farmer; besides farming she also assists her daughter to spin thread.

Sinoun is requesting her first loan of US$ 400 to purchase silk materials for her silk weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
For almost two years, Mario has successfully managed his village store business. He is already 54 years old and still single.

Mario is hoping to borrow PHP 9,000 for the improvement of his store. He feels the contentment of living all by himself and dedicates his perseverance to support his parents and their daily necessities.

Mario also shared that every week, he can earn around PHP 1,000 net income. That is very useful in supporting their family needs since he serves as the bread winner of his family.

loans.use: To uses for business Improvement

loans.name: Olga Sofia

texts.es:
Olga  vive en la zona Mariscal Sucre, calle Miguel Angel Astoria  de la ciudad de El Alto.

Vive junto a su esposo, quien trabaja como patrullero en la policia Nacional,  y sus  hijos los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar, en su casita propia ubicada en una zona periférica de la ciudad.

La señora se dedica a la confección de ropa de algodón para bebes y niños, su producción lo realiza al por menor y sus ventas directamente al publico en la feria de la zona.
 
El crédito lo destinara, en la compra de lana al por mayor y asi  incrementar su producción, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el segundo  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Olga lives in the Mariscal Sucre zone called Miguel Angel Astoria in the city of El Alto. She lives with her husband, who works as a policeman in the National Police, and her children who are school-aged in their own small house located in a zone adjacent to city. She dedicates herself to making cotton clothing for babies and children; her production is retail and she sells directly to the public at the regional market. The loan will be used to purchase wholesale wool to increase her production and in that way her income. This is her second loan with Impro, and the evaluation carried out qualifies her to be approved for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital (to purchase wholesale wool).

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn L. is from the city of Oroquieta City. She is 52 years old. Marilyn is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Marilyn owns & operates a hog raising business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Marilyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Marilyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Gbamra

texts.fr: Gbamra A. est un cultivateur de sorgho à Avetonou, un village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Agé de 32 ans, il est marié et père de 2 enfants. il désire avec ce crédit acheter des intrants comme les engrais pour augmenter sa production et par là améliorer son niveau de vie.
texts.en:
Gbamra A. is a sorghum farmer in Avetonou, a village located about 100 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. He is 32 years old, married, and the father of two. He would like to use this loan to buy inputs, such as fertilizers, to increase his production and thus to improve his standard of living.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other inputs

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hardworking entrepreneur in the village of Sili Aurora, Isabela. She is married to Reynaldo V., who is a simple farmer and who sometimes operates a tricycle transport to help generate income for their daily needs at home.

Agriculture is the main business of Gina's family: they grow corn, rice and vegetables. Gina vends vegetables, most of which come from her family's own vegetable crops. Gina sells her vegetables at wholesale prices in the public market of Aurora. She is happy that she is generating enough income to support her family's daily needs and the education of her children.

Gina wants her business to become more developed and to someday produce bigger volumes of vegetables. She is working to achieve this ambition of the sustainability of their business in order to secure her family's comfort and contentment in life. For this reason, Gina is requesting to borrow PHP26,000 from Kiva as additional business capital for her vegetable business.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Isabelle

texts.fr: Isabelle est âgée de 34 ans ; elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Isabelle est couturière de formation. Isabelle a comme activité secondaire, la vente de tissus, bijoux et savons et ustensiles en aliminium. C’est pour mieux assurer ses besoins et ceux de sa famille que Isabelle s’est donnée à cette seconde activité. En effet, Isabelle achète ses produits à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Isabelle distribue à crédit ces produits à ses clients qui ont fait la demande ; chaque cinq jours,  Isabelle passe chez ceux-ci pour collecter ses fonds. Isabelle a déjà bénéficié d’un premier prêt d’ALIDé, prêt qu’elle a bien remboursé. Isabelle sollicite un deuxième crédit d’ALIDé pour renforcer son fonds de roulement afin de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Isabelle is 34 years old; she is married and the mother of three children. She is a dressmaker by training. Isabelle’s secondary business involves selling cloth, jewelry, soaps, and aluminum utensils. To meet her needs and those of her family, she has dedicated herself to this second business. Basically, she buys her goods at Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin. She distributes these goods on credit to customers who ordered them; every five days, she comes around to collect. Isabelle has already benefited from an initial ALIDé loan that she has repaid. She’s requesting a second loan from ALIDé to bolster her working capital in order to respond better to customer demands.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy six 12-meter bolts of cloth, ten boxes of BF soap, and some jewelry to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cases of drinks

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en: Cheryl B. is from the village of Usocan. She is 37 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Cheryl owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Cheryl joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. Cheryl is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Noraima

texts.en:
Noraima S. is from the village of Panduma, Tukuran, Zamboanga del sur. She is 29 years old, married and has four school-aged children. Noraima recently started a transportation services business, which is her main source of income. She earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from the business.

In 2008, Noraima joined GDMPC to access their financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous GDMPC loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP. This previous loan was used to repair her existing vehicle to provide better service. Noraima is requesting 3,000 PHP for her second GDMPC loan, which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermongers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories.

loans.name: Fausat

texts.en: Fausat just came from the market after visiting the food stall. She sells food items at retail, to her clients within her community in Lagos state. She purchases food items from the market to sell in her stall at home. She has been in this business for a long time and through hard work, has been able to grow her business. She is 44 years old and married with five children. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more food items to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more food items to sell.

loans.name: Khloem

texts.en: Mrs. Khloem S. is a low-income person who is 33 years of age. She currently depends on selling fish in the local busy market. She sells fish that she either gets from her husband’s fishing or buys from her wholesale supplier. Khloem S. is a humble mother who has been blessed with five school-aged children. Now the river is full of fish due to the coming fish season. Khloem S.’s husband can’t catch a lot of fish because he lacks tools to use for the fishing activities. Therefore, Khloem S. has decided to seek a loan, which will enable her husband to purchase extra tools to fish.

loans.use: To purchase extra tools to fish

loans.name: Kim Chharn

texts.en:
Mr. Kim Chharn R. is a villager who lives in Srae Ampil village in Kandal province. He is a married man, and he and his wife (who is pictured with him in the photograph) have six children. Three of his children collect recyclables, while his other children attend the local school.

To earn a living, he is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he grows vegetables. Unfortunately, he is facing a problem with his business because his field has a lot of insects. Thus, Mr. Kim Chharn R. decided to ask for a loan to buy pesticides. Accordingly, with the loan proceeds, he expects to have a more productive growing season, with many more vegetables.

loans.use: To improve his farming operation by purchasing pesticides

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing sells groceries in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She is 35 years old and she is married with 3 children. Her children are excelling in school. She is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. She is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more groceries to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Rejina

texts.en:
Rejina W. sells groundnut paste, beans and tomatoes and is requesting a loan to buy more groundnuts to make paste to sell. Rejina is 36 years old and is married to a soldier. She has six children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a permanent house.

About BRAC: BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. The programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more groundnuts to make paste to sell

loans.name: Touni

texts.en:
Touni is a 42-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa Valley with his wife and their child. Touni has owned a laundry since 1989. He has requested a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase cleaning products and to repair one of his cleaning machines. 

This is the first time that Touni has requested a loan. His business is special because he does it well and is very precise in his work. His clients are his friends, neighbors, and tourists. When he first started his business, he had difficulty purchasing all the tools required for his work. He decided to start his business because it was his family’s business. In the future, he plans to improve his work.

loans.use: To purchase cleaning products and to repair one of his cleaning machines.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina R. owns a small “sari-sari” (variety) store in the far, distant village of Dumrog in Pandan, Antique. She was able to start this business when she became a member of ASHI in 2004. Cristina took the risk of taking out a loan then and started taking a step toward achieving her dream of a better life for her family. The endeavor she chose was supported by her loving husband. Despite poverty, Cristina now is happier than before because she has her own business and is playing a productive role as a wife and mother. However, growing her “sari-sari” store into a grocery store that has a complete inventory of goods which people can access without spending money for going to the market would make her complete. Her dream of a better life for her family is anchored to this goal; thus, it needs to be achieved. 

Cristina is hopeful that through ASHI, a Kiva field partner in the Philippines, she will be able to have a larger amount of capital to materialize her dream for her business and family. She wants to increase the inventory of her goods little by little as the amount of the loan she is qualified to request from ASHI also grows. With the people who work with the poor like Kiva and ASHI, Cristina is hopeful that someday she will be able to bring her family out of the shadow of poverty.

loans.use: Will be used to purchase inventory of goods/foods for her "sari-sari" (variety) store business

loans.name: Ra

texts.en:
Mr. Ra M. (pictured with his son) is 27 years old and lives with his widowed father, sister and brothers in the Muk Kampoul District of Koh Dach. This is a famous island located 30 kilometers along the Mekong River, roughly 15 kms northeast of Phnom Penh City.

Ra has been a security guard for a year. He does not have his own transportation and spends a lot of money on traveling costs. Ra is, therefore, asking for a loan of $300 to purchase a motorcycle for commuting to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.name: Jeanvier

texts.en:
Jeanvier is 21 years old and is single. He lives with his parents in the Gasabo district of Kigali, the capital of Rwanda, in the village called Nyabisindu where his business is located.
