Jeanvier has been an entrepreneur since last year; he has an experience of 8 months. He is young man in this field but his business is well-known in the village where his business is located.

Jeanvier employs one person in his salon as a helper; the hours of his business are from seven in the morning to seven in the evening every day, even during the weekend.

Jeanvier is a serious man in his business. He is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy an electric trimmer plus some other materials to be used which will make him more efficient and effective and more successful.

With this loan, Jeanvier will be able to earn more profits which will allow him to get married in the future.

loans.use: To buy a new electric trimmer and other materials

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La  Señora Luz Marina N., Labora como Secretaria en el Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez de Managua, ella tiene  tres   hijos a su cargo,  y estos  se encuentra en edad escolar, esta casada, ha trabajado un créditos con CEPRODEL durante un año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido un crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como, arena y  cemento,  para reforzar las paredes de su casa de habitación.
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
Luz Marina Nuñez dijo que los préstamos otorgados han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luz Marina Nunez is a secretary at the Manuel Olivares Rodriguez Institute in Managua. She's married and has three school-age children. Luz has been working with CEPRODEL for about a year. She put her first loan toward some home improvements, and she'll use her new loan to buy construction materials like sand and cement. Luz plans to reinforce the walls of her home. Her goal is to improve her children's living conditions. She says the loan will be used to improve her home.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements and renovation

loans.name: Yeang

texts.en: Mrs. Yeang K. is 54 years old. She is a villager who lives in Pou village in Takeo province. She is a fruit seller who can earn a small income to support her family’s living. In order to support the fruit business, Mrs. Yeang K. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorcycle for transportation. Her husband, Mr. Touch San, is staying at home and cares his children. Mrs. Yeang K. is a mother of three children, one is a worker in a casino, and one is fruit seller who supports her mother’s business. The youngest child is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Cette  femme âgée de 39 ans est mariée et mère de  2 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d’agoè logopé, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de charbons de bois, avec ce qu’elle gagne elle contribue aux dépenses de sa famille, elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays  dans la ville de blitta. Elle fait face en ce moment en une baisse de stock, voulant se réapprovisionner elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de  35  sacs de charbons de bois. Sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes.
texts.en:
This 39-year old woman is married and has two children. She lives with her family in the Agoè Logopé district. She has an income-generating activity selling charcoal, and with the money she earns she contributes to the family's expenses. She gets her supplies inland in the town of Blitta. She is experiencing a decline in her stock at the moment, and since she would like to get fresh supplies she is requesting a loan from WAGES, in order to buy 35 sacks of charcoal. Her customer base is made up of all sorts of people.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Floresol

texts.en: Floresol L. is from the village of Barangay 3, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 28 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child. Floresol owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Floresol joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Floresol is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Estrella

texts.es: Estrella M. P., tiene la edad de 49 años, está casada, tiene 1 hijo que son su mayor  prioridad. Vive con el esposo y su hijo. El crédito lo quiere para comprar un lote en el cual desean construir la casa, ellos anhelan tener el lote propio con su casa. El lote cuenta con buenas condiciones para vivir y construir. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Doña Estrella espera poder desarrollar una vida tranquila en su lote propio y tener una mejor calidad de vida y  seguir creciendo como persona.
texts.en:
Estrella M. Portugeuz is 49 years old, married, and has a son who is her highest priority. She lives with her husband and son. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a plot of land so that she can build a house. Both she and her husband desire their own land for their house. This plot will provide good conditions on which to live and build.

This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR and she is very happy with the services that have been provided. Doña Estrella hopes to establish a peaceful life on her own land, have a better quality of life, and continue growing as a person.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a plot of land

loans.name: Por Siempre Alegres Group

texts.es:
En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer, Panamericana, se reúnen cada dos semanas la Asociación Comunal POR SIEMPRE ALEGRES. Su presidenta es Margarita H. de 22 años, comenta que es la primera vez que ingresa a conformar un grupo, tiene algo de temor pero con entusiasmo de mejorar y hacer crecer su negocio. 
Margarita tiene una tienda de barrio y con préstamo tiene planificado  comprar mercadería y surtir su negocio. 
Margarita se levanta muy temprano para atender a su clientela desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche.


Las demás  integrantes de esta Asociación tienen variados negocios que se dedican a la comercialización, producción y servicio.
texts.en:
The Por Siempre Alegres ("Forever Joyful") Group meets every two weeks in one of the centres of Pro Mujer Panamericana. Their president is Margarita H., 22 years old. She mentions that this is the first time she has led a group, and she is a little nervous, but enthusiastic to watch her business grow and improve. Margarita has a neighbourhood store and plans to use her loan to buy merchandise and stock her business. She gets up very early to serve her customers, from 8 am to 9 pm. The other group members have various businesses involved in marketing, production and services.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia lives with her husband and family in the mid-sized city of Vehari, Pakistan. Her husband, a loader by profession, has been working in a brick furnace for over ten years, using his donkey cart to deliver the bricks to the designated recipients.

Shazia, a mother of nine, takes care of her family and carries out her responsibilities as a housewife. She has repaid her first loan from Asasah (microfinance institute in Pakistan) and is now applying for a new loan so her husband can replace his old and damaged cart. A new cart will enable him to carry a greater load and thus earn more income.

loans.use: Purchase a new donkey cart for loading

loans.name: We Will Do It Group

texts.en:
Nathaniel G., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called We Will DO It. He is 34 years old, married, and has two children ages 4 and 8. He was able to attend school only through 10th grade due to lack of support.
  
For two years, he has been involved with making and selling soap in Pelele Town, Bong County, central Liberia.

He plans to use his 4,000 LRD portion of this 20,000 LRD group loan to buy more red oil and caustic used in the soap production.

He describes himself as hardworking. His dream is to expand his business and become a wholesaler.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Rebecca is inset at lower right because she was absent during loan disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more red oil and caustic used in the soap production.

loans.name: Ricardo Julian

texts.es: Ricardo Julian es un hombre muy emprendedor tiene 38 años tiene 2 hijos junto a su esposa que labora como comerciante de mercadería, el se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de laboratorios, pues no es la primera experiencia con créditos, sus experiencias han sido gratificantes. El labora fuertemente para mantener a su familia, pues siempre está pendiente de proporcionarle a su familia los ingresos necesarios para el hogar. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como contenedor para cortas punzantes, bulbos, microscopio binocular  por lo que son importantes para realizar los exámenes necesarios. El sueña con obtener su propio local para tener más ganancia y ayudar a la población.
texts.en:
Ricardo Julian, age 38, is a very enterprising man. He and his wife have two children; she sells merchandise. He offers laboratory services. This is not his first experience with loans, and his experiences have been gratifying. He works very hard to support his family. He is always conscientious about giving his family the money that the household needs. His is currently requesting this loan to buy raw material like plastic containers for used syringes and needles, bulb pipettes, and a binocular microscope. They are important to do the important tests. He dreams of having his own place in order to have more earnings and to help the people in his village.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Desiree

texts.en:
Desiree S. is from the village of Brgy.Bonfal West, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 21 years old. Desiree is single. To make a living, Desiree owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling personal products such as shoes, clothes and watches in the local community. Desiree has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Desiree joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Desiree is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Desiree from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria H. is from the town of Talibon. She is 54 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Gloria owns and operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling dried fish to the community. She hopes to grow her business and for it to provide her with a stable income.

Gloria joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to dry and sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca S. is from the village of Tangaro, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 50 years old and is separated from her spouse. She has eight adult children. Rebecca owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Rebecca joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Rebecca plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Polleritas Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal “POLLERITAS” está iniciando su segundo ciclo, está en proceso de consolidación. Esta conformada por 8 personas, siete mujeres y un varón. La mesa directiva esta constituida por la presidenta, la tesorera y la secretaria de actas.

La señora Aurelia, al igual que el resto de las socias está en su segundo ciclo y dispuesta a mejorar en relación al primer ciclo.  Además como presidenta tiene el desafío de motivar a su asociación.
El negocio que desarrolla es tejido de chompas, primero aprendió como ayudante en tejidos, desde hace cuatro años tiene su propio negocio.
El primer crédito fue de Bs. 2000.- y lo invirtió en la compra de lana, para este segundo ciclo su solicitud fue de Bs.1000.- para comprar materia prima.  Las ventas son realizadas en la Feria de la zona 16 de Julio, de 6 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche.  Una señora le ayuda con la costura de las chompas.  Cuando se le consulta sobre lo que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella indica que le gusta ahorrar.

Las otras integrantes de la asociación también tienen sus propios negocios: venta de comida, venta de helados, venta de escobas, tejido de mantas.
texts.en:
The “POLLERITAS” communal bank is starting its second cycle; they are in the consolidation phase. It has 8 members, seven women and one man. The governing board consists of a President, a Treasurer and a Recording Secretary. Aurelia, like the rest of the members, is in her second cycle willing to improve the record of the first cycle. Besides, as President her challenge is to motivate her association. The business she’s in is sweater weaving. She first learned as a weaving assistant but has had her own business now for four years. The first loan was for Bs.2000 and it was used to buy wool. This second loan request is for Bs.1000 to buy raw materials. Sales take place at the 16 de Julio market from 6am until 8pm. She has a woman who helps her with the weaving. When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she indicates that it’s the savings. The other group members have their own businesses: food sales, ice-cream sales, broom sales, blanket weaving.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool.

loans.name: Betina Nanjala

texts.en:
Betina Nanjala W. is a 24-year-old lady married to Levy Mugudo. They have two children, age 5 and 11 years respectively. They live in Kipsaina Kapenguria, Kenya. Betina has a grocery store where she earns her income. She has been in this business for the past two years with an income of 25,000 Kenyan shillings (Kshs.) per month.

Betina was introduced to KADET LTD. by a friend and she is applying for her second loan of Kshs. 40,000 with KADET LTD. With this loan, she plans to buy bananas, tomatoes, onion, carrots, pilipili hoho (peppers) and Irish potatoes. With the rest of the amount, she will renovate her new premises.

She hopes to have her own home and develop it, and also hopes for her children to have the best education.

loans.use: To buy bananas, tomatoes, onion, carrots, pilipili hoho (peppers), Irish potatoes and renovate her new premises.

loans.name: Maria Dominga

texts.es:
La señora Maria Dominga tiene 52 años de edad. La Sra Maria es casada , tiene 3 hijos y vive en una casa propia . La Sra. Maria se dedica  a comercializar  productos de tejidos de prendas de vestir que viene realizando desde hace más de 10 años.  
      
La Sra. Maria es casada pero su esposo por mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia se fue a trabajar a España. El crédito que está solicitando será destinado a la compra de material de trabajo y mercadería para la tienda que ella tiene, para de ese modo incrementar sus ingresos.    
 
La Sra Maria nos cuenta que su mayor sueño es poder darles toda la comodidad que pueda a sus hijos para que sean felices es por eso que el proximo crédito que saque sera para mejorar las condiciones de su casa.
texts.en:
Maria Dominga is 52 years old. Maria is married, she has 3 children and she lives in a house she owns. Maria engages in selling fabrics for garments: she has been engaging in this activity for more than 10 years. 

Maria is married but her husband went working in Spain to improve their family’s quality of life. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy working material and products for the shop she runs, in order to increase her earnings.

Maria told us her biggest dream is to be able to offer the best commodities she can to her children so that they can be happy, and this is why the next loan she will request will be used to improve the conditions of her house.

loans.use: To buy products to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly S. is a 48-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating 2 business ventures: a ready-to-wear clothes business and a welding shop business. 

She lives in Brgy. Bulwang, Mabinay, Negros Oriental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her ready-to-wear clothes and welding shop businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 15000.  

Nelly is now borrowing PHP 19500 so that she can purchase more stocks to sell. This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 19500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. 

Nelly aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). 

Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 38 years old and married. She has five children, from the ages of 14 to 4 years, who are all in school.

She has been in the farming business for seven years and sells products such as maize, beans, cabbage, and milk to the local market.

She has requested a loan for 31,200 KES through Juhudi Kilimo in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She hopes that the loan will improve life for her family, allowing them to get enough milk for home consumption as well as enough milk for selling, to help meet their basic needs.

In the next five years, Beatrice hopes to own four dairy cows and a chuff cutter to make feeding of her livestock easier. She hopes to become the main milk supplier in the local market.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine K. lives in the Lugala Masanafu neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has six children, all of whom are in school. Christine has a business selling fresh food. She has been in this business for 7 years and she works 6 days out of every week. Christine sells her products in a market by means of retail.    

Christine has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy sweet bananas, green bananas, onions, eggplants, pineapples cabbages, and tomatoes. She also generates additional income through cattle keeping.

The main business challenges for Christine include transportation and seasonality.   Her goal and aspiration for her business is to expand her business.   

Christine lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy fruit & vegetables for resale

loans.name: C2897 Abatiganda Group

texts.en:
Angelique is the representative of a group called Abatiganda.  She was born in 1985 and is married with one child. In the picture, she the first person on the right.

Angelique sells different kinds of clothes. The hours of her business are from six in the morning until six in the evening every day. This is her 5th successful year in his business where she employs one person.

Angelique will use this loan to purchase a variety of clothes to help increase profits. She would like to save any profits she makes for her child's future.

Each of the four members pictured have a different business.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Gloria, reside en Santiago de María departamento de Usulután, tiene casa propia y vive con sus hijas de 14 y 12 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa, tiene 49 años de edad, este negocio fue iniciativa propia, está situado en el mercado municipal desde hace 7 años, con un horario de 6:00am a 4:00pm.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de blusas, faldas, camisas sport, camisas de vestir y ropa interior, con la intención de fortalecer el negocio y brindar a los clientes diversidad de prendas de vestir e ir mejorando su vida cotidiana.
Sus aspiraciones es ser una microempresaria con un negocio fuerte, con mayores ganancias y mejorar el sistema de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Gloria lives in Santiago de María department of Usulután. She has her own home and lives with her two daughters, ages 14 and 12. She sells clothing. She is 49 years old. This business was one she started herself in the municipal market 7 years ago. She works from 6:00 AM until 4:00 PM.

She seeks a loan to buy blouses, skirts, t-shirts, dress shirts, and underwear, with the intention of strengthening her business and providing a variety of dress and casual clothing to her customers.

Her aspirations are to be a businesswoman with a strong business, with great profits, and improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: Buy blouses, skirts, t-shirts, dress shirts, and underwear.

loans.name: Candy Nattalli

texts.es: La Sra. Candy trabaja con nosotros desde principios del año 2010 en este tiempo  demostró responsabilidad y puntualidad, La Sra. Candy vende tucumanas de carne picada y huevo en la puerta del mercado de la Zona, ella es muy conocida por la zona ya que sus tucumanas son muy ricas y tiene bastante  clientela que viene desde otras zonas solo por comprar sus tucumanas, otra actividad que tiene ella es la de un bazar que lo tiene en el mercado en los primeros puestos del mercado donde vende juguetes, ropa, aretes, collares y otros, el préstamo que solicitan es para la compra de miniaturas y billetitos para la feria de las alasitas(La Feria de las Alasitas es una feria artesanal cuya característica principal es la venta de miniaturas con la finalidad ritual de que las mismas se conviertan en realidad, El nombre de la Feria deriva del aymara Challasita o Alasita es una palabra del Jaya Mara, (Del Tiempo) de los primeros habitantes de estas tierras, haciendo una celebración ofrecida a la Pachamama)	La Sra. Candy en su bazar venderá estas miniaturas, es una persona muy trabajadora se dedica vender variedad de productos según a la temporada, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado
texts.en:
Candy has worked with us since the beginning of the year 2010.  During this time she has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality.  Candy sells minced meat and egg “tucumanas” (fried turnovers) at the entrance to the area’s market.  She is very well-known in the area because her tucumanas are very delicious.  She has many customers who come from other zones solely to buy her tucumanas.

Another business activity she has is a small variety store, which is one of the first stands in the market.  She sells toys, clothes, earrings, necklaces, and more.  

She is requesting the loan to buy miniature replicas and “billetitos”(miniature money) for the Feria de las Alasitas.  The Alasitas Fair is a handicrafts fair.  Miniature replicas are primarily sold there and then used as offerings to the Pachamama (Mother Earth).  People believe that their offerings will make their dreams come true.  The name of the fair is derived from Challasita.  Challasita or Alasita is a Jaya Mara word (From Time) from the first inhabitants of this land.   

Candy will sell these miniatures at her store.  She is a very hard-working person who sells a variety of products according to the season.

She is grateful to the institution for the support that has been provided.

loans.use: To buy miniature replicas and bills for the Las Alasitas

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent bills, electricity and clothing. 

She has been operating a charcoal selling business for the past two months, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she owns and rents out a lorry used for transport, which also contributes to her income. Rose faces a major challenge in competition from other charcoal sellers. She hopes to expand and operate as a wholesaler in the future.

With the loan for 40,000 Kshs, she wants to purchase ten sacks of charcoal. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase ten sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Julynda's Group

texts.en:
Julynda B. is from the village of Mansabay bajo, Lopez Jaena. She is 35 years old. Julynda is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Julynda is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Julynda owns and operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood product, such as, fish in the local community. Julynda has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Julynda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julynda has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. Julynda B.'s group is requesting a new loan of 10,000.00 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Julynda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Kuy

texts.en:
Mrs. Kuy who was born in 1980 is married to Mr. Koem Na. She is a chicken seller at the local market where she is able to earn some income to support her family. Now she has a problem because her old motorcycle is not suitable for transportation of chickens to the market.  Mrs. Kuy is seeking a loan to add to her savings to buy a new motorcycle. 

Her husband is a basket maker and a farmer who owns a small piece of land where he grows rice. They sell part of the rice yield and use the rest of the rice to support their family. This couple supports four children, two of whom are attending local public school; the others are too small to work or study.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is married with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a water selling business for the past one year, selling from home to her neighbours. Mwanamisi faces a major challenge of stiff competition from neighbours who operate the same business. Mwanamisi dreams of establishing other businesses to increase her income in the future. 

With the loan she is requesting she wants to install another water tap for water distribution. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To install another water tap for water distribution.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 36-year-old married man with three children in school. He has been selling fish for the past 13 years. He has employed two people to assist him in his business. He decided to leave employment so as to concentrate on his business. He has previously received a loan from Faulu Kenya. He has requested another loan of 50,000 KES, which he will use to buy more fish and a freezer.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and more fish

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo D. is from the village of District 1. He is 51 years old. Danilo is married and has three adult children. 

To make a living, Danilo raises livestock, primarily pigs, for breeding. Danilo has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Danilo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Danilo is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the first loan taken out by Danilo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis M. O. is a married man and has one child aged one, to whom he hopes to give a good education to university level. Dennis' business is located at the busy Nyalenda market in Kisumu. Kisumu is the region in Kenya that harbors Lake Victoria and is commonly referred to as the lake basin.
Dennis runs a general store in which he sells such items such as beverages, sugar, detergents, flour, cooking oil and so forth to local people. He has been doing this business for two years now. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is that there are other people in the area doing the same business so his customers are not always loyal as they are spoiled for choice. However, Dennis works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of 50,000 KES to increase his stock of cooking oil, sugar, flour, rice, detergents and beverages to grow his business and meet the demand of his customers. He hopes to expand his business and become a wholesaler in the future. He describes himself as hardworking and determined.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil, detergents, beverages etc.

loans.name: Betti

texts.es: Betti tiene 29 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo en casa una alquilada. Desde su niñez se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería y desde hace  4 años decidió vivir en la ciudad para encontrar mejores oportunidades de educación para su hijo. Sin embrago no deja de lado sus actividades, que son su fuente de financiamiento, por ello cada fin de semana viaja a su tierra natal para cuidar de sus sembríos así como procurar el alimento de sus reses y ovejas, ya que depende de ello para engordarlo y poder ser vendidos en las ferias ganaderas. Considera que este negocio de animales es más rentable que la agricultura ya que su capital de trabajo tiene mayor rotación, permitiéndole mejorar su economía, por lo que desea intensificarse en esta actividad. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito con MFP, tiene buenas referencias de un trabajo grupal y decidió formar parte de un banco comunal porque aprecia que es una oportunidad de desarrollo, promete que será puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de ovejas de raza “merino” por considerarlos de mejor raza.
texts.en:
Betti is 29 years old.  She lives with her husband and son in a rental house.  She has been farming and raising livestock since she was a child and four years ago she decided to go and live in the city so that she could find better educational opportunities for her son.  However, she didn't abandon her business activities which are her source of income.  Every weekend she travels to her home town to look after her crops and obtain feed for her cattle and sheep so that she can fatten them and then sell them in the livestock markets.

Betti considers her animal raising business to be more profitable than farming crops since her working capital has a better turnover, which allows her to improve her finances.  For this reason, she would like to strengthen this part of her business.  This is the first time that Betti has requested a loan from MFP.  She has good references for group work and decided to join a community bank because she appreciates that it represents an opportunity for development.  She pledges to be punctual in making her repayments.

Betti will invest the loan she is requesting in buying merino sheep as she considers them to be the best breed of sheep.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en: Alphonsine is 33 years old, she has five children who are ages 4 to 13. They are all in school. Alphonsine sells clothes and some traditional fabrics called kitenge. She and her husband have been in this business since 2004. With the profits she earned she has been able to expand her business. She is requesting a loan to buy more clothes and hence make more profits. With the profits together with her savings she plans to build the family a house.

loans.use: To buy clothes for sale.

loans.name: Alily

texts.en: Alily, a 57-year-old married mother of six children, lives in the Philippines where she has had a shop selling coconuts for copras for the past 27 years. A member of HSPFI since 1999, Alily has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy additional coconuts for copras. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional coconuts for copras.

loans.name: Elsa Maria

texts.es: Elsa de 52 años de edad vive en el barrio El Socorro de la ciudad de Cartagena, con sus dos hijos en las edades de 9 y 13 años,  para quienes sueña construir un futuro prometedor. En este ambiente de playa, brisa y mar, Elsa tiene un negocio de miscelánea que inició hace 6 años, donde vende productos para el hogar, accesorios femeninos, ropa, artículos plásticos, perfumería, papelería  y cosméticos, mediante el sistema de crédito y de contado, a clientes ubicados alrededor de su barrio, entre los que se encuentran amas de casa, jóvenes, empleados y estudiantes.    Elsa está vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo desde hace 2 años, en los cuales ha recibido 2 financiamientos, con los que ha logrado incrementar su capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio. Su meta es lograr mayor crecimiento, por eso acude a un  credikiva con el cual comprará  bolsos, accesorios y ropa, para surtir su negocio y responder a los requerimientos de su clientela rentable. Mientras trabaja persistentemente para lograr sus sueños, continua esmerándose por conseguir una recuperación de sus cuentas por cobrar inferior a 30 días.
texts.en:
Elsa, aged 52, lives in the El Socorro neighborhood in the city of Cartagena.  She lives with her two children, aged 9 and 13, for whom she dreams of building a promising future.  In this atmosphere of beach, breeze, and sea.  Elsa has a business that she began 6 years ago.  It is a miscellaneous business that sells household products, women's accessories, clothing, plastic items, perfumes, stationery and cosmetics.  The business takes credit and cash from customers located around the neighborhood; among them are housewives, young people, employees and students.  

Elsa has been linked to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for 2 years during which she has received 2 rounds of funding.  With this, she has managed to increase her working capital and supply her business.  Her goal is to achieve greater growth, which is why she is coming for a Kiva loan with which to buy handbags, accessories and clothing to supply her business and meet the requirements of her customers profitably.  While working persistently to achieve her dreams, she continues to strive to achieve payment of accounts receivable in less than 30 days.

loans.use: to buy handbags, accessories and clothing to stock up her business.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Unidas se conformó en la ciudad de Pilar, con mucho esfuerzo de todas las miembros, ellas  ya se encuentran en el 6 ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también desarrollan actividades en forma conjunta, a la vez se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos que es la de trabajar para apoyar a sus familias. 
La de la Sra. Francisca quien se dedica a la venta de ropa, desde ya hace muchos años, por medio de este trabajo ha podido salir adelante y la economía de la familia mejoró ya que ella mantiene la casa.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de mas ropas, con lo cual podrá atraer a mas clientes. Ella sabe que el credito le sera de gran ayuda en su pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Unidas ["United Women"] group was formed in the city of Pilar, with a great deal of work from all of the members. They are now in their sixth cycle, working together within the program.
On top of each woman's independent work, they also do group activities. Currently, they are helping each other to achieve their objectives, which are to work in order to support their families.
Mrs. Francisca, who has sold clothing for many years, has been able to get ahead through this work. Her family's economic situation has improved and she is able to maintain her household.
She is requesting this loan for the purchase of more clothing, with which she will be able to attract more customers. She knows that his loan will be a great help to her little business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for the next sale.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 23 years old and single. She is financially responsible only for herself. For the past two years, she has been a farmer and she earns a monthly income of 11,000 KES. 

Caroline is requesting a 10,000 KES loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. This will be her second loan. She successfully repaid her previous loan. Caroline’s dream is to buy a plot of land in Tugen Estate and plough it for cultivation next year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
La señora  Catalina, ella se dedica  a la venta de comida  a tenido su negocio  desde  hace  dos años atrás .
Tiene dos hijos  Ricardo de tres años de edad  y  Luís Antonio de diez años de edad , su hijo Luís le ayuda  a lavar los trastes  y a comparar  las cosas que necesita , para que  a  Doña  Catalina no se le haga  tarde y le de tiempo de hacer guisados.
Su sueño mas grande  es  tener  un restaurante  ya que ha trabajado muchísimo  y tiene  ahorrado su dinero para los materiales que va  necesitar.
Esta  muy agradecida con fundacion por que  con el préstamo va comparar mas alimentos  ya que aparte de vender comida en su local va entregar comida a sus clientes  que trabajan en locales y en casas.
Su esposo le ayuda cuando sale de trabajar a limpiar y  acomodar las mesas  y la acompañ a comparar  lo necesario para el otro día y  su hijo Ricardo se encarga de  comprar las cosas del mercado.
Esta  agradecida con  sus hijos  que la han  apoyado y a fundacion por que con su  préstamo a alcanzado sus sueños.
texts.en:
Señora Catalina works selling food.  She started her business two years ago.

She has two sons: Ricardo, aged three, and Luís Antonio, aged ten.  Her son Luís helps wash the dishes and buy the things required, so that Catalina does not have to work late and has time to make stews.

Her biggest dream is to have a restaurant as she has already worked very hard and has been saving her money for the supplies she will need.

She is very grateful to the Foundation for the loan, with which she will buy more food supplies, because apart from selling food on her premises, she also will deliver food to her customers who work in premises and homes.

Her husband helps when she goes to work cleaning and arranging the tables, and accompanying her to buy necessary items for the next day, and her son Ricardo is in charge of buying things from the market.

She is grateful to her sons who have supported her, and to the Foundation for the loan to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase and sell food.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 61-year-old married man with seven children. He lives in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His major dream is to have enough money and be able to take his children to the best schools around the country. 

Robert is a cattle keeper and has been in practice for the last 20 years. His major challenge is pests and diseases that affect cows and his dream is to modernise his farm. Robert needs a loan to buy pesticides to keep his cattle healthy.

loans.use: To buy pestcides for his cattle.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is a 33-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 1.5 years to 14 years old. Hi describes himself as a God-fearing, very humble man. 

He has a clothing business in Kibuye where he sells cloth, both new and second-hand, and also provides clothing repairs. He has been in this business for 6 years and employs one person. His stall is located in a large market and his customers are primarily young ladies and boys. He describes his biggest business challenge as the cost of materials and the influx of cheap materials.

Benard will use his Kes 20,000 loan to add stock to his stall. He hopes that he will be able to expand in future and open a new stall. His goal is provide a higher level of education for his children.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en: Paz is 56 years old and a widow with three children. Paz works very hard to provide for them. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store. Paz has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, detergent and other groceries. Paz would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos tiene 33 años, convive con María de 30 años, con quien tiene 03 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Nueva Fortaleza, Pichari. El trabajo al que se dedica es el cultivo de cacao, producto que comercializa en los centros de acopio de su ciudad. Cuenta con una parcela de terreno, ahí le dedica la mayor parte del tiempo a sus plantas, fertilzandolas y realizando la poda cada cierto tiempo. 
Él nos comenta que en un inicio le fue muy difícil establecerse, pero el carácter perseverante hizo que no descuidara de sus plantas. Ahora le genera buenas ganancias, y con ella puede cubrir la necesidades de sus hijos. Esta será su primer crédito con MFP,  por el que el se compromete en pagar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,000 soles que solicita, contratarña jornaleros para que realicen la poda a sus plantas.
texts.en:
Santos is 33, and lives with María, 30. They have three children and live in their own house in the community of Nueva Fortaleza, in Pichari district.

He grows cacao, and sells it to the middlemen in the city. He has a parcel of land, and there he devotes most of his time to his plants; fertilizing and pruning them from time to time. 

He tells us that in the beginning it was very difficult for him to get established; but due to his persevering nature, he didn't neglect his plants. Now they generate good profits for him, and with those he can pay for his children's necessities. 

This will be his first loan with MFP, so he is committed to making his payments on time. With the 1,000 soles he is applying for, he will hire day laborers so that he do the pruning of his plants.

loans.use: To hire day laborers.

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en:
Celerina is 39 years old.  She is married and has 3 children who are in school.

Celerina is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional pigs to sell.

Celerina has been raising pigs for 7 years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Celerina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs to sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina  is  28 years old. She is married with five children. She has a stall that display her Ready to wear items like jeans, shirts, and more for both sex. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy additional items to sell like shoes, slippers,and blouses. Gina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business which eventually could help the family needs.

loans.use: To purchase additional ready-to-wear items like jeans and blouses to sell.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 24-year-old single Lebanese man living with his parents and one sibling. In addition to the family's main income from his father, Hassan's is also considered as an important source of financial earnings. 

He has been working in floor covering and bricks for the past eight years and he's way too good. He works independently and has his own and loyal customers. Today, he's asking to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new supplies. He notes that this will help him serve more customers and therefore increase his profits by 10%.

loans.use: to purchase new supplies

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en: Jaime is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 4 children. Jaime is providing motorcycle or habal-habal services. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy tools for maintenance and pay for gasoline. He has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Jaime hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools for maintenance and pay for gasoline.

loans.name: Grace Nora

texts.en:
This is Grace, a 36-year-old resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Roel, who is also her partner in business, and the mother of one child. Grace and her husband manage their household while operating their business. At this time, Grace is working hard to continually provide income to meet their everyday expenses.

Grace operates a room rental business. She offers rooms for rent in the family's house that local students and workers rent on a monthly basis. She also operates some arcade machines in part of the house for additional income. She earns a minimum of 5000 Philippine pesos (PHP) in rent every month.

To help her continue operating her business, Grace is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP. She will use the loan for the repair and maintenance of the rental rooms and arcade units. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Grace hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for repair and maintenance of her room rentals and arcade units.

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Mrs. Phon, 42, is a married woman who lives in Kompong Cham province. She has three children, one of whom is already married. Farming is her livelihood and she typically earns about $2.50 per day. One of her children contributes to the family’s income by selling sweet iced drinks with syrup near her house. This business is doing well. She wants to expand it gradually. 

Mrs. Phon would like to request some funds from Kiva’s lenders to purchase a sugar cane squeezing machine for her daughter to provide natural soft drinks and satisfy her customers. She is thankful to all lenders who continually help in this business.

loans.use: to purchase a sugar cane squeezing machine.

loans.name: Dilsa

texts.es:
Dilsa  de 44 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Malambo, con su cónyuge e hijo de 9 años de edad y allí mismo tiene una miscelánea,  donde vende accesorios femeninos, papelería, artículos de belleza entre otras mercancías,  de acuerdo con la exigencia de la temporada.  Su experiencia emprendedora comenzó desde hace 15 años, cuando aplicando su creatividad inició su negocio, elaborando con sus propias manos productos artesanales y aprovechando que su cónyuge era vendedor de un almacén, donde  hizo contactos comerciales en las instalaciones de pequeñas colmenas a su alrededor y  construyó su propia clientela y finalmente, hace menos de 2 años,  cuando este dejó de trabajar en el almacén, invirtieron su liquidación en una miscelánea agregando a sus productos, mercancías variadas, inicialmente sobre los pedidos y posteriormente en el marco de la época en la cual se mueve cada producto.
Como  la creatividad de Dilsa no tiene límites, así como su deseo de aprender,  además de fabricar productos en pequeños materiales de cuero, también aprendió últimamente a elaborar sandalias, que ahora exhibe en su miscelánea con mucho orgullo. Su negocio gradualmente va creciendo, porque su clientela se ha expandido, esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que comprará juguetería, aprovechando la temporada de navidad, que usualmente llega con muchos pedidos de sus clientes especialmente de juguetes, para el nacimiento del niño Dios, los niños lo reciban llenos de alegría y jugando por las calles de su municipio.
texts.en:
Dilsa is 44 years old. She lives in the town of Malambo with her husband and 9 year old son. She has a variety store in her house, where she sells women's accessories, paper products, beauty items and other merchandise, according to the season. Her enterprising experience began 15 years ago, when, using her creativity, she started her business. She made artisanal crafts with her own hands, taking advantage of the fact that her spouse worked in a store. He made commercial contacts in the small communities nearby and built their own clientele. Finally, less than 2 years ago, when her husband stopped working in the store, they invested his severance package in a variety store. They mixed their own products and various merchandise. They started selling via orders and later sold according to each season. 

Dilsa's creativity knows no limits, nor does her desire to learn. Besides making products out of materials such as leather, she also learned to make sandals, which she displays in her store with much pride. Her business is growing gradually, because her clientele has expanded. This is the reason why she has turned to a Kiva loan, the first loan she has taken out with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, she will buy toys, taking advantage of the Christmas season. Usually she has a lot of orders from her customers, especially for toys, given to children for the birth of the Christ child. They receive them with much joy and they play in the streets of town.

loans.use: to buy toys

loans.name: Lourdesita

texts.en:
Lourdesita is married and has five children. She is 54 years old and lives in  Lupagan, Clarin.

Lourdesita raises livestock to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. Lourdesita has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase a cow.  She has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Lourdesita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Palccaraqui Ii Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama “PALCCARAQUI II” y se reúnen  cada treinta días en la ciudad de Urubamba en el distrito de Urubamba. (Cusco, Perú).  El banco comunal se distingue por estar conformado por gente trabajadora,  profesionales, artesanos y comerciantes. El grupo está conformado ocho integrantes y es la primera vez que solicitan un préstamo de la Asociación Arariwa y el dinero lo invertirán para mejorar sus negocios. 

En esta reunión conocimos a la señora Lucia y nos cuenta que ella nació en la ciudad de Quillabamba y ahora vive en la ciudad de Urubamba en el poblado de Palcaraqui junto con  sus tres hijos (Brenda de 18 años, Lenin de 15 años y Arnold de 11 años). Desde joven se caracterizo por ser una persona responsable y amable y por ese motivo sus vecinas le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal. Lucia es enfermera y trabaja en una posta de salud de la ciudad de Urubamba, ella también se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales menores. Ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para el mantenimiento de la casa ósea quiere comprar maderas y cemento.  Ella tiene 42 años de edad, es una persona con muchas ganas de superarse y tener un negocio exitoso día con día, siempre con el deseo de brindarle lo mejor a su familia. El sueño de la socia es ver profesionales a sus hijos.
texts.en:
This group is called “Palccaraqui II” and meets every 30 days in the city and district of Urubamba (Cusco, Peru).  The Communal Bank is distinguished for having hardworking individuals who are professionals, artisans, and merchants.  There are eight members and this is the first time they have requested a loan from Asociación Arariwa.  The money will be invested in the improvement of their businesses.  

At this meeting, the staff of Asociación Arariwa met with Sra. Lucia.  She indicated that she was born in the city of Quillabamba, but now resides in the subdivision of Palcaraqui in the city of Urubamba.  Lucia lives with her three children:  Brenda – 18, Lenin - 15, and Arnold – 11.  From a young age, Lucia has been known for being a responsible and friendly person.  Her neighbors encouraged and invited her to participate in the Communal Bank.  

Lucia is a nurse and works at a health clinic in the city of Urubamba.  She also engages in farming and raising small animals.  Lucia is taking this opportunity to request a loan for home maintenance.  She plans to buy wood and cement.  Lucia is 42 years and has great desire to succeed and do well in her business day after day so that she can always provide the best for her family.  Her dream is to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy wood and cement for home improvements.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is married with three children who are currently going to school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  Leah has a fishing business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 10 years.

Leah has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials for the repair of her fishing boat. In the future, Leah would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for the repair of her fishing boat

loans.name: Gerardo Ramon

texts.es: Gerardo es un microempresario de éxito y además es agricultor durante toda su vida herencia de sus padres, el cultiva maíz y el mismo lo comercializa en los mercados del país, tiene 13 años que la institución le brinda financiamiento para su agricultura, es un emprendedor casado y tiene 58 años de edad, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes como abono, urea, alquiler de terreno, granos para la siembra, desgranado, sacos etc.
texts.en: On top of being a successful micro entrepreneur, Gerardo has been a farmer all of his life, an activity he has inherited from his parents. He plants corn and sells it in the various markets of the country. Gerardo is 58 years old and he is a married man. Our institution has been granting him loans for his agriculture activity for 13 years. This new loan he is requesting will be used to buy manure and urea, seeds to plant, corn off the cob, sacks and to pay rent for his lands.

loans.use: To buy manure and urea, seeds to plant, corn off the cob, sacks and to pay rent for his lands.

loans.name: Mahugnon 1 Group

texts.fr: MAHUGNON 1 est un groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans la même zone. Léké Solange, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 48 ans n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Léké Solange est mariée à un certain Vincent. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Léké Solange vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont supportées par Léké Solange et son mari. Léké Solange vend des bassines et des plastiques depuis trois ans. Léké Solange s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Léké Solange sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUGNON 1 dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: Acheter des bassines et des plastiques

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Despite the importance of farming to the economy of Kenya most financial institutions don’t fund farmers. Juhudi Kilimo is different and is provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Kenyan farmers. 
Meet Consolata, an ever-smiling, hardworking, and honest mother who is 41 years of age. She hails from the Nandihills area of Kenya. She is the proud mother of eight lovely children. She loves and treasures her children and will go the extra mile to make sure that they are comfortable. 
Consolata’s primary source of income has been selling milk, crop farming, and poultry farming. Through these ventures she has been able to earn a decent income. She is a very determined and dedicated farmer who has been farming and throughout, she has never regretted going into farming. 
Although this humble mum has been making profits, not everything has been okay She faces financial challenges, and because the Kopere, Nandihills area has proven a ready market for cereals, she is kindly seeking a loan to buy cereals for re-sale and thus improve her income. 
Through Juhudi Kilimo, Consolata has received training and she has proven to be honest and disciplined with finances. She intends to fully repay the loan with the profits from her business. Consolata is quite visionary and with her accumulated profits hopes she will be able to open a large cereal-selling shop that will boost her income and turn her life around.
Help her so that she can also have a big smile during this festive season.

loans.use: To buy cereals for re-sale.

loans.name: Percilliano

texts.en: Percilliano has signed up her membership with PMPC and availed the needed capital to start up a rice production business. He is thankful for the capital it extends to a small time loaner like him. Percilliano is able to turn the tide in his favor and has made good sales these days. He wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, he availed a loan to pay for land preparation like plowing & harrowing and purchase of good variety of seedlings for healthier, heavier and more produce. In the future, he hopes to mount a descent home for the family.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation like plowing & harrowing and purchase of good variety of seedlings for healthier, heavier and more produce

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria sells perfumes, cosmetics, shampoo, natural medicines and other vitamins. She learned to be a saleswoman from her parents who are also in the same line of works. She is in need of a loan in order to invest in products. She is especially interested in diversifying her line of natural medicines because her clients are satisfied with the results and they have become very popular items. Maria is 41 years old and has 3 children. Her oldest daughter is married but still lives with Maria at home. Maria has been separated from her husband for 5 years and she has had to play the role of mother and father to her 2 younger children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in natural medicines and vitamins

loans.name: Ameenullah

texts.en:
Ameenullah is 27 years old, single, and has a shop in district 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He has been working in his current business, selling shoes, for about 3 years. During the Taliban government he sold 2nd hand shoes and after there was peace he opened a new shoe shop to cover his family financially and develop his business.

Ameenullah is happy with the procedure of AFSG, giving loans to people to increase their business. He took a 1st individual loan to design his shop and buy shoes.

loans.use: Buying Shoes

loans.name: Kit

texts.en:
Mrs. Kit S. is a 27-year-old mother of one child who lives with her husband in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She is a good housewife who looks after the children and cooks meals, while her husband works very hard in a field with his two healthy cows growing, cultivating and plowing soil for his new coming crops. Meanwhile, he typically makes around $3.5/days from his produce. In order to maximize their revenue, Kit S. is asking for a $1000 loan to purchase some seeds and two healthy cows, which would be a big help for her husband's agricultural pursuits.

For the next coming year, her husband hopes to introduce a great variety of crops, especially some kinds of vegetables which are so common for his clients' needs. With this increasing size, he hopes he would have enough money to find a better education for his children.

loans.use: To purchase some seeds and two healthy cows to help her husband in his agricultural pursuits

loans.name: Yorleny

texts.es:
Business Description

Yorleny used to work doing domestic chores from her home. She has 1 year of experience on cosmetic sales. She was motivated to start her own business by her aunt and Yorleny was able to gather the capital toinvest in cosmetics. She has her own business thanks to her determination to save some money to start it. She works every day of the week from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. Yorleny has a good clientele to whom she distributes her products.

Loan Investment

The loan will be use to buy cosmetics and other products that she sells like: perfumes and costume jewelry. Yorleny also plans to invest some of the money in clothes too since she has orders already.

Personal Information

Yorleny is 26 years old and has 3 children. Two of the children go to school. Her husband works as a bricklayer and helps with the expenses at home. Her small home is made out of reed and has only one room (her dining room and bedroom are together). Her wish is to provide security for her residence where her children can grow without fears.

Traslated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Yorleny tiene experiencia de 1 año en su negocio. Ella se dedicaba a trabajar realizando quehaceres domésticos en casa. Por medio de una tía, se motiva a conseguir un capital para invertir en cosméticos. Gracias a sus ahorros tiene su negocio. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. Tiene una buena cartera de clientes a los que le distribuye sus productos.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de cosméticos como lo son: perfumes, bisutería, joyas. Además piensa invertir algo de prendas de vestir para la venta ya que tiene pedidos.

Información Personal

Yorleny tiene 26 años. Y 3 hijos de los cuales 2 estudian. Su esposo trabaja realizando trabajos de albañilería. Con lo que también ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Su casita es de caña y tiene un solo ambiente. Es decir comedor y dormitorio junto. Su deseo es poder darle seguridad a su domicilio donde sus hijos puedan crecer sin temores.

loans.use: To invest in cosmetics other products for her business.

loans.name: Ni Wayan Sukarmi

texts.id:
Wayan Sukarmi’s husband works as a skilled construction laborer whose monthly income is unpredictable. To pay for food and her children’s education she needs Rp 700.000 (about USD80) per month. With her pig breeding business she is able to supplement her husband’s income. Currently, she has 1 breeder sow, each birthing produces 10 to 12 piglets every 4 months, worth Rp 250.000 (about USD30). With this loan of Rp 1.300.000 (USD150), she intends to purchase feed increase the number of breeder sows thus increasing her income to cover her family’s expenses.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Suami Wayan Sukarmi bekerja sebagai seorang buruh tukang bangunan yang memiliki penghasilan tidak tetap setiap bulannya.Untuk Biaya makan dan biaya sekolah anaknya dalam satu bulan memerlukan dan Rp 700.000 dengan usaha inilah Wayan Sukarmi dapat membantu pendapatan suaminya yaitu menjalankan usaha beternak babi.Saat ini Wayan Sukarmi memelihara 1 Ekor induk babi yang sekali melahirkan anak bisa mencapai 10 sampai 12 ekor per 4 Bulan yang harga perekornya Rp 250.000. Dengan pinjaman sebesar Rp.1.300.000,- ini Wayan Sukarmi pergunakan untuk membeli pakan dan juga rencananya ingin menambah jumlah induk babinya agar jumlah pendapatannya bertambah untuk bisa menutupi biaya kebutuhan kelurganya setiap bulan.

loans.use: Purchase Breeder Sow (female pig) and feed (Membeli induk babi dan pakan ternak)

loans.name: Aleircina Medina

texts.en:
Aleircina is an active and very positive woman who is striving to make a living.  She is married with four children.  Two of them, the eldest, attend the public school of the town.  Her husband is a taxi driver. 
Aleircina is a clever businesswoman and her entrepreneurial spirit has helped her be successful in her business activities.  
Six months ago, she took a loan from our organization and started to sell clothes for children.  She operates her business in a public place and could obtain a lot of customers.
She says that with this activity she better supports her family and now she can save money for emergency issues.
Currently, the entrepreneur needs more credit to make her business larger.  She wants to buy larger quantities of garments in Santo Domingo, the capital, in order to augment her sales and income.  As such, Aleircina will have more facilities to help her husband financially support the family.

loans.use: To purchase big quantities of children's clothes in order to make her business larger.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her grocery business

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie M. is a 35-year-old married woman. Her husband is a taxi driver. She has 3 children who attend primary and high school. She has been selling “attieke” made with cassava (a local food) and fried fish, a food appreciated by Ivorian people. She used her first loan from AE&I to increase her goods. She sells her food outside and next to a road, which is a problem for customers because cars and taxis stir up dust in the area of the restaurant. She uses the money from her business to help her husband with their household expenses. She hopes to settle down in a better place for her health and for the health of her customers. She will use the loan as capital to improve business conditions and to earn additional profit.

loans.use: To improve business conditions

loans.name: Darling

texts.es:
Darling learned farming from her husband who worked in the fields at a very young age. They live in Ticuantepe, an agricultural area with a high potential for eco tourism. For the last 30 years, she and her husband have dedicated themselves to growing the most predominant crop in the area, pineapple, as well as, bananas, oranges, lemons and mandarins (citrus). The municipality has excellent farming conditions because of the climate and arable land, both favourable for agriculture. This is how these parents prepared their children, who are university students preparing themselves for a better life.

She explains that the production process of different crops includes chemical control of bushes, as the crops need to be free of them to develop properly; to this end, 3 cycles of chemical control -- herbicides and man power -- are needed during this process. Unfortunately, this process is expensive and Darling can't afford it at the moment. She needs a loan to cover the costs, as the success of her crops depend on it.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Darling aprendió de su esposo el oficio de la agricultura, quien desde muy joven ha trabajado en el campo, habitan en Ticuantepe una zona altamente productiva con un alto potencial para el ecoturismo. Hace 30 años la señora junto a su esposo se dedican al cultivo de piña siendo este el más predominante de la zona, así como banano, naranjas, limones y mandarinas (cítricos), debido a la excelente condiciones agro climática y la fertilización de las tierras que presenta dicho municipio, las cuales son favorables para la actividad agrícola. Es de esta manera como estos padres han preparado a sus 2 hijos quienes se encuentran estudiando en la universidad, preparándose para un mejor futuro.

La señora explica que el proceso productivo de los diferentes cultivos requieren de un control químico para la malezas de las plantaciones durante el desarrollo vegetativo, ya que requieren estar libre de malezas; para ello se debe realizar por lo menos tres controles químicos a lo largo de todo el proceso, a base de herbicidas combinadas con controles manuales y esto tiene un alto costo que ella no puede cubrir en estos momentos, es por eso que necesita un préstamo para poder cubrir esos gastos, ya que de esto depende el éxito de su cosecha.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and herbicide for her crops.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity T. owns a shop where she makes hair for people living in her community; she also sells cloth. She is married with a child and is 27 years old. She has been in business since 2004 and hails from Edo State, Nigeria. She spent 1 year and 6 months learning the business. She needs the loan of $450 to buy cloth in bulk for sale.

loans.use: To buy cloth for sale

loans.name: Kung

texts.en: Kung C. is 44 years old, unmarried, and working as both a farmer and an electrician in Siem Reap Province. He makes $6 U.S. per day in his business. Kung wants to make his farm more efficient by purchasing a water pump that will be used to better irrigate his fields, thus his request for a $300 loan..

loans.use: To purchase a water pump.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria, from a very young age has been a farmer. This being a very common profession in her area and in her family from whom she learned the trade. Thanks to her efforts her production and economic stability at home have improved greatly. She hopes to continue achieving the dreams of her beloved children and with this motive she hopes to solicit a loan in order to purchase more fertilizers.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

Gloria, desde muy pequeña se ha dedicado a la agricultura siendo este una labor muy común en su localidad y dentro de su familia de quienes aprendió los gajes del oficio.Gracias a su desempeño continuo su producción y economía dentro de su hogar han mejorado mucho. Su deseo es continuar con el desarrollo de los sueños de sus amados hijos y por esa razón solicita un préstamo a fin de adquirir mayor cantidad de abonos y fertilizantes.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers

loans.name: Ines

texts.en:
Ines, a member of the Village Bank Retoño, is 35 years old, married, and has five children. Ines has a car washing business at her house, and at the beginning she had very few clients. However, thanks to the great service she offers and the quality of her products, she has been able to develop a client base surpassing all other car washing services. Furthermore, Ines dedicates much of her leisure time to her business. She now needs a loan of $425 to renovate the floor of her car wash so that the runoff doesn’t infiltrate her home.

Ines´s dreams are to have a stock of car lubricants, continue developing her business, and have her children grow up to be professionals.

loans.use: To renovate the floor of her car wash in order to avoid infiltration into her home.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.en:
Fortunata is a member of the Ccori Soncco Village Bank (meaning Gold Heart in Quechua, the native language of Peru).

Forutnata is a married 55-year-old mother of five children. Fortunata travels to different regional fairs where she sells wool, brooms, cleaning tools, combs, and flashlights, among other goods. Furthermore, Fortunata buys avocados and oranges at the regional fairs and sells them to middlemen in the city of Ayacucho.

Fortunata needs a loan of 1600 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($575 USD) that she will invest in more wool, avocados, batteries, creams, and soaps to further expand her business.

Fortunata dreams to improve her business, improve her home and that her children become professionals.

loans.use: Fortunata needs a loan that she will invest in more wool, avocados, batteries, creams, and soaps to further expand her business.

loans.name: Helena's Jerusalem Group

texts.en:
Helena is a 46-year-old married woman with three children, aged 16, 20, and 26. She has been a clothes seller since 2007. Every day, she works from 9am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $US100 from her sales.

Helena now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Martha, who has a business dealing with farming.

loans.use: To buy more clothing inventory

loans.name: Thi Thanh Tam

texts.vi: Tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương năm 2003, ngay từ vòng vốn đầu tiên chị Tâm đã sử dụng để đầu tư cho chăn nuôi. Tận dụng nguồn thức ăn sẵn có của gia đình và kinh nghiệm chăn nuôi đã được tích luỹ trong nhiều năm nên dự án đã cho kết quả  rất tốt. Các vòng vốn tiếp theo chị Tâm đều sử dụng vào chăn nuôi lợn, đến nay gia đình chị đã có khu chăn nuôi đủ tiêu chuẩn với khoảng gần 20 con lợn. Hiện tại ngoài công việc chăn nuôi hàng ngày chị Tâm còn đi chợ để buôn bán rau. Công việc buôn bán cũng đem lại nguồn thu khá ổn định cho gia đình chị. Chị Tâm có một người con gái hiện đang đi làm và có thu nhập ổn định 2.000.000đ/ tháng nên hàng tháng chị đều nhận được sự hỗ trợ thêm từ con gái. Với mong muốn cuộc sống của gia đình ngày càng ổn định và phát triển, chị mong muốn được vay thêm 15.000.000đ để đâu tư vào chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Joined the TYM Fund in 2003, Mrs. Tam used the first loan to raise livestock. With the readily available animal feed in her house and her experiences in raising livestock, the project was very successful. The subsequent loans were also used to invest in rearing pigs.
