She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rowena is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional piglets, vitamins, and feeds for her business.

Rowena has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from selling electronic reloads (prepaid cell phone credits), a sari-sari store, and food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional piglets, vitamins, and feeds for her business

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.ru: Людмла – вдова, мать четверых детей. Она начала свой бизнес 8 лет назад, так как не имела другой возможности содержать свою семью. Благодаря напористости и решительности, Людмила смогла развить свой бизнес, который стал небольшим, но стабильным источником дохода. Людмила просит выдать ей кредит в размере 5,000 гривен на закупку сезонного товара. Она надеется получить дополнительную прибыль и приобрести кухонный комбайн.
texts.en: Ludmila is a widow and a mother of four children.  She started her business 8 years ago because she had no other option to support her family.  Thanks to her persistence and decisiveness, Ludmila was able to develop her business, which became a small, but stable source of income.  Ludmila is requesting a loan in the sum of 5,000 hryvnia to purchase seasonal merchandise.  She hopes to make an additional profit and buy a kitchen food processor.

loans.use: to buy seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Srom

texts.en: Ms. Srom is a hard-working and conscientious person, located in Baray district of Kompong Thom Province, Cambodia. She is married to the loving father of their two kids, who attend school .  What she most wants is to offer her children a better quality of life. Presently, she is a sewing factory worker in Phnom Penh city, where she can get enough salary to cover her family’s expenses. To assist her income, her lovely husband is a local construction worker. From this type of business, he can earn $9 for each day. To upgrade their living conditions, this humble couple wish to build a house.  However,  they lack equity so they would like to request some funds through HKL, a partner with Kiva.  Srom expects that, through this loan, her family will find happiness and prosperity. Srom wants to have her children educated to a high level. This is her third loan with HKL and the first loan with Kiva as a partner. This humble couple sends thanks in advance to all generous lenders who always help her family.

loans.use: to build a  house.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy is a 32-year-old married woman who lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She has two children: one son and one daughter. Her husband lives with her and supports the family by woking as a bricklayer.

Thuy runs a general store to earn a living. She sells spices, candy, cigarettes, lighters, shampoo and toothpaste. She has done this for three years. 

Thuy is asking for a loan to buy a greater range of food and general goods to stock her store and better meet the needs of her customers. She hopes the loan will help her to increase her income and enable her to set aside some savings.

loans.use: to buy more kinds of food and general goods to stock her general store.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has six children who all go to school. She has no additional family members. 

She sells passion fruit on a retail basis at the market. She also makes passion fruit juice. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of passion fruit. She gets additional income through her video library. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler, to build more commercial houses, and to educate her children up to university level. 

Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of passion fruit

loans.name: Kamila

texts.en: Kamila is a 32 year-old woman who raises and sells cattle in the small village of Imishli city. Kamila is married and has three children. Cattle breeding is the only financial income in her family. She has five years of experience in this field. Her monthly income from cattle selling is 350 AZN.  She applied for a 1,200 AZN loan in order to purchase more cattle and improve the life of her beloved children.

loans.use: to purchase three cattle and fodder.

loans.name: Mơ's Group

texts.en:
Mơ is a 50 year-old female living in the town of Yen Phong district - Bac Ninh province. Mơ is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Đồng Thôn 3 (16).

Mơ is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To making a living, Mơ owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock, primarily chickens, for sale. Mơ has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2010, Mơ joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities.  Mơ has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. She is now requesting a new loan of 7,392,000 VND, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies used in raising quail and chicken. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Mơ from SEDA. Mơ plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Phượng is a 28 year-old female who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock (pigs).
2.  Liên is a 28 year-old female who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock (pigs and chickens).
3.  Hạnh is a 22 year-old female who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock (chickens).

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a responsible woman who helps Roque, her husband, in their farming business. They go down to the field every day to ensure they cultivate good crops. She has been in this business for nearly 10 years. Rice farming is the family's primary source of income. Though she encounters some problems in her farming business, especially during a flood season, she still aims to overcome these trials to provide for the needs of her family. 

She is now asking for a loan of PHP 45,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and herbicides for farming. 

Through her patience and perseverance, she believes she will improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and herbicides for farming.

loans.name: Ronel

texts.en:
Ronel is 33 years old and single. He has one child. For the past five years Ronel has had a shop where he makes and sells candies and pulvoron, a type of shortbread.

Ronel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. He is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy the raw ingredients to make his snacks.

Ronel hopes to see his business grow.

loans.use: to buy the raw ingredients to make his snacks.

loans.name: Romela

texts.en:
Romela works hard to support her family. Romela is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Romela requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing equipment.

Romela has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Romela would like to save enough money so that she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing equipment.

loans.name: Emprendedores De Pampahasi Group

texts.es: La señora Carmen es la presidenta de banco de emprendimiento Emprendedores de Pampahasi, todas las socias viven en la zona de Pampahasi de ahí el nombre, la Sra. Carmen es un apersona muy responsable y trabajadora siempre solidaria con su compañeras por tal motivo la eligieron como presidenta, ella se dedica a la venta de  cd's de colección en la zona de Villa Fátima es ambulante trabaja con el hijo que tiene 2 años de edad el esposo trabaja como ayudante de minibús viven en alquiler y ambos corren con los gastos del hogar, el dinero del  crédito lo utilizara en la compra de cd bailables para este año nuevo ya que tiene gran demanda, la Sra. Carmen es una persona muy trabajadora siempre esta diversificando sus productos, en un futuro desea alquilar una tienda para poder vender sus productos y así de esta manera incrementar mas su capital de trabajo, se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo brindado
texts.en: Carmen is the president of the Emprendedores de Pampahasi (Entrepreneurs of Pampahasi) communal bank. All the members live in the area of Pampahasi, which is where they got the name. Carmen is a very responsible and hard-working person who is always supportive of her fellow members, so they elected her president. She sells collectible CDs in the area of Villa Fátima. She sells door-to-door and she works with her son, who is 2 years old. Her husband works as a minibus assistant. They rent, and they both pay household expenses. She will use the money from the loan to purchase a CD of dance songs for this new year, since she has a lot of demand. Carmen is a very hard-working person and is always diversifying her products. In the future, she wants to rent a shop in order to be able to sell her products and in this way further increase her business capital. She is very thankful for the help she is receiving.

loans.use: to purchase CDs of dance songs for the new year

loans.name: Lucille

texts.en:
Lucille is a 32-year-old married woman with two young children aged eleven and two. Her husband works as a driver. Lucille lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with her family.

Lucille has been a farmer for five years. She grows rice and vegetables to sell at her town's market. Lucille earns about 6000 PHP per month through farming. She plans to use her loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and other farm inputs.

In the future, Lucille hopes for her children to finish college, and for her family to have a better quality of living.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en: Sherlita operates a computer shop and mushroom production business. She is 52 years old and married to a farmer. The couple has been blessed with three children and all of them are married. Sherlita would like to borrow 5,000 PHP to be used to purchase 1,000 banana leaves and spawn for mushroom production. She hopes for continuous growth of her mushroom production through her additional capital. In this way, she could sustain her family's basic needs and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase 1,000 banana leaves and mushroom spawn for her mushroom production business.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
For the past three years, Lucia raises hogs to support the needs of the entire household. She  hails from the town of Sikatuna.   She is forty-eight-year old married woman with seven  children, whom three are still attending school. Her husband's way of earning a living is by being a laborer.

She raises and sold hogs to the locals in her community. She would like to augment her income and need adequate funds to make it. That is why Lucia join Kiva's field partner CEVI to cater the financial services.

Lucia has requested a loan to purchase piglets and feed. These could boost her income and  in few months to come, she would be able to raise quality hogs. In that way, she would able to support her family and provide better living condition.

She is hoping that someday, she will be successful and to have her own capital in order to be sustainable .

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Juana Patricia

texts.en:
In the city of Monclova, Coahuila lives Juanita, a married woman and mother of three children. Some time ago her husband had to leave to work some place else, but the money that he was sending them was not always steady. Given this situation she started to make and sell home made foods in her very own community. Despite her husband\'s absence Juanita has been able to make it with the love for her children and her unquestionable integrity. She counts on the unconditional support of her children that actively help her in the business she runs day after day.

They now need you. They require a loan in the amount of $250, to be able to fill all the orders placed and purchase all the ingredients necessary. Help Juanita provide stable sustenance to her children, now that she finds herself alone. You can help her now. Make your decision. She thanks you for it.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

En la localidad de Monclova Coahuila vive Juanita, casada y madre de 3 hijos. Hace algún tiempo que su marido tuvo que partir a laborar en otro lugar, pero el dinero que les envía no siempre es seguro, ante esta situación ella se encontraba muy preocupada por la integridad y estudios de sus hijos, es por ello que comenzó a elaborar alimentos y venderlos ahí mismo en la colonia donde vive. A pesar de la ausencia de su esposo, Juanita ha logrado salir adelante por el amor a sus hijos y su indudable entereza. Ella cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de sus hijos, quienes le ayudan activamente en la actividad que realiza día con día.

Ellos ahora te necesitan, pues requieren de un préstamo por la cantidad de $250 DLLS, para poder hacer frente a todo los pedidos que tiene en puerta y comprar todos los insumos necesarios, ayuda a Juanita a brindarle un sustento estable a sus hijos, ya que se encuentra sola. Tú puedes apoyarla ahora, decídete, ella te lo agradece.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Ziyafat

texts.en:
Ziyafat is 37, lives in Salyan region, Yenikand village. He is married and has a child. He is happy with this business. He has 5 years experience in this business. He wants to improve his services to his customers.

Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy spare parts.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
Yvonne was born in 1973.  She is married  has 3 children. She is a school dropout. She dropped out of school when her father died when she had not yet completed her education and this caused her to look for some one to give her assistance. Even when she got married, her husband could not afford enough money to send her back to school, considering the fact that he (a technician) is not getting contracts to provide for the family and other expenditures. Yvonne has taken and repaid loans from GHAPE. She   is asking for another loan to enable her expand her business. She feels that with a bigger loan, she will be able to provide fowl and pigs to those who sell processed chicken and pork. She is involved in the sale of cabbages and other foods.   The profit will enable her to support her husband to educate and bring up their children.
Yvonne will repay the loan during the term.

loans.use: Pig farming and poultry

loans.name: Saitia

texts.en: Saitia is thirty seven years of age. She is a mother of nine children, including five that are in school. Her business is selling vegetables such as beans, cucumbers, tomatoes and pumpkins. Saitia’s husband is unemployed but he works on his plantation himself. changes. She sells the vegetables at the market when there is a lot, but usually she sells her product in the village. She earns $240 a week from vegetables and $198 from the plantation. Saitia’s vision is to expand her business by exporting her product overseas.She is requesting a loan to buy seeds and pesticides.

loans.use: :To buy vegetable seeds and pesticides.”

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
I am 27 years old and for a living, I do machine embroidery for a local boutique who in turn gives me $35 USD a month. I am the mother of only one daughter. My husband is an electrician and works for an electric shop in a nearby town for an income of just $30 USD a month. We are hardly surviving with this meager income.

However, as an adage quotes “luck favors the brave,” I know that I am brave and can change my circumstances. I am quite skillful at my work and now I wish to make a small boutique of my own. I therefore request you to provide me with a $325 USD loan.

loans.use: To start her own boutique

loans.name: Migdalia Cabral

texts.en:
Migdalia is very active, with all the youthful energy and positivity of a hard-working woman.  She is 20 years old and has a one-year-old son.  She dedicates herself to the sale of tennis shoes, shirts and pants.  She started her business six months ago with a loan which she had taken from our organization.  She wisely used the funds and could repay the loan on time.
She gets the products in the capital and resells them in her community and other provinces.  Her mother helps her , since she works every weekend in the field and got a lot of customers there.
The entrepreneur confesses that her midterm plan is to have a location to run the clothes store.  Meanwhile she is working a lot selling good in the streets.  
She plans to invest the loan requested to buy more second-hand tennis shoes and shirts to sell in December.  That way the entrepreneur will have more means to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: The funds will be used to buy second-hand clothes and shoes to supply the entrepreneur's business.

loans.name: Umsah

texts.en: Umsah is 38-year-old woman who has a food stall at her house, where she prepares and sells coconut milk rice and some crackers. She could earn US$7.50 per day. Unfortunately, her husband, R., has no fixed income. Umsah is a member of MBK and requests a loan to make her business sustainable and hopes that it will increase her income. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To make her business sustainable

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa is 43 years old and is a valiant mother who, due to adversities which touched her life, is eager to move forward. For the last few years she has suffered from thefts in her home and her business [buying and selling of gold] had to be abandoned, leaving her in a very bad economical condition. To add to this unfortunate series of events her husband abandoned her, leaving her alone to care for their young boys. Since then she decided to begin fresh, with all of the eagerness, strength and insistence that characterizes her, in order to obtain what she wants. She opened a small grocery store which also offers a phone calling service, a strategy that was very important in oder to attract more customers. Finally this persistent mother with much dilligence and strength is concretely achieveing one of her dreams, establishing a hardware store that sells construction materials. She is certain that this business will provide her dear sons with professional careers, a thought that motivates her to push forward. Elsa's desire is to obtain a loan which will permit her to expand this business. Your investment will not be wasted in the hand of this dilligent and valiant mother.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Elsa de 43 años de edad es una valerosa madre que a pesar de las adversidades que le ha tocado vivir sigue deseosa de salir adelante; desdichadamente hace algunos años sufrió un robo en su domicilio y su negocio de compra y venta de oro tuvo que ser abandonado, este hecho la dejo en muy mala condición económica, para finalizar su infortunio su esposo la abandonó dejándola sola con sus dos menores hijos.Desde entonces decidió empezar de nuevo, con el mismo ahínco, fuerza y empeño que le caracteriza para lograr lo que quiere. Aperturó su pequeña tiendita de abarrotes, en ella también brindaba servicio de llamadas telefónicas al público, estrategia que fue muy importante para captar más clientes, finalmente esta empeñosa madre con mucha diligencia y esfuerzo está logrando concretas uno de sus sueños, poner su gran ferretería, está segura que con este negocio podrá brindarles carreras profesionales a sus queridos hijos quienes en todo momento la motivaron para seguir adelante.El deseo de doña Elsa es adquirir un préstamo de dinero que le permitirá implementar aún más su negocio.Tu inversión no será malgastada en las manos de esta diligente y valerosa madre.

loans.use: Deposit in order to establish a small hardware store that sells construction materials

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Mrs. Eb Savy, 18, works as a housewife staying at home and cooking food for her husband. Her husband Mr. Sen P., 21, is a motor-taxi driver who makes on average $5 a day. To make more profit Mr. Sen wants to buy a trailer so he can transport not only people but also heavy goods. To achieve this, he needs a loan from Kiva of US$ 400 to purchase the trailer.

loans.use: purchase a trailer for his motor-taxi

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana D. is married and has four children. She has been a fishmonger for the past eleven years. She buys the fish on the docks of Elmina (a small fishing village 5 km from Cape Coast) and sells them to local villagers. She is requesting a loan of $525.00 to have enough capital to buy fish in bulk.

Juliana is also the leader of a lending group called “Mawunyo Traders” that consists of 13 borrowers in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy fish in bulk

loans.name: Mwanahawa's Majengo D Group

texts.en:
Mwanahawa is 30 years old and is married with 2 children, ages 10 and 3. Mwanahawa owns a small grocery, which she started in 2006. Every day she works from 7:00 AM to 10:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items (alcohol and soft drinks) for her grocery. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Mariam and Rahma, who have businesses dealing in tailoring and grocery and fish sales.

loans.use: To buy more items (alcohol and soft drinks) for her grocery

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza is a diligent mother who left her native village of Sandia with many ideas about how to make a life for herself. She used her savings to buy a van to provide urban transit to the Juliacan public. She has also dedicated herself to selling gasoline, and with the two businesses she was able to build her home. This cheerful woman dreams of getting this loan, which she will use to fix her van, currently in need of repairs.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Esperanza, es una diligente madre que salió de su pueblo natal, Sandia, con muchas perspectivas para prosperar en la vida, con los ahorros que disponía decidió adquirir una combi y brindar servicios de transporte urbano a la población Juliaqueña, adicionalmente a este oficio viene dedicándose a la venta de combustible; negocios con los que ha logrado construir su vivienda.El deseo de esta alegre dama es adquirir un préstamo que tiene pensado invertir en la reparación de su vehículo que en estos momentos se encuentra paralizado.

loans.use: Repair her public transit vehicle

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph A. sells second-hand goods. He is single and his income is not sufficient for his expenses. Demand for his goods is high, and he is looking to expand his business to increase his profits. He is asking for additional capital to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his business selling second-hand goods.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa is a merchant and dedicates herself to selling masitas (small sweet breads and pastries). She has two children, and her home is in the Irpavi II area of La Paz. Her job is to buy masitas from local bakeries and sell them retail at her post. This is the second loan she has requested, and her history categorizes her as a good client who fulfills her obligations. This loan will be used to purchase larger quantities of masitas, because demand for her products has grown considerably. This will increase her income and help her improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

Rosa es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de masitas (son pequeños panes dulces y pasteles); tiene dos hijos a quienes mantiene. Su actividad economica es comprar masitas de los hornos y venderlas en su puesto al detalle Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Irpavi II de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir como cliente bueno en el pago de su obligación. El crédito será destinado para la compra de mayor cantidad de masitas, en vista de que la demanda ha aumentado considerablemente. El crédito le ayudara a mejorar sus condiciones de vida ya que aumentará sus ingresos en sus ventas.

loans.use: Purchase larger quantities of sweet bread and other pastries to sell / Compra de mayor cantidad de pequeños pan dulce y otros pasteles para su negocio de venta de los mismos.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 34-year-old married woman with 4 children, ages between 2 and 22. She owns a small general store where she works every day. Jane can earn a monthly profit of about $US550 from her sales.

Jane now hopes for a loan to buy more inventory for her store.

loans.use: To increase inventory.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru: Холбоева Матлюба жительница Бохтарского района. 15 лет занимается торговлей . Торгует на центральном рынке  материалами. Живет со своей семьей в центре района. Она замужем и имеет двоих детей. Планирует получить кредит сроком на шесть месяцев. Использовать деньги хочет в целях бизнеса, то есть увеличить товарооборот. Это поможет увеличить ассортимент товара и привлечь новых клиентов.
texts.en:
Matluba H. lives with her family in the center of Bohtarskiy region. She had been in the business of textile sales for the last 15 years. She has a space in a central market that she uses to sell different textiles. She is married and has 2 children. Matluba plans to obtain a loan for 6 months and use the money to increase her inventory. This will help her to attract new customers and improve her business.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan es un hombre muy trabajador y emprendedor, dedicado al cuidado de sus terrenos de cultivo y sobre todo de sus animales, a quienes les debe el pan de cada día, por ello trata de atenderlos de la mejor manera.  Juan es uno de los agricultores más dedicados, todas las mañanas lo ven pasar por las calles rumbo a su trabajo, es una de las personas más respetables de la zona, quien a sabido ser ejemplo para sus hijos y para los demás.  Esa valentía y ganas que le pone a su labor como agricultor, es lo que resalta en este hombre, consagrado a su familia y sus campos.  Sin embargo, tiene dificultades y problemas económicos que le están trayendo desniveles y pérdidas, por ello solicita  su apoyo con el préstamo de 1300 soles para incrementar su producción, y si es posible adquirir un toro.
texts.en:
Juan is a very hard-working and enterprising man who works cultivating his farmland and caring for his animals. It is to them that he owes his daily bread, so he tries to take care of them as best he can. Juan is one of the most dedicated farmers and every morning the town sees him walking to his work. He is one of the most respected people in the area and is known as an example for his children and the rest of the town. The courage and earnest he puts into his job as a farmer is what stands out in this man, devoted to his family and his farmland. Nonetheless, he has difficulties and financial problems that are bringing him irregularities and losses. For this reason he is requesting your help with a loan of 1300 soles ($450) to increase his production and also possibly buy a bull.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase crop production and buy another bull

loans.name: Suraiya M.khalid Group

texts.en:
Suraiya baji is the wife of M. and has been living in the city of Riwind, Pakistan for the past 30 years. She is the mother of six children: five sons and one daughter who are all enrolled in a neighborhood school. Suraiya baji’s husband has been selling wood for the past 20 years. For the past 5 years, Suraiya baji has been working in the thread making business but she also does household work and takes care of her family.

Suraiya baji has successfully repaid her prior three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). She is now applying for a loan to buy more wood to expand her husband’s wood selling business. She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Allah Rakhi baji is requesting a loan to buy thread for resale. Jamila baji is requesting a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Nasreen baji is requesting a loan to buy clothes for resale.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible for repayment.

loans.use: To buy wood for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sweets and candies

loans.name: Nelsa Margarita

texts.en:
Nelsa is a member of the Bonanza Village Bank. Nelsa is 38 years old and lives with her partner and their two daughters. Nelsa bakes traditional Peruvian breads in her parents’ oven, as do her siblings. She works seven days a week, and sells her bread in the Santa Clara Market in the afternoon. Nelsa needs a loan of 600 soles to buy lard and sugar. Nelsa dreams of owning a large store and a chicken restaurant and that her children will graduate from college with professional degrees.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow: Nelsa es socia del Banco Comunal Bonanza. Nelsa es conviviente, tiene 38 años y 2 hijas, Nelsa se dedica a la elaboración de panes típicos que elabora en el horno que era de sus padres, en el cual también elaboran panes sus hermanos, actividad que realiza todos los días y lo vende en el mercado Santa Clara por las tardes. Nelsa necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de manteca y azúcar. Nelsa sueña con tener una tienda grande, una polleria y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: To buy sugar and lard to bake bread.

loans.name: Uguloy

texts.en:
R. Uguloy is 40 years old, married and has four children. With her husband, she runs a business buying and selling cows. She would like to secure a loan of $900 for nine months in order to buy additional cows to increase her inventory and meet customer demand. She believes this will lead to greater revenue and, ultimately, greater profit for her family. In the future, she would like to reinvest the earnings generated by this loan back into her business to purchase even more cows and increase her income even further. She and her husband plan to use their increased earnings to fund their children’s education. Uguloy deeply appreciates the trust and support her lenders are giving her. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. Civil war, which ignited soon after independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients have viable business propositions. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To expand her business by buying additional cows.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. is 38 years old and married with four children. She sells drinks and clothes in a shop. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more drinks and clothes to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a 37-year old woman dreaming to have more capital to sustain the needs of her family. She hopes that her three children will finish their studies so that they will not experience what she experienced before.

She is engaged in fish vending on a consignment basis with a fish dealer. The dealer trusted them with bulk of fish, in turn she became a dealer in the town of Bugasong. The retailers in her neighborhood serve as her customers.

She needs additional capital to increase the volume of fish she would be trading to augment her income.

loans.use: purchasing of 118 kilos of different kind of fish

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru: Ахмедов Фарход  проживает в районе Шахринау. Возраст 38 лет. В данный момент нигде не работает. Но занимается фермерской деятельностью. имеет хозяйство , где разводит крупно-рогатый скот. Опыт работы в данной сфере уже 6 лет. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Купив еще одного бычка  он сможет чаще выводить животных на рынок.Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Farhod A. lives in the Shahrinav district. He is 38 years old. Currently, he is unemployed. However, Farhod is involved in an agricultural business and owns a farm where he raises cattle. He has 6 years of experience in this field. Farhod plans to obtain a loan to increase his livestock headcount. Buying one more bull will allow him to bring the cattle to the market more often. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Muidin

texts.ru: Муидин мужчина,который кредитуется уже третий год.Он использует каждый займ для увеличения товарооборота.Он торгует на рынке Худжанда, мужской одеждой.Его товарооборот заметно увеличился за время своей кредитной истории.Муидин ездит за товаром два раза в месяц в город Истаравшан, и закупает товар с оптового рынка.Муидин пока не женат , считает что ещё не готов, т.к. недостаточно денежных средств для самостоятельной семейной жизни.Но в ближайшие годы надеется женится.Он благодарен инвесторам за финансирование .
texts.en:
This is the third year that Muidin has taken out loans. He uses each loan to increase his turnover. He sells men's clothing at the Khujand market. His turnover has significantly increased since he first received financing. Twice a month, Muidin travels to Istaravshan for goods, which he purchases wholesale. Muidin is not yet married. He feels he is not yet ready because he does not have sufficient monetary resources to support a family on his own; however, in the next few years he hopes to marry. He is grateful to the investors for the funding.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of men's clothing

loans.name: Saima Majid Khan Group

texts.en:
Saima baji is a housemaid and she is divorced. She works for a family who pays her money on monthly basis. She just cook their meals and manages their kitchen work. She has two children, a son and a daughter. Both of the children are getting education. Saima baji pays their school fees and other utility bills. Her brother is also lives with her. He has a fruit-selling business. He has 3-years of experience in this business. Saima baji has successfully repaid her three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for another loan to buy fruits for her brother’s fruit-selling business.  

She is the group leader of five other women from her locality. Nazia baji wants a loan to buy meat to sell. Mussarat rani baji wants a loan to buy fruits for her fruit selling business. Rubina baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Ishrat baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her clothes-selling business. Asma khatoon baji wants a loan to buy bangles for her bangle-selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members and each member will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits to sell, clothes to sell, bangles to sell, and an auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Cette femme  a perdu son mari et a depuis à sa charge ses 05 enfants. L’activité génératrice de revenu qu’elle exerce est le commerce de charbons de bois, elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays dans la petite ville d’AMOU-BLO parce que dans cette ville le sac de charbon de bois est moins coûteux. Son stock actuel de charbons de bois a diminué, pour pouvoir se réapprovisionner, elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 30 sacs de charbons de bois.
texts.en:
This lady lost her husband and is the sole breadwinner for her 5 children. Her business is selling charcoal. She stocks up in the countryside in the little town of AMOU-BLO because in that town, a sack of charcoal is less expensive. Her present stock of charcoal is low, so in order to stock up, she is requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy 30 sacks of charcoal.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of charcoal for re-sale

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
"El hogar D. la Sra. Paticia C. D. A. esta compuesta por tres hijas, la hija mayor D. 16 años,7 y 1 año, actualmente se encuentra separada D. su esposo, es por esta razon que ella se constituye en el sosten D. su familia, presentando la necesidad  D. un credito para continuar apoyando a su familia y asi mejorar su calidad D. vida.  
La. Sra. Patricia C. D. A. presenta como activiadad la D. lavado D. automoviles en la zona donD. vive por con una antiguedad D. 2 años que atienD. con su hija mayor, ademas D. contar con una segunda actividad que es la atencion D. tienda D. barrio, requiere el credito por la necesidad que tiene D. ampliar su tienda con la compra D. cabinas telefonicas por la demanda D. las mismas.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            "
texts.en:
Mrs. Paticia C. D. A. has 3 daughters who are 16, 7 and 1 year old. She is currently separated from her husband and it’s for this reason that she became the provider of her family. She is asking for a loan to continue supporting her family and improve their quality of life.

Ms. Patricia has a car wash business in the area where she lives and which has run for 2 years with her oldest daughter. She has a grocery neighborhood store, as a second business and is asking for a loan to expand it with the purchase of phone booths that have a high demand in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase of phone booths and food for her grocery shop

loans.name: Shafiqan Ali Hassan Group

texts.en:
Shamim akhtar baji wants a loan to buy wood for her furniture making business. 
Anwari begum baji wants a loan to buy a lathe machine. 
Sarwari baji wants a loan to buy vehicle wheels to sell. 
Rasheedan baji wants a loan to buy paint boxes to sell. 

Shafiqan baji is a wife of A. H. who has lived in Vehari, Pakistan for the last 14 years. Her husband deals with seasonal vegetables. He buys vegetables wholesale and sells to the vegetable shops to earn income. Shafiqan baji also has a thread roll making business. She sells the thread rolls to the thread sellers and earns income. She is the group leader of the aforementioned ladies. Her members are very happy to have her as a group leader because of her good behavior. She is applying for a loan to buy seasonal vegetables to expand her husband’s business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal vegetables to sell

loans.name: Bilma

texts.es:
la sra. BILMA B. C. se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal es de la venta de carne (carniceria ) y tambien tiene comedor, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace (8) años, su negocio opera bajo el nombre de carniceria Zelaya.
Doña Bilma es casada y su esposo se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, del matrimonio ya no depende ninguno de sus hijos ya que todos ellos trabajan y tienen sus hogares formados.
el local donde tiene su negocio es apto para consumir toda su variedad de comidas ya que es un lugar muy higienico y de ambiente agradable. 
Con los ingresos que genera el negocio ella cubre un 100% sus gastos del hogar. 
Doña Bilma, nos comento que con su negocio logro educar a sus hijos con carreras universitarias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bilma B. C. works selling meat at her butcher shop, where she also has a small restaurant. She has been running her business, called the "Zelaya Butcher Shop," for the past 8 years. Bilma is married, and her husband buys and sells cows. All of her children now have jobs of their own and their own families, so none of them depend on their parents for support anymore. Her business is an ideal place to consume different kinds of food, since it is very hygienic and has a pleasant atmosphere. The income she generates with this business pays for 100% of her household expenses. Bilma tells us that thanks to her business, she has been able to provide her children with a college education. She will use this loan to buy beef, chicken and pork for her butcher shop.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beef, chicken and pork

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is requesting PHP 14,000 from kiva lenders. She manages a general store business that is very helpful in sustaining her daily basic needs. She is now 61 years old and is married to a farmer in the person of Francisco S., 62 years of age. The couple is still strong in doing their business successfully despite their retiring age.

Due to difficulties of life, they were not able to provide their children with a college education but they are thankful that all of them are very responsible and made their way to a better living by gambling their fate in Manila where they all now live. There they find their jobs as factory workers while one is in abroad working as a domestic helper.

Elena is also saving for whatever happenings that will occur in their following days. She wants everything to be secured. Thus, she is working very hard with the support of her husband.

loans.use: To use for business improvement

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 62 years old. She is widowed and is the mother of five children, two of whom are still in school. She is very hardworking and supportive to her children, especially those in school.

Beatrice owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk and biscuits (cookies), etc. in her neighborhood. She has been in this business for eight years now. It has been her dream to expand by adding other foodstuffs to her existing products.

With the loan, she wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits, etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve her savings to support her children’s educational needs.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of bottled mineral water and boxes of biscuit, etc.

loans.name: Jorge Luis Celso

texts.es:
Jorge Luis tiene 28 años de edad, es casado, y vive junto a su esposa y su pequeño hijo de cuatro meses de nacido en la casa de sus padres que está ubicada en el distrito de Ciudad Eten, a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace dos años se dedica al trasporte de carga y pasajeros en su mototaxi (vehículo motorizado de tres ruedas) durante todo el día trabaja en su vehículo y con lo recaudado sustenta los gastos económicos de su hogar.

El continuo uso ha hecho que el vehículo sufra algunos desperfectos en el motor, por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en el arreglo y mantenimiento de su instrumento de trabajo.

Su más grande anhelo es comprarse un terreno y construir allí una casa en la que pueda vivir junto a su familia; sus vecinos lo consideran como un joven alegre y responsable que todos los dias trabaja arduamente para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge Luis is 28, married, and lives with his wife and four-month son in his parents' house, which is located in the district of Ciudad Eten, twenty-minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For two years he has transported cargo and passengers in his moto taxi (a three-wheeled motorized vehicle). He works all day on his vehicle and with the money he gains he supports the costs of his household. The continual use of the vehicle has caused some damage to the engine. For this reason, Jorge Luis finds him himself asking our institution for his first loan of 1200 soles to invest in the repair and maintenance of his means of work. His greatest desire is to buy a piece of land and to build a house there so he can live together with his family. His neighbors consider him a happy and responsible young man who works arduously every day to support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repair and maintenance

loans.name: Isekahungu United Bamanyisa Topista Group

texts.en: B. Topista is forty-seven years old, the chairperson of Isekahungu United group. She is married with eight children and three of them are in school. She owns a retail shop which she has been operating for over ten years. She is requesting for the loan to purchase retail items such as sugar, salt, soap, cooking oil, etc mostly essentials. The loan will help her improve upon her business which will enable her pay school fees for her children. She is a hard working business woman. Her future plan is seeing her children through. There group target is to struggle for the better future of their children

loans.use: To purchase retail items such as sugar, salt, soap, cooking oil, etc mostly essentials.

loans.name: Na

texts.en: Mrs. Na Some is a villager in Chan Teab village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn for living. Aside from this, she is a breeder who raises cow and pigs. Since breeding business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy one more cow and four piglets and she would use the rest of the loan to buy pig food to support her pig. Her husband, Mr. Yoem Sam Art, is a construction worker who can earn a small income to support the family. Mrs. Na Some is 40 years old and the mother of five children two of whom are employed in a garment factory while others two are attending the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is on the age of a year.  Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy one more cow and four piglets and she would use the rest of the loan to buy pig food to support her pig.

loans.name: Kikelome

texts.en: A. is 40 years old and married, with 4 children. She sells electronics and other goods. She lives in Oyo State, Nigeria. She has been in LAPO for 2 years. She is requesting a loan for the amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more electronics to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more electronics to sell

loans.name: Ednalyne

texts.en:
“If there is no pain, there is no gain” is a guiding principle of a hardworking mother like Ednalyne V. of Barangay Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. Her husband is Marlon V. and they are blessed with three children. She and her husband help each other to earn a living and support the schooling of their children. As a fruit of their patience and sacrifices, their eldest child has graduated from college and is presently working in one of the well known companies in Manila while the two youngest are presently studying in tertiary level.

Ednalyne’s husband cultivates their farm by planting rice and some vegetables while Ednalyne is engaged in selling fish and frozen foods. She acquires her product from Solano Public Market and sells it in their village on a retail basis. They earn an average income of P 700 a week which they use to acquire their daily basic needs and to finance the schooling of their children.

Since their income is not sufficient for the needs of the family Ednalyne wants to earn more income to meet their needs. So she wants to borrow additional capital of P 8,000 to be used in improving their small business. They believe that with the use of this financial assistance, they can improve their business and earn more income.

loans.use: To buy more goods to retail

loans.name: Nurinisso

texts.ru: Кароматова Нуриниссо проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст 37 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Муж занимается организацией свадеб, и их ведением. Сама же клиентка более 5 лет занимается выращиванием овощей и их продажей. Кредит просит для закупа семян и удобрений.
texts.en:
Nurinisso K. lives close to Shahrituz, Tajikistan. She is thirty-seven and married with three children. Her husband is a wedding organizer. Nurinisso has grown and sold vegetables for over five years. She is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.


Translated from Russian by Susan Savkov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Melecia

texts.en:
Melecia D. V. is from the village of Ramos East. She is 23 years old. Melecia is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Melecia owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector selling cosmetic products. Melecia earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Melecia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Melecia is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP. This will be the first loan taken out by Melecia from ASKI. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Towards additional capital for business.

loans.name: Alita

texts.en: Alita M. is from the village of Lower Dicayas. She is 56 years old and is single. Alita owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Alita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Alita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
El Sr. Santiago se dedica al transporte de carga con su camioneta, actividad con la que se sostiene el solo ya que aun no se caso y vive solo con los papas a quienes les ayuda con los gastos del hogar. 

El credito solicitado es para la compra de repuestos para su movilidad.

Tambien podemos mensionar que el cliente es bastante responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.
 
El Sr. Santiago esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada.
texts.en:
Santiago transports cargo in his van. He is still single so his earnings are for his own needs and to help his parents, with whom he lives, to pay for household expenses. The funding requested is to buy replacement parts for his vehicle. We can mention, too, that he is quite responsible with his repayments. Santiago is very grateful both to Emprender and to Kiva for having confidence in him.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy replacement parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Dancille

texts.en:
Dancille was born in 1976 and is married with three children aged between 3 and 15 years. She and her family live in the Western Province of Rwanda, approximately three hours drive from Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Dancille’s village, called Nyabihu, is where, since 2007, she has owned her business selling women’s clothes. The hours of her business are from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. every day except Sunday.

Although this hardworking businesswoman has been in her business for three years, her profit is still too low to expand the business meaningfully and she believes that a small amount of additional capital would change her business positively.

For that reason, Dancille is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more clothes to sell so that she will be able to satisfy the demands of her customers.

With this loan, Dancille hopes that she will become more efficient, effective and successful. She thanks VFC and Kiva lenders for their support!

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Ihab

texts.en:
Ihab is a 20-year-old single man who has been working as a car repairman for the past eight years after stopping his education.

In 2008, Ihab opened his own car repair shop to earn income to help satisfy his life needs and to support his family. He is planning to expand his business and make it better to attract more clients. To do so, he is requesting $1,200 to increase his inventory and to buy more tools needed for his business.

loans.use: To increase his inventory and to buy more tools needed

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is 40 years and she is married. She was jobless before starting the business. Financial problems brought her tenacity and innovation, however, and she decided to start a small business selling clothing items. This is her third successful year in this business, which she runs from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. every day.

Jeanne is a focused hard-worker. She puts energy in long hours trying to keep her business sustainable. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers.

Jeanne would like to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company so that she can purchase additional bales of cloth and re-supply her inventory. With this loan, she will significantly expand her clothing trade. Jeanne believes that having a variety of bales of good quality will increase her sales as well as her profits.

loans.use: To buy additional bales of cloth

loans.name: Geraline's Group

texts.en:
Geraline Z. is from the village of Landing, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is the leader of a three-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
Geraline is 38 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Geraline owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling tuba (coconut wine) products in the local community. Geraline has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Geraline joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Koem Yen

texts.en: Mrs. Koem Yen S. is 38 years old and lives in Prey Thum village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who grows rice on her land, and has applied for a loan to buy pesticide so that she can produce a good crop. Her husband, Mr. Ry Kong, is a driver who earns a small income which is not enough to support his family. He and his wife have four children, three of whom are in the public school while the youngest is too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy pesticide

loans.name: Ndèye

texts.fr: Ndèye D. est âgée de 63ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Son ancienneté de 4 ans dans le Banc Villageois de DANKH SENE lui a offert la possibilité de bénéficier 8 fois de suite de crédit. Elle fait essentiellement de l'embouche bovine, son nouveau prêt lui permettra d'acheter de l'aliment de bétail et un bœuf qu'elle engraissera pour revendre au bout de 5 mois. Elle participe au bien-être familiale.
texts.en:
Ndèye D. is 63 years old, married, and the mother of five children. Her four years of seniority with Banc Villageois de DANKH SENE has provided her with eight consecutive opportunities for loans. Ndèye essentially fattens cattle. Her new loan will allow her to buy livestock feed and a cow or steer, which she will fatten up for resale after five months. She contributes to the well-being of her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a steer to fatten

loans.name: Omed Group

texts.en:
Rohullah is a member of the Omed group. He is a 55-year-old man who lives in district 3 of Nangarhar province. He has three kids and they are all in school.

He has a retail shop. Currently he has some financial problems. Due to that, he wants to take a loan to buy some essential materials for his retail shop that have more demand in the market. This will allow him to increase his business income and solve his financial problems. He would like to thanks to both AFS and Kiva lenders for their helpful process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: They want to complete their stocks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Selling electronic goods

loans.name: Pabla Petrona

texts.es: Pabla Petrona tiene 44 años vive con sus 2 hijos que están a su cargo su actividad económica es a la venta de mercadería en general. Pabla tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación por lo que ha sido de mucho apoyo. Sus inicios se dan por que el padre de sus hijos la abandono y ella tenía que buscar la forma de mantenerlos, así es que decide que esta actividad es de gran ayuda. El crédito será invertido en la compra de camisetas, pantalones, faldas y lápiz labial.
texts.en:
Pabla is 44 years old and lives with her two children. She sells general merchandise and has been working with the foundation for a long time. It has provided her with much support. She began after she was abandoned by the father of her children and needed to find a way to support them. This business has been a great help. She will use the money from this loan to invest in t-shirts, pants, skirts, and lip pencils.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Paquita

texts.en:
Paquita S., from the village of Calatunan, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, is 58 years old, married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Paquita owns a business venture ofering motorcycle transport services. Engaged in her business for seven years, she earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Paquita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to buy materials for her motorcycle, she is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP for additional inventory and working capital. Paquita plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For motorcycle repair

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia, tiene 36 años y pertenece al banco comunal “Los Comerciantes de Virgen Asunta” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco de Perú.  

Eugenia nos cuenta.- En mi banco comunal somos 10 integrantes y me eligieron a mí para dar mi testimonio de mi actividad económica. Yo me dedico a  la venta de pasamanería de forma ambulatoria en las ferias sabatinas y dominicales y también en la calle. Ya son varios años que trabajo con la asociación Arariwa y me ha ido muy bien, con los préstamos que me dieron y las utilidades que conseguí pude comprar más mercadería. Actualmente, requiero el préstamo para comprar más mercadería.
texts.en:
Eugenia, 36, belongs to the Los Comerciantes de Virgen Asunta community bank, an Asociacion Arariwa group in the Peruvian city of Cusco. Eugenia tells us, "My community bank has 10 members and they chose me to talk about my business. I work as a street vendor selling passementerie. I have worked with Asociacion Arariwa for some years and it has been a successful partnership. The loans and help that they have given me have allowed me to buy more product. I want a loan now so that I can buy more product that I will resell."

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy product for resale.

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.en:
Adjowa A. is a widow who takes care of six dependents. She cooks rice at Elmina for sale and uses her income in providing the basic needs of her children.

Adjowa says the loan will enable her buy bags of rice instead of buying in small quantities. With the new returns from her expanded business, she plans to trade in other foods to bring variety into her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice instead of buying in small quantities

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita L. is from the village of Allinguigan 3rd. She is 44 years old. Merlita is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Merlita owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products such as biscuits, canned goods, and soap in the local community. Merlita has been engaged in her business for more than seven years and earns approximately 4200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Merlita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Merlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Merlita is requesting a new loan of 18000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Merlita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Socheata

texts.en: Mrs. Socheata M. is 32 years old and her husband, Mr. Phan Phann, is 40 years old.  They have been married since 1997 and have one son and one daughter who both attend school. Their family lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Mrs. Socheata M. sells fruit (mango, longan, and bananas). Her husband is a chef who cooks for weddings and other ceremonies. Socheata wants to expand her business, so she is requesting her first loan in the amount of $600 to purchase additional fruit for selling.

loans.use: To purchase mango, longan, and banana for selling.

loans.name: Jasmine

texts.en:
Jasmine O. is from Alinam, Cauayan City, in Isabela province. She is 43 years old, widowed, and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Jasmine owns & operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing transportation services as well as pedicure and manicure services in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Jasmine joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide her services. This will be Jasmine’s 8th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide her services

loans.name: Ulambayar

texts.en:
Ulambayar R. is 33 years old and lives with her husband and 1-year-old son in the Zavhan province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a "ger," a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her husband operates a transportation business in his town to supplement his family's income. 

Ulambayar operates a cafe in a rented space of 24 square meters. She provides a variety of meals for her customers. She has been engaged this business for six years and has built a successful operation. She hired two workers and pays them a monthly salary of 108,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) each. Over the years of operation, she has managed to expand her business activities and has gained a positive reputation among her customers. 

Ulambayar is a very open-minded and hardworking person and is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan both to decorate her cafe and to buy new electronic equipment for her cafe.

loans.use: To buy new electronic equipment

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina A. is from the village of Tigbao. She is 41 years old. Marina is widowed and has four children. To make a living, Marina grows crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Marina is just starting this business.

In 2007, Marina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Marina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to grow. Marina is requesting a new loan of 3,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops. This will be Marina's seventh loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops

loans.name: Hector Manuel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “QORIWASI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


El socio es el Sr. Hector Manuel; el tiene 32 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 2 hijos; el socio trabaja en una farmacia vendiendo medicinas, el es químico farmacéutico, el es propietario de una farmacia que atiende desde 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar medicinas al por mayor para la farmacia.


El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “QORIWASI” Banco Comunal, which is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

His name is Señor Hector Manuel; he is 32 years old, single and has two children. He is the owner of the pharmacy where he works as the pharmacist from 7:00am to 6:00pm, selling medicines. He would like to expand and improve his business. He is requesting this loan to buy medicine in bulk for the pharmacy.

He is grateful to those who are involved in making his dream a possibility through this loan, and he is committed to making his repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy medicines in bulk for the pharmacy.

loans.name: Galicana

texts.en:
Galicana D. is a 52-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a business buying and selling fishing materials. She lives in Prk. San Juan, Brgy. Patao, Bantayan, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1998 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing materials business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 12,000. Galicana is now borrowing PHP 20,000 so that she could fund her business operations. This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Galicana aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. In the photo, you will see her husband helping her run the business. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: To fund her business operation

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista B. is married and has four children, three of whom are in school. She lives in the Ndeeba neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. Teopista lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and food for the family.

Teopista sells fruits and vegetables. She has been in business for less than one year, working seven days a week. She sells her produce at the market.

Teopista has requested a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of tomatoes, oranges, green peppers, fresh cow peas and onions. Her main business challenges include transportation and seasonal changes.

Teopista’s goal is to buy land upon which to grow these vegetables herself.

loans.use: To buy more produce to sell

loans.name: Albina

texts.es: Albina tiene 62 años, vive con su esposo en su casa propia. Hace más D. 50 años se dedica a los bordados en hilo para elaborar trajes típicos D. su región, este arte que le enseñó su madre le ayudó bastante para poder ahora independizarse. Para ello cuenta con un taller D. bordadura, que es muy conocida por su zona, ya que el trabajo que realiza es muy apreciado por sus clientes, por ello son muchos lo que acuden a su taller, considera que su actividad  es rentable ya que sus clientes están dispuestos a pagar el precio  porque lo consideran justo por la calidad y acabado que entrega. Por otro lado, Albina también conoce las técnicas D. cultivo, así como el cuidado D. los animales. Es así que día a día trabaja cuando pueD. en el campo, pero cuando tiene mucho pedidos para bordar, contrata mano D. obra para que se encarguen D. la producción D. su cosecha. En adelante, tiene planeado intensificarse en la agricultura. Es el crédito número 2 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. más hilos y telas para sus bordados, así mismo comprará sacos D. abono para sembrar maíz.
texts.en:
Albina is 62, she lives with her husband in their own house. She has worked for more than 50 years embroidering with thread the typical dress of her region. This art, which her mother taught her, has greatly helped her to be able to now become independant. For this work she has an embroidery workshop, which is very well known in her zone since the work she produces is much appreciated by her customers and it is for this reason that many come to her workshop. She considers her activity to be profitable since her customers agree to pay her prices because they consider them fair for the quality and finish that she delivers.

On the other hand, Albina is also familiar with cultivation techniques, as well as animal husbandry. This is how she works day to day when she can in the countrysiD.. However, when she has many embroidery orders she hires labour to take care of the production of her harvest. From now on, she plans to intensify in agriculture. This is loan number 2 that she has had with [field partner] MFP and is very happy to know that she has financial support. As well, she is pleased to be a part of her communal bank because all its members are responsible people and very supportive. She thanks all the people who will be providers of the loan that she requests as it will be very useful for the progress of her business. The loan she is asking for will be invested in the purchase of more thread and fabric for her embroidery, as well, she will buy sacs of fertilizer for the planting of maize.

loans.use: To buy thread and fabric for her embroidery, as well as sacs of fertilizer for the planting of maize.

loans.name: Noime

texts.en:
Noime A. is from the town of Banga. She is 49 years old. Noime is married and has 2 children aged 19 and 17. To make a living, Noime owns & operates a farm. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. Noime works hard to improve her family's living conditions.
