Noime joined CEVI to gain access to financial services. She is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to buy fertilizers and other farm products. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: Buy fertilizers and other farm materials

loans.name: Jesús María

texts.es:
Jesús María tiene 50 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el distrito agrícola D. TambogranD., una zona D. clima semitropical que produce principalmente mango, limón y maracuyá, pertenece a la provincia D. Piura y se encuentra situada a más D. cuatro horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la comercialización D. bebidas en su domicilio. Ella comercializa gaseosas y cervezas entre los vecinos D. su localidad. Como el negocio ya cuenta con varios años D. funcionamiento y ella siempre se esfuerza por brindar productos D. buena calidad. La demanda con la que cuenta es bastante estable. Los ingresos que percibe D. estas actividades le sirven para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento D. la economía familiar.

Jesús desea adquirir más bebidas para satisfacer a sus clientes ya que durante la presente temporada D. verano la demanda suele aumentar. Por ello ha decidido solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Jesús María is 50 years old, married and lives with her husband and two children in the agricultural district of TambogranD., an area with a semi-tropical climate which mainly produces mangoes, lemons and passion fruit.  It is located in Piura province, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.

Jesús sells drinks from her home.  She sells soda and beer to her neighbors.  As she has been running her business for several years and she always works hard to proviD. good-quality products, her customer demand is quite stable.  She uses the profits she makes from this activity to help her husband support their family financially.

Jesús would like to acquire more drinks to satisfy her customers since her demand usually rises during the summer season.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to help her achieve her goal.

loans.use: To acquire more drinks to satisfy her customers

loans.name: Selina

texts.en: Selina A. sells provisions in Takoradi. Selina has received junior high education. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a mechanic. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be added to her working capital to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy land.

loans.use: to add to her working capital to expand her business

loans.name: Arely

texts.es: Arely  solicito un financiamiento para incrementar la venta de sus productos, ya que se encontraba en una fecha de bastantes pedidos, y quería cumplir con todos ellos. Su actividad es la venta de ropa, desde hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio. Por lo que es una mujer muy trabajadora que disfruta de su trabajo, y que además está luchando por llevar los ingresos necesarios a su hogar. Ella actualmente está solicitando este financiamiento para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos y trajes. Ella sueña con tener una casa con muchas comodidades y tener un negocio muy productivo, si es posible establecerlo en el mercado.
texts.en:
Arely requested a loan to increase sales of her products because she was in a period of time with many pending orders and she wanted to fill all of them.  Her activity is clothing sales.  She’s been in business for over 3 years.  She is a hard working woman who enjoys her work and strives to bring needed household income.

She is asking for funds to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses and suits.  She dreams with having a house with lots of comforts and a very productive business, if possible located in the market.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en: L. Nguyễn Thị is a 48-year-old woman living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. She is married and has two grown-up children. To make a living, L. works in someone else's business manufacturing and selling wood products to local businesses and community members. L. has been in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000,000 dong (VND) a month. In 2009, L. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. L. has successfully repaid a previous L. of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA. This previous L. was used to invest in renovating the business. She is now requesting a new L. of 7,392,000 VND which will be used to purchase tools and other equipment to expand the business. This will be her second L. from SEDA. L. plans to use additional income to improve and expand the business. L. is the leader of a five member group accessing a L. offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual L., they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Đồng Thôn 2 (nhóm 11)". No. 20203040085 About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. Trương Thị T. (0) is a 28-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,048,000 VND L. to support her business in the retail sector selling home products. 2. Trương V. T. (0) is a 23-year-old man who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND L. to support his business providing recycling services. 3. Trương Thị T. (0) is a 35-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND L. to support her business raising livestock. 4. Ngô Thị K. (0) is a 35-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND L. to support her business running a bakery. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this L. was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ====================================== L. Nguyễn Thị (20203040085) là 48 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. L. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Đồng Thôn 2 (nhóm 11). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm bằng gỗ cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. L. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, L. kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND. Vào 2009, L. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. L. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư đổi mới công việc kinh doanh. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Trương Thị T. (0) là 28 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán hàng gia dụng. 2. Trương V. T. (0) là 23 tuổi nam. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là cung cấp dịch vụ tái chế. 3. Trương Thị T. (0) là 35 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 4. Ngô Thị K. (0) là 35 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh lò bánh mì. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase tools and other equipment to expand the business

loans.name: Antonio Jose

texts.es:
Antonio en su bicicleta acondicionada para vender sus papa fritas recorre el municipio de Barbosa y de esta forma consigue diariamente el sustento para su familia.

Sin embargo, Antonio necesita comprar mas insumos para poder tener mas cantidad de producto para venderla, ya que al tener mayor número de clientes su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos mejorará notablemente.
texts.en: Antonio has his bicycle set up to sell french fries on the streets of the municipality of Barbosa, and in this way he makes a living to provide for his family. However, Antonio needs to purchase more ingredients in order to sell his product in larger quantities, since having a larger number of customers will notably improve the quality of life for himself and his children.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Aura Olimpia

texts.en:
Aura is 65 years old, married, and has four children. For the past 30 years she has worked in the hostel business. She started out working as an assistant for her mother-in-law and now manages a hostel with her husband. 

Aura is requesting a loan to remodel the water system in the hostel she manages. She hopes to one day run a large hotel with many guests. This is Aura´s second loan with ASDIR. The previous loan was paid back in full with no problems.

loans.use: to remodel hostel water system.

loans.name: Las Conchitas Group

texts.es:
Las Conchitas es un grupo formado por 11 personas todas mujeres, esta ubicado en una pequeña comunidad que esta sobre carretera y enfrente de una presa de pesca, la comunidad se llama Concepción Chico, vulgarmente se le dice la concha, por esa razón como el grupo lo integran mujeres se pusieron las conchitas y ese el significado, varias integrantes van invertir su préstamo en comercio; Francisca (pequeña tienda), Maria (molino de maiz),Valentina (tienda), Maricela (zapatos por catalogo), las demas señoras: Maria Eleuteria, Maria Irene, Maria Modesta, Rosa Felipa y Maria Guadalupe van invertir su prestamo en comprar molinos para el maiz, ya que es una actividad muy demandante porque toda la gente cultiva maiz, y para darle de comer a sus animales nesecitan molerlo, y no hay molinos para hacerlo. La representante del grupo se llama Ana Luisa, ella cria pollos para vender, y nos platica lo siguiente sobre su negocio: Yo me dedico a criar pollos y habeces guajolotes, ahora quiero invertir en comprar pollos y aprovechar para hacerle la casita a los pollos y tengan donde duerman y protegerse del clima, un problema que he tenido con los animales es que como no tengo donde se queden se van y despues ya no los encuentro y se me pierden, tambien vacunarlos y no se enfermen de gripa, va beneficiarme el prestamo porque tengo un hijo que esta en la primaria y puedo ayudarlo con algunos gastos de papeleria que seguido le piden, mi meta es hacer mi casa porque vivo en casa de mi mamá con mi señor, no soy casada vivo en union libre, mi esposo trabaja como albañil, pero primero quiero ahorrar para comprar un terreno y despues fincar, por eso quiero mi negocio y empezar a ganar aunque sea un poco para ir empezando.
***La señora Maria C. García aparece en la foto, pero no se alcanza a percibir su rostro, es por esto que se marca como si no estuviera***
texts.en:
Las Conchitas is a group which is made up of 11 women.  The women live in a small community which is located on a road, opposite a fishing dam.  The community is called Concepción Chico.  It is locally known as 'La Concha' (The Shell).  This is why the group, which is made up entirely of women, decided to give themselves the name 'Las Conchitas' (The Little Shells).

Several of this group's members will invest their loan money in commercial activities: Francisca (a small store), Maria (a corn mill), Valentina (a store) and Maricela (selling shoes through a catalog).  The rest of the ladies, Maria Eleuteria, Maria Irene, Maria Modesta, Rosa Felipa and Maria Guadalupe, will invest their loan money in buying corn mills since milling corn is an activity which is very much in demand.  Everybody grows corn and, in order to give it to their animals as feed, they need to mill it.  There aren't mills to do this.

This group's representative is called Ana Luisa.  She raises chickens to sell and she tells us the following about her business: "My business is raising chickens and sometimes turkeys.  I would like to invest in buying chickens and also build a chicken coop so that they have somewhere to sleep and protect themselves from the weather.  One problem that I have had with my animals is that, because I don't have anywhere to keep them, they disappear and then I can't find them and I lose them.  I also have to vaccinate them so that they don't get flu.  This loan will be very helpful to me because I have a son who is in elementary school and I will be able to help him by paying for some of the stationery supplies that he needs.  My goal is to build my own home because I live with my partner in my mom's house.  I am not married but I have a common-law marriage.  My partner is a construction worker.  First I would like to save up and buy a plot of land and then build.  My business is important because it means I can start to earn, even if it's just a little bit of money, and start saving".

Note: Maria C. García appears in the photo but you cannot make out her face.  This is why she has been marked down as if she wasn't there.

loans.use: to build a chicken coop

loans.name: Novemar

texts.en:
Novemar B. is 31 years old and married with two school-aged children. He is from the village of Barangay 17, Gingoog City. To make a living, Novemar owns and operates a mini-restaurant. His main source of income comes from serving a variety of different meals to customers such as adobo, caldereta, and afritada in the local community. Novemar has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

Novemar joined HSPFI in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional ingredients like meat, spices, and vegetables. This is Novemar’s first loan with HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his loan to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as meat, spices, and vegetables

loans.name: Julio Alberto

texts.es:
Julio de 29 años, es un hombre inspirado en su trabajado que abrió una panadería hace poco tiempo ya que el sabe de preparación de panes.

En la actualidad trabaja desde muy temprano realizando la preparación de panes y con el apoyo de la esposa en las ventas de lo mismo. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso con el préstamo quiere comprar vitrinas y mas frigoríficos para sus ventas y así aumentar sus ingresos y darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en: Julio, age 29, is a man who is very enthusiastic about his work. He recently opened a bakery because he knows how to prepare bread and related products. Currently, he works from the early hours of the morning preparing and baking bread while his wife helps him with the sales. Julio has a lot of hopes for his business which is why he wants to use the loan to purchase glass display cabinets and additional refrigerators. This investment will help him increase his sales and earnings and will help him to provide the best for his family.

loans.use: to purchase glass display cabinets and refrigerators

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La Sra. Martha S. S. pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Margaritas II” del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Tiene 35 años, es madre soltera y tiene un niño de 10 años.

Desde muy  joven  le gustaba los negocios,  es así que se inicia en el negocio de venta de carnes asadas a la parrilla.  Debido a las gran competencia  decide cambiar de negocio por la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad para el ama de casa, invirtiendo un pequeño capital de S/. 400.00 

Con este préstamo de S/. 2700.00 surtirá su negocio con mas  productos, comprará cocoa, aceite , leche en cajas , insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas en paquetes y otros productos para mantener contenta a su clientela. 


Martha  es una mujer luchadora,  su sueño es contar con un Mini Market.
Está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de poder hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Martha S. S. is a member of the communal bank "Las Margaritas II", located in the district of Tarapoto, of the province and department of San Martin. She is 35 years old and she is a single mother of a 10-year old boy.

She enjoyed commerce ever since she was very young. This is how she started her grilled meats business. Given the great competition she decided to change her business to a grocery and general store carrying basic needs products for housewives. She made a capital investment of S/. 400. 

With this loan of S/.2700 she will supply her business with more products. She will purchase cocoa, cooking oil, boxed milk, personal care products, cleaning supplies, soft drinks, and other products to keep her clientele satisfied.

Martha is a hardworking woman. Her dream is to have a mini market.

She is very thankful to the Manuela Ramos Movement (Kiva Field Partner) for helping women like her to have opportunities to realize their dreams.

loans.use: to purchase cocoa, cooking oil, boxed milk, personal care products, cleaning supplies, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Adelia

texts.es:
Adelia ya va por su tercer credikiva y desde la ciudad de Bogotá agradece a sus financiadores por la ayuda que le han brindado; ella está muy satisfecha, porque ahora tiene volantes promocionales y se ha dado a conocer mucho más y todo se lo debe a los financiamientos a través de Kiva, a través de los cuales que ha logrado más ventas de forros para muebles. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento para renovar su registro mercantil, porque ahora sus nuevos clientes potenciales son empresas con las que planea   hacer negociaciones   y también comprará   materia prima como yacar y espuma en mayor volumen, pues necesita producir  forros para muebles y responder a pedidos para seguir construyendo éxitos. Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Adelia puede ingresar a los siguientes enlaces:
http://kiva.org/lend/202261
http://kiva.org/lend/247153
texts.en:
Adelia is in her third credikiva cycle and from the city of Bogotá sends her thanks to all the lenders for their help.  She is very happy since she now has promotional flyers and is much more well known thanks to Kiva loans, which have helped her increase furniture upholstery sales.  She now is applying for a new loan to renew her mercantile licence since her potential new customers are companies.  She will have to negotiate with them and buy raw materials such as jacquard fabric and foam rubber in higher volumes. She must incease her upholstery services to fill orders so she can continue growing her business.  If you would like to learn more about Adelia's background, you can following these links:
http://kiva.org/lend/202261
http://kiva.org/lend/247153

loans.use: To buy larger volumes of raw materials such as jacquard fabric and foam rubber.

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van is 48 years old and lives in Kompong Chhnang Province. He works in construction as a day laborer and earns about $3.25 a day. For many years now, his wife has made a living weaving baskets out of bamboo, and earns about $1.25 a day. In addition to their jobs, the couple grows rice on land they rent. They have four children, one of whom is married and one of whom works in a garment factory. Van has applied for this loan to buy a piece of land on which he can grow rice. This would mean a big improvement in the family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land on which to grow rice.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is married  and has 3 children.  She is 50 years of age and lives in P-4 Caridad, Dumingag, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines. 

Esther grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this 20 years.  She is requested a loan to purchase fertilizer.  

Esther has been a member of PAGLAUM MULTI-PURPOSE COOPERATIVE for 7 months. In the future, she hopes that she can earn a lot from her  farm in order to provide her family with financial assistance.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María forma parte del banco comunal “Fe y Unión” perteneciente a la comuna de Pudahuel, ciudad de Santiago.
Ella se dedica a vender productos de bazar en diferentes ferias los días martes a domingo, hasta las 14ºº horas. Trabaja en éste rubro desde hace 5 años, comenzó vendiendo ropa usada y después comenzó a incorporar artículos de bazar. Su mercadería la compra usualmente en el barrio Meiggs, comuna de Estación Central. Los días de más alta demanda son los fines de semana, ya que concurre más clientela a la feria libre. 
Con el crédito comprará pantuflas, pilas, candados, entre otros productos. 
Sus metas son comprar un vehículo para trasladar su mercadería, ya que por ahora solo traslada su mercadería en un triciclo y los fines de semana su marido, es quien se encarga de ayudarla.
María vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos. Sus sueños son que sus hijos obtengan su casa propia. 
Ella está muy agradecida del apoyo brindado por Fondo Esperanza, ya que ha podido invertir en su negocio. Comenta que el grupo del banco comunal al cual pertenece es muy bueno y unido. Respecto a las reuniones, éstas han sido muy buenas e interesantes, ya que le ha permitido conocer experiencias de otras socias en sus negocios. Las capacitaciones además le han servido para registrar sus gastos e ingresos en su propio negocio. 
Pudahuel es una comuna del sector poniente de Santiago (capital de Chile), región Metropolitana. Es un vocablo del mapudungun (lengua mapuche) que se traduce como “lugar donde se juntan las aguas” o “lugar de charcos”, debido a que posee una variada red fluvial compuesta por el río Mapocho y los esteros Lampa, Carén y Las Cruces, lo que favorece sus suelos para la producción agrícola por la existencia de abundante agua subterránea.
texts.en:
María is part of the “Fe y Unión” (Faith and Union) communal bank belonging to Pudahuel Commune in the city of Santiago.

She sells assorted household items in various markets from Tuesday to Sunday until 2pm.  She’s been in this line of work for five years.  She started out selling used clothes and later started adding household items.  She usually buys her merchandise in the Meiggs neighborhood, Estación Central commune.  Weekends are when demand is highest because more customers come to the street markets.

She will use the loan to buy slippers, batteries and padlocks, among other products.  Her goals are to buy a vehicle to transport her merchandise because currently she uses a three-wheeled cart and on weekends her husband takes care of helping her.  María lives with her husband and two children.  Her dreams are that her children acquire a house of their own.

She is very grateful for the support Fondo Esperanza has given her because she’s been able to invest in her business.  She comments that the group of the communal bank she belongs to is very good and united.  With respect to the meetings, they have been very good and interesting because she’s been able to learn about the experiences of other members.  The training sessions have also been useful for her to keep track of her expenses and income in her own business.

Pudahuel is a commune in the western part of Santiago (capital of Chile) Metropolitan Region.  It’s a Mapudungun (indigenous language) term meaning “place where the waters join together” or “place of puddles” because it has a varied network of waterways composed of the Mapocho River and the Lampa, Carén and Las Cruces marshes which make the soil favorable for agriculture due to the existence of abundant underground water.

loans.use: to buy slippers, batteries and padlocks, among other products.

loans.name: Mwinyi

texts.en:
Mwinyi is a married man with three children, all of whom of whom attend school. He owns a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighbors and passersby. Mwinyi faces the major challenge of the high cost of transporting goods from town to his place of operation. He dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KSHS 80,000, he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat oil and sugar. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat oil and sugar.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora Guadalupe tiene ya más de nueve años dedicándose a la venta de abarrotes. 
Solicita un préstamo para invertir en compra de mercancía para su negocio de abarrotes. Doña Guadalupe desea tener a la venta más variedad de productos que son frutas, verduras y carnes frías. Pero no cuenta con el capital necesario para la inversión de su negocio, ya que es la única fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia.  
Con las ganancias que obtendrá del negocio planea pagar el crédito.
La señora Guadalupe es clienta distinguida en FVP ha tenido un crédito el cual realizo sus pagos puntuales.
texts.en:
Guadalupe has been selling groceries for more than nine years. She requests a loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise for her grocery store business. Guadalupe wants to be able to sell a greater variety of products such as fruits, vegetables, and cold meats. But she doesn't have the necessary capital funds to invest in her business, especially because it is the only source of income for her family.

She plans on paying back her loan with the profits she earns from her business. 

Guadalupe is a distinguished member in FVP (Kiva Field Partner) and she has had a previous loan for which she paid back on time.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Sofronia

texts.en:
Sofronia is a 60-year-old widow with 2 children. She lives in Malaubang, Ozamiz City.

Sofronia has been selling “balut” for 2 years, earning a monthly income of PHP 1,000. Balut, a fertilized duck embryo that is boiled alive and eaten in the shell. is a popular streetfood in the Phillipines. Sofronia has requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to buy balut eggs. Sofronia has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her balut sales business.

loans.use: To buy "balut" eggs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase provisions (soap, chloride, tissue cartons) for her business

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 49 years old and married with 4 children.

Elsie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more inventory to sell in her sari-sari store.

Elsie has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 7 years and also earns an income buying and selling scrap materials.

Elsie aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La Sra. Martha vive en la comunidad conocida como Esquilan Chico, en la provincia de Quillacollo en el departamento de Cochabamba, junto a sus padres, los cuales son mayores de edad y ella los cuida. La Sra Martha se dedica a la producción de leche cruda y su posterior venta a la empresa Pil Andina. Actualmente cuenta con 12 cabezas de ganado lechero en producción y obtiene de las mismas un aproximado de 95 litros diarios.
El siguiente crédito que solicita es para la compra de un tanque de leche enfriamiento (el tanque de enfriamiento es un deposito para mantener la leche cruda en buen estado, es de este tanque de donde recoge la Empresa Pil la leche todas las mañanas y todas las tardes) el cual en primer lugar tiene un costo aproximado de 13.000$us a 16.000$us, es por esta razón que la compra la están haciendo conjunta con otras 15 personas de la misma comunidad poniendo 1000$us cada uno. La Sra Martha Al tener el tanque de Enfriamiento más cerca de su casa podrá realizar su trabajo en menos tiempo y poder pasar más tiempo con sus padres.
texts.en:
Martha lives in a community known as “Esquilan Chico” in Quillacollo Province, Cochabamba Department with her elderly parents that she cares for.  Martha is a raw milk dairy farmer.  The milk is sold to the Pil Andina firm.  She currently has 12 head of dairy cattle producing and she gets about 95 liters daily from them.

The loan she’s asking for is to buy a milk cooling tank (The cooling tank is a storage unit to keep raw milk in good condition.  This is the tank that the Pil firm collects the milk from every morning and afternoon).  

Its price is between US$13,000 to US$16,000 and this is why the purchase is being made together with 15 other people from the same community; each one is putting in US$1,000.  By having a cooling tank closer to home, Martha will be able to do her work in less time and be able to spend more time with her parents.

loans.use: to buy a share in a raw milk cooling tank.

loans.name: Anacela

texts.en:
Anacela is 40 years old and married, with 3 children of school age.  With 3 children in school, Anacela works very hard to provide for them.

Anacela runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Anacela has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, milk, soap, sardines, noodles, etc.. 

In the future Anacela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items, like sugar, milk, soap, etc., to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
Roman is 36, married, and has two school-aged children. He owns and manages a rice farming business to earn income and save for the sake of his family. Being a responsible father, he aims to become financially stable in order to satisfy his family's needs and educate his children. Although sometimes they encounter hardships and difficulties in life, they still have the strong determination to become successful someday, for they believe that it is their stepping stone toward success. 

In this regard, Roman patiently manages his rice farming business and wants to ask for an additional capital of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers, pesticides and pay the labor cost required in transplanting rice. He hopes that this loan will help a lot to increase his yield and income this coming harvest season.

loans.use: buy fertilizers/pesticides & pay labor cost

loans.name: Luz Estrella

texts.es:
Luz Estrella, es una mujer emprendedora y echada para adelante que a sus 31 años de edad, día tras día se levanta para abrir su tienda y así ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a sus dos hijos de 8 y 11 años.

El negocio en el que vende víveres y abarrotes, hoy requiere mayor inversión, puesto que así podrá ofrecerle más alternativas de surtido a sus clientes y garantizar que la sigan prefiriendo a ella, antes que a la competencia que tanto le ha venido afectando.

De acceder a los recursos económicos que tanto está necesitando, los invertirá en la compra de estanterías para exhibir de manera más atractiva sus productos y en un mejor surtido para su tienda.
texts.en:
Luz Estrella is an entrepreneurial woman who strives to get ahead in life.  At 31 years of age, she gets up early every day in order to open her store and thereby offer a better quality of life to her two children who are 8 and 11 years old.  

In her business, Luz Estrella sells food and groceries.  She currently needs to make a greater investment in her business as this will enable her to offer more stock to her customers and ensure that they remain loyal to her business rather than to the competition which has been affecting her.

With access to the financial resources that she so needs, Luz Estrella will invest her loan in buying shelves on which to display her products more attractively and in better stocking her store.

loans.use: to buy shelves and merchandise

loans.name: Yokub

texts.ru: Ёкуб женат и имеет двоих детей. Он добросовестный и трудолюбивый человек. Более 17 лет он занимается скотоводством и выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Он содержит скот за счет кормов произведенным самим. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить хороший прибыль. Ёкуб запрашивает займ для покупки 3 голов крупного рогатого скота. Он заранее благодарит вас за поддержку и милосердие.
texts.en: Yokub is married and has two children.  He is a conscientious and hardworking person.  He has been involved in animal husbandry and growing agricultural crops for over 17 years.  Yokub sustains the livestock by the fodder that he produces himself.  He wants to expand his business and make a good profit.  Yokub is requesting this loan for the purchase of three heads of cattle.  He thanks you in advance for the support and mercy.

loans.use: to purchase three cows

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
This is Marina, aged 44, and a resident of Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Gilbert, a tricycle driver, and is a mother to their children. By the grace of God, Marina has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marina oversees operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle (motor with side car) that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community, all of which are paying boundary (daily fee) each day. Marina’s husband drives their tricycle. Her regular customers are her neighbors in the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 600 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of Php 21, 000. She will be utilizing the loan for the maintenance of her tricycle and also to open up another business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Marina dreams to be able to buy another tricycle soon. She also dreams that her children will finish their education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their Tricycle unit.

loans.name: Safarkhocha

texts.ru: Сафархоча проживает в районе Кумсангир. Возраст, 30 лет. Женат. Имеет трое детей. У него среднее образование. Он при доме имеет участок земли, где выращивает овощи для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Safarkhocha lives in the Qumsangir district.  He is 30 years old, married and has three children.  He has a secondary education.  Safarkhocha has a plot of land by his house, where he grows vegetables for sale.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Lucie

texts.en: Lucie is 36 years old with 3 children aged 6 to 12. She is married to a soldier. She sells clothes in a shop she has run for 1 year. Lucie would like a loan to buy more clothes to sell in her store. Any profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children. She dreams to run a prosperous store with a variety of clothing.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with four children. 
Rodrigo has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Rodrigo has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rodrigo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: La señora Lidia vive junto a su esposo Severino y sus cuatro hijos en la zona de alto san isidro que esta ubicado a treinta minutos del centro de la cuidad. Lidia se dedica a la venta de víveres a crédito como ser arroz, fideo, azúcar y aceite. Pero su ella no reparte estos víveres en la cuidad sino que ella los lleva a las localidades y pueblos fuera de la cuidad, por ejemplo al pueblo de los padres de su esposo. Esta actividad que ella tiene es agotadora ya que tienen que realizar un largo viaja hasta estos pueblos y tiene que cargar y descargar la mercadería que lleva.  Por otro lado el Sr. Severino trabaja como albañil contratista. Ellos actualmente viven en casa familiar de los padres pero quieren llegar a ahorrar suficiente dinero para comprar una casa propia.  En esta oportunidad lidia solicita el préstamo de dinero para el incremento de su capital con la compra de mas arroz, fideo y azúcar.
texts.en:
Ms. Lidia lives along with her husband Severino and their four children in the Alto San Isidro area which is located thirty minutes from the downtown area of the city. Lidia devotes herself to selling groceries on credit such as rice, beans, sugar and oil. But she does not distribute these goods in the city but rather carries them to towns and localities outside the city, for example, the town where her husband's parents live. This business of hers is exhausting since she must make long trips to these towns and must load and unload the merchandise she carries. Her husband Mr. Severino works as a construction worker for hire. They currently live in the family home of her parents but would like to save up enough money to be able to buy their own home. 

At this time Lidia requests the loan for increasing her capital with the purchase of more rice, beans and sugar.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans and sugar.

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en:
Jeffrey is a farmer.  He is 36 years old, married and has children attending school.  Jeffrey usually earns around PHP 20,000 twice a year (during harvest season) and he carefully budgets his income for food, electric bills, school allowance and as rolling capital for their farming business. 

Jeffrey wants to further develop his business.  For him to do this, he would like a loan of PHP 40,000 that he plans to use in his farming business.  He will buy pesticides and insecticides which are very useful in the farm.  He promises to pay back his loan in full and continue to improve his business and have a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and insecticides

loans.name: Camilo

texts.en:
Camilo is determined to succeed in the business to establish a bigger store someday. Indeed, without sufficient capital, all of the hard work will be of little worth. But when his previous loan was granted, the amount made a vast impact on the business. He bought stocks of grocery items for his variety store. He wants to thank lenders since the amount they’ve provided became a way for him to increase sales as he’s earning an income is approximately Php 9, 000 every month.

Camilo wants to thank as well Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for approving his previous loan. He is blessed for God’s abundance and the medium of blessing, CCT and all of the lenders with compassionate hearts. He’s also grateful as they conduct seminars for every entrepreneurs. 

This year, he is requesting for a loan of Php 22, 000 that will be used for the renovation of his variety store and added grocery items as well. 

Camilo is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where he gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony, share his own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and  hear God’s word that  was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: The amount will be used for the renovation of his variety store and added grocery items as well.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his business and improve his store

loans.name: Ruska

texts.en: Ruska M. is 47 years old and lives in Silistra. She is married and has two children. Ruska started her own business in 1990. First she was a taxi driver and in 1995 she started her retail business. Ruska M. sells fruits and vegetables on the town cooperative market. She has rented three stalls on the market. Her husband helps her and drives all the products from the store to the city market. The family has their own truck. Ruska M. and her husband need some financial help for their business. They have to make some repairs to their truck and to supply some fuel. The loan amount is $1200.

loans.use: To make some repairs to her truck and to supply some fuel

loans.name: Emilia Manka

texts.en:
Emilia is married and has three children. Things became very difficult for her when her first son on whom she had invested a lot died in a car accident. Unable to raise  sustainable business capital, she decided to join GHAPE. In the year 2004 Emilia received her first loan of $40 which she used in retailing foodstuffs. Food is something people cannot do without and she therefore has a ready market. With the ever increasing demand, there is need for her to increase the size of her business.

Given a loan of $800, she plans to buy plantains, yams, beans, and maize. With all these food items in stock, she may be able to meet most of the expectations of her customers. The profit she gets from the business will be used to meet her children’s school needs and for medication.

She plans to repay the loan during the loan term.

loans.use: Sale of foodstuffs

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru:
Firuza is single and lives with her parents. Her business started 4 years ago, when she first started selling. At first she helped her mother and then started bringing and selling products herself. Firuza’s product selection includes rubber summer footwear, that she sells in the summer. In the winter she sells winter children’s clothing. Her 2 younger sisters help her. She reinvests a portion of her profits into her business and spends the rest on family expenditures. That is her contribution to the family budget.

Firuza has been a client of MicroInvest for a half year and her business has noticeably expanded. She plans on using her new loan to further expand her business.P.S in the photo you can see her sister,Firuza wants to rent one more place for her sister.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: to expand business

loans.name: Mukadas

texts.ru:
Mukadas S. raises cattle. She is married and has three children. She has a middle school education. She began raising cattle as soon as she has moved to a new area. She decided to get a loan from MicroInvest in order to increase the amount of cattle she has. In 2006 she obtained a $270 loan, which she used to buy a milk cow and improve the location where the animals are fed. Currently she has doubled the amount of cattle she has. In the future she is planing to buy several milk cows and start selling milk products. Her daughter in law is on the picture.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Шуайбоева Мукадас занимается животноводством. Замужем, мать троих детей, образование среднее. Начала заниматься животноводством, как только переехала в новый участок. Для увеличения поголовье скота она решила получить займ в МЗФ «Микроинвест». В 2006году она получила займ в размере 270$. После получения займа она приобрела дойную корову, улучшила место для откорма скота. Сейчас поголовье её скота увеличилось в два раза. В будущем планирует приобрести несколько дойных коров и заняться реализацией молочных изделий.На фото ее невестка

loans.use: to increase the number of livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase flour and other baking ingredients for bread production

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina is 44 years old and currently lives in her own home with her three children who depend on her. Monthly she receives a check from La Vitalicia due to the death of her husband, and her son who is the co-debtor, is a mototaxi driver and supports the family with the income that he generates in this business. The public transportation business with mototaxis is quite competitive, but he accesses a high demand over it all in Warnes where he partners with the principal transportation group. With the loan presently requested Cristina will buy a line of taxis for her son, though she does not know yet which cooperative group they will affiliate themselves. This will be Cristina’s fourth loan with Agrocapital, during this time she has shown that she is responsible and serious person. She also has other loans with other financial institutions that she also is completing punctually

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Cristina tiene 44 años de edad, actualmente vive en su casa propia junto a sus tres hijos, que dependen de ella. Mensualmente recibe una renta de La Vitalicia por el fallecimiento de su esposo, y su hijo, que es codeudor de la presente solicitud, es mototaxista y apoya a la familia con el ingreso que le genera este negocio. El negocio de transporte público con mototaxis es bastante competitivo, pero así de elevada también es la demanda del mismo sobre todo en Warnes donde se consolida como el principal medio de transporte. Con el crédito de la presente solicitud Cristina comprará una línea de mototaxi para su hijo, aún no saben a que sindicato o cooperativa se afiliarán. Esta vendría a ser el cuarto préstamo de Cristina con agrocapital, durante este tiempo demostró ser una persona responsable y sería. También tiene otros créditos con otras intituciones financieras que también están siendo cancelado puntualmente.

loans.use: Buy a line of mototaxis

loans.name: Justa Justina

texts.es:
Justa V. is dedicated to her economic activity which is the sale of vegetables, having had her business for the past 33 years. It was started up with her own saving and those of her husband. Her vegetable-selling business started in Leon, in the market in the area outside the bus station. However, later she requested a space inside for her business and this was granted to her without any problem.

Justa V. is a married lady with 3 children and, together with her husband, they struggle to help them get ahead in their studies at primary and secondary levels.

We cannot omit that Justa V. has benefited for the past three years from Ceprodel, who has helped her out with financing, granting her 20 credits up to now. These have helped her buy vegetables and additionally have helped her pay for her children´s studies.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Justa V. se dedica a su actividad económica que es la venta de verduras teniendo su negocio desde hace 33 años que dio inicio con sus propios ahorros y los de su esposo. Su negocio de venta de verduras lo inicia en León ubicándose en el mercado la Estación en las afueras, sin embargo mas adelante solicita un puesto para su negocio y se le fue otorgado sin ningún problema.

Justa V. es una dama casada y con 3 hijos que junto a su esposo luchan para sacarlos adelante en su proceso de estudio en niveles de primaria y secundaria.

No podemos omitir que la señora Justa Vasquez ha sido beneficiada desde hace tres años por Ceprodel quien le asistió con financiamiento otorgándole 20 créditos hasta el momento de los cuales le han beneficiado para la compra de las verduras y además le han ayudado para pagar los estudios de sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Ni Nyoman Wati

texts.id:
Ni Nyoman Wati’s husband, I Made Suja, is a middle school teacher whose income barely pays for his family needs. Because of this, Ni Nyoman Wati would like to find a new source of income to increase their household income. That was why she joined DINARI’s pig breeding program, which provides training before the loan is disbursed in order to prevent unnecessary usage of the fund. With this loan, Ni Nyoman Wati will buy 2 sows and pig food. In the next 6 months, each sow will bear 8 piglets. That means, in 6 months, Ni Nyoman Wati can have a total of 16 piglets, which can be sold for $25 each, and yield about $100 monthly profit, which will be used to help pay for her family expenses. Ni Nyoman Wati hopes that her pig breeding business will grow even more with time so that she will no longer struggle to make ends meet and pay for her children’s school tuition.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Joan, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Nyoman Wati adalah istri dari I Made Suja yang kesehariannya bekerja sebagai seorang Guru di sebuah Sekolah Menengah Pertama yang penghasilanya pas – pasan untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya. Dengan penghasilan seprti ini Ni Nyoman Wati menginginkan untuk mencari pendapatan baru untuk dapat meningkatkan pendapatan keluarga. Oleh karena itu Ni Nyoman Wati memutuskan untuk ikut memelihara babi yang didukung oleh program DINARI. Salah satu kelebuhan yang ada di program ini adalah adanya pelatihan dan pembinaan sebelum modal diberikan. Hal ini untuk mencegah penggunaan dana pinjaman untuk keperluan lain yang tidak berguna. Dengan kredit yang diperoleh, ia manfaatkan untuk pembelian 2 ekor Induk dan pakan ternak. Selama 6 bulan masa pemeliharaan Induk Babi ini akan melahirkan rata-rata 8 ekor. Sehingga dengan demiki selama 6 bulan pemeliharaan Ni Nyoman Wati menghasilkan 16 ekor anak babi yang bisa dijual dengan harga Rp. 250.000.- per ekor. Dari hasil penjualan keuntungan yang akan diperolah sebanyak Rp.1.000.000.- per bulan. Keuntungan itu ia manfatkan untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidup keluarganya. Ni Nyoman Wati berharap kedepan ia akan dapat lebih mengembangkan usaha ternak babinya dengan memelihara induk dan penggemukan. Jadi dengan demikian jelas ia tidak kesulitan lagi dalam memenuhi kebutuhan hidup sekaligus biaya sekolah anaknya.

loans.use: To buy 2 sows and pig food

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Since his childhood, Mr. Marcos F. has dedicated his life to agriculture and cattle ranching in the municipality of El Sauce in the city of León. He is a married father and carries the responsibility of providing for his family's quality of life; they depend on his agricultural income.

Ever since they have lived in this location, they have had problems with the absence of electricity, since they live in a remote, rural area. To get around this issue, Mr. Marcos requested the installation of a solar panel. Once received, he must be very responsible about paying this debt, and that's why he is seeking the help of Ceprodel in earning credits that will help him cover his debt, and so contribute to improving his household's condition.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

El caballero Marcos F. desde su juventud ha dedicado su vida a la labor de la agricultura y ganadería en el municipio de El Sauce en la ciudad de León. Es padre casado y con la responsabilidad de llevar el sustento a su hogar brindando todas las condiciones de vida a su familia que dependen de sus ingresos en su labor de agricultura.

Desde que viven en su localidad siempre han tenido el problema de la inexistencia de la energía eléctrica por estar ubicados en una zona rural muy alejada. Para evitar tal problemática, el señor Marcos solicitó la instalación de un panel solar que al ser otorgado debe muy responsablemente pagar esta deuda y por este motivo busca apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener créditos que le permitan cubrir la deuda y de esta manera contribuir con el mejoramiento de las condiciones de su hogar.

loans.use: Pay for a solar panel to provide his household with electricity.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 40 years old and originally from Namaacha. She was married for many years, but her husband left her a couple of years ago and moved to South Africa. Julieta has 6 children ranging from 25 to 6 years old. All attend school, expect from the older one who is already working to help with the household expenses.

Julieta just studied until 2nd grade, as she had to work to help her family’s difficult financial situation. Soon after Julieta had her first son and got married, she started to sell baskets bought in the capital city Maputo in Namaacha, where she would buy shoes and go back to Maputo to sell them. Ten years ago, Julieta started to sell only pots and pans made in Maputo. The person that produces those pots comes from Maputo to sell to her and Julieta then sells them at Namaacha’s open market. Julieta buys each pot for Mozambique Metical (MZN) 120 to MZN230 and sells them for MZN180-270. Julieta makes between MZN1,000-3,000 per day, but unfortunately the market is only open twice a week (on Wednesdays and Saturdays).

This will be Julieta’s first loan. She heard about Hluvuku during a conversation with a friend, and decided to apply as well. This loan will be used to increase her inventory and help increase sales. According to Julieta, the more products there are in the stand, the more the stand sells.

In the future, Julieta would like to ask for a new loan to build a stand at her house where she would be able to sell her products during every day of the week.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Domullojonova

texts.ru:
M. is 31 and has a high school education. She is married with four children. M. has a business selling vegetables wholesale; right now, her main business is in carrots. She would like a loan in order to expand into selling potatoes, beets, and other vegetables as well. M.'s husband is a mechanic. Her children are in school. M. has a steady income from her business and would like to increase her sales volume.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Манзура женщина в возросте 31 год замужем имеет 4 детей , образование имеет среднее .Она занимается оптовой продажей овощей восновном сейчас продает морковь.Получив кредит Манзура хочет увеличить ассортимент, продавать нетолько морковь но и картофель , свекла. и.т.д. Муж работает слесарем. Дети учатся в средней школе. Манзура имеет доход со своего бизнеса и хочет увеличить товарооборот.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables for sale

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael sold chifles (plantain chips) in the streets but realized that the business wasn’t making enough money, so he needed to reevaluate new possibilities. One year ago he decided to rent a stall and sell soup in a market in his neighborhood. He works there from 6am until 4pm. He sells a variety of soups, such as chicken soup, lamb soup, and stewed corn soup, among others. The loans that Rafael has received thus far have helped him to purchase the ingredients he needs to make his soups. He would like to open another stall to sell chicken soup.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Rafael se dedicaba a la venta de chifles (chips a base de plátano) en las calles, sin embargo, se dio cuenta que el negocio no le estaba rindiendo económicamente, por lo que tuvo que evaluar nuevas posibilidades. Fue así que desde hace 1 año decidió poner un puesto de caldos en un mercado de su barrio. Él trabaja allí desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde. Vende diversos tipos de caldos, como de gallina, de cordero, de mote, entre otros. Los préstamos que ha pedido le han servido para comprar los ingredientes que necesita en la elaboración de sus caldos. A Rafael le gustaría poder abrir un puesto más de caldo de gallina.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for his soups

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris, age 45, has two school age children who are her reason to keep struggling to get ahead. She and her husband, Mr. José, work hard for their children, hoping that one day they will become professionals. Doris has been selling groceries and basic need items for a while now. This business is her family’s source of income. Doris intends to expand her business, buy foodstuff, and above all, make some repairs to her house, which is why she turns to you in search of a loan that will help her advance. Thanks to your help, Ms. Doris will be able to obtain her goal very soon.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Doris (45 años) tiene 2 hijos que aún están estudiando y son el por qué D. seguir luchando para salir adelante, ella junto a su esposo, el señor José, trabajan muy duro por sus hijos esperando que algún día sean profesionales.Doris se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes y productos D. primera necesidad desD. hace ya tiempo, este negocio es el que brinda el sustento económico D. su casa e hijos. Doris tiene el propósito D. ampliar su negocio, comprar comestibles y sobre todo mejorar algunas estructuras D. su vivienda, por lo que recurre a ustedes en busca D. un préstamo que pueda ayudarla a surgir. Gracias a tu ayuda la señora Doris logrará su propósito en corto tiempo.

loans.use: Purchase goods for general store and make home repairs

loans.name: Dinna's Sayuni Group

texts.en:
Dinna is married with four children between the ages of one and eleven. She has owned and run a small food shop since 2005. Everyday, she works from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Dinna now hopes for a loan to buy more items to sell in her business, like rice, sugar, oil, and salt. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Eliamani, who has a business selling clothes.

loans.use: To increase her food shop inventory.

loans.name: Thi Huong's Group

texts.vi:
chị C. thị Hương Ms 01030017 năm nay 32 tuổi, chị là một phụ nữ rất năng động và hoà đồng với mọi người, công việc bán hoa tươi nên lúc nào cũng bận rộn, cùng với việc chăm sóc 2 con đi học, chồng chị làm công an xã nên không giúp chị được nhiều trong công việc gía đình. Nhưng mỗi khi người dân đến mua hàng, đều nhìn thấy vẻ mặy luôn tươi cười chào đón, vì vậy cửa hàng nhà chị lúc nào cũng đông khách đến mua nhất là vào dịp lễ tết. Thu nhập của gia đình chị ngày càng ổn định hơn trước từ 150.000 VND đến 170.000 VND/ ngày. Chị cùng nhóm đã tham gia vay vốn qua 2 C. kỳ và hoàn trả rất tốt, lần này chị đăng ký vay tiếp C. kỳ III với mức vay 5.152.000 VND để mua hoa, giấy trang trí đám cưới, mở rộng hàng kính mắt nhằm thu hút nhiều khách hơn. Các thành viên trong nhóm chị :

  • chị Nguyễn thị Minh Ms 01030018 vay mức 5.152.000 VND để kinh doanh điện thoại
  • chị Lê thị Hà Ms 01030019 vay mức 5.152.000 VND để kinh doanh chăn ga gối đệm
  • chị Đặng thị Hoa Ms 01030020 vay mức 5.152.000 VND để kinh doanh điện thoại di động
  • chị Tống hồng Xuyên Ms 01030021 vay mức 5.152.000 VND để kinh doanh áo cưới
  • chị Nghiêm thị Thành Ms 01030022 vay mức 5.152.000 VND để đầu tư vào cửa hàng giầy dép.
texts.en:
Mrs. C. Thi Huong (ID: 01030017), aged 32, is a very active and sociable woman. Mrs. Huong is very busy, as she sells flowers in the farmer market as well as takes care of her two children. Her husband is a local police, so he is very busy too and isn’t able to help her much with all the family work. Mrs. Huong’s flower shop is relatively popular in the area, especially during the Lunar New Year and festivals. The daily income of the family is about 150.000-170.000 VND. Mrs. Huong and her group’s members have been very on time in paying back the loans of the previous round. In the next round of loan, Mrs. Huong would like to borrow 5.152.000 VND to buy more flowers, decoration papers for wedding to expand her business. Other members in her group include: -Mrs. N. Thi Minh (ID: 01030018) would like to borrow 5.152.000 VND to open a small shop selling telephones. -Mrs. Le Thi Ha (ID: 01030019) would like to borrow 5.152.000 VND to open a small shop selling blankets and pillows. -Mrs. Dang Thi Hoa (ID: 01030020) would like to borrow 5.152.000 VND to open a small shop selling cell phones. -Mrs. T. Hong Xuyen (ID: 01030021) would like to borrow 5.152.000 VND to open a shop selling wedding dresses. -Mrs. N. Thi Hanh (ID: 01030022) would like to borrow 5.152.000 VND to open a shop selling footwear.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa N., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vay vốn buôn bán

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es: EL SEÑOR ROGELIO ES CHOFER DE TRAILER Y SU ESPOSA LA SEÑORA GEORGINA ES VENDEDORA POR CATALOGO TIENEN 1 HIJO EN EDAD DE ESCUELA Y OTRO PEQUEÑO, JUNTOS COMO FAMILIA ESTAN SOLICITANDO ESTE PRESTAMO PARA COLOCAR PROTECCIONES EN PUERTAS Y VENTANAS A SU CASA Y ASI DARLE A SU FAMILIA UNA MAYOR SEGURIDAD.
texts.en:
Mr. Rogelio is a trailer driver and his wife, Georgina, is a catalogue saleswoman. They have one son who is an elementary school student and another small baby son. As a family, they are seeking a loan in order to add protective bars on the doors and windows of their home to provide greater security for the family.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Door and window guards (bars) for their home

loans.name: Lang

texts.en:
Mrs. Lang S., 55, and her husband, Mr. Nat Chum, 58, live on an island located fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Married in 1970, they have three sons and five daughters. Three of their children are married and live outside the family home. Two of their other children are garment factory workers, two are silk weavers, and the youngest in study in local school.

Mrs. Lang and her husband have been in the business of selling mangoes for five years. They buy mangoes from farmers on contract, meaning they pay money upfront to villagers before the harvesting season and then they collect mangoes to sell at Phnom Penh market. Mrs. Lang is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase mangoes before the harvest season for resale.

loans.use: To purchase mangoes for business

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Long N., 48, is married and lives with her husband and five children in  Battambong province, Cambodia. She is a local teacher and makes $3 a day, while her husband stays at home growing many kinds of mint. On average, he is able to make $4 a day. Three of their children are students and two are helping him with planting mint. 

Long N. is asking a loan of $600 to purchase fertilizers. (Husband is pictured)

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Miryan

texts.es:
Mirian, tiene 40 años  es soltera con una hija que es menor de edad y  dependiente de ella,  solo estudia por el momento. Ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos, championes y ropas.
Mirian  se ha dedicado a este rubro por más de dos años y su local comercial se encuentra en la zona del mercado de abasto de ciudad del este. Todo empezó como un negocio familiar  hicieron una sociedad con su hermana donde invirtieron capital para montar su negocio, hoy día la hermana de la misma le vendió toda sus acciones quedando ella como única propietaria del local comercial. 
Mirian, con sus ganancias de las ventas  hace frente a los gastos de la casa y ayuda a su hija en sus estudios para que en el día de mañana la nena sea una gran profesional.
Mirian, comenta que tiene bastante venta. Es por ello que  desea adquirir mayor cantidad de ropas primavera - verano y championes deportivos, y así  abastecer la fuerte demanda que tiene en la zona.
texts.en:
Miryan is 40 years old and single. She has a daughter, still a minor, who is dependent on her and is a full time student at the moment. Miryan works sells shoes, running shoes and clothing. Miryan has worked in this business sector for more than 2 years. Her business is located in the zone near her city´s wholesale market. It all began as a family business when Miryan and her sister formed a company together and invested the money with which Miryan would launch her business. Her sister has now sold all of her shares to Miryan, leaving her the sole proprietor of the business. With the earnings she receives from her sales, Miryan takes care of the household expenses and helps her daughter with her studies so that one day her daughter will be a great professional. Miryan comments that she has plenty of sales. For this reason she wants to acquire a larger quantity of spring and summer clothing and sports shoes, as a way of stocking up to meet the strong demand she sees for these products.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing and shoes for women, men and children.

loans.name: Shoira

texts.en:
R. Shoira is 38 years old. She is married with two children. Shoira has a tailoring business at her home. Her business is sewing clothing for women and children. Her workmanship is very good and she has a good eye for design. She is very organized and has a good head for business. She has had this business for 8 years and this is her second loan from IMON International. With her loan, she is planning to purchase a new sewing machine. She promises to repay the loan in 12 months. Help this family improve the quality of their life by contributing to the growth of Shoira’s business. They will sincerely thank you for it.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets (including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others). The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: Purchasing a new sewing machine

loans.name: Suyapa Guadalupe

texts.es:
Los salvadoreños a lo largo y ancho del mundo se  han caracterizado  por ser hombres y mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras. La señora Suyapa Guadalupe G. es un claro ejemplo de ello a sus 24 años cuenta con  tres puestos en el mercado de San Vicente; logros obtenidos a través de sacrificios y esfuerzos.  Su sueño es renovar los productos de su negocio y contar con mercadería variada  que  a atraiga nuevos clientes. 

Actualmente  esta solicitando a  integral  su tercer crédito para lograr comprar más insumos para sus  puestos y mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Además  en los créditos anteriores Suyapa  ha demostrado mucha responsabilidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
The Salvadorian people have characterized themselves as extremely hard-working and enterprising men and women throughout the world. Suyapa Guadalupe G. is a clear example of this, having three stalls at the San Vicente market at only 24 years of age. She has managed her accomplishments through much sacrifice and effort. Her dream is to update the products she carries so she has a variety of items to attract new customers. Currently, she is requesting her third loan through Integral to purchase more supplies and improve her income. In addition, Suyapa has demonstrated she is responsible about her payments in previous loans.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies.

loans.name: Nasra

texts.en:
Nasra I. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur and businesswoman. She runs a shop selling clothes in the Vituka ward in Dar es Salaam. She sells both used clothes and new clothes for women and children. She purchases the items from Kariakoo wholesale shopping center. The used clothes are purchased from Karume used clothes city market.

She has been running the business for six years.

She needs a loan of Tshs 1,400,000 to expand the business by buying more inventory.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Amope

texts.en:
Amope sells foodstuffs, torchlights, batteries, and provisions. She goes to the Republic of Benin to buy rice in bags, tin tomatoes in cartons, and vegetable oil. She supplies her customers during the daytime from 7 am to 3 pm. She has been borrowing from LAPO for the past three years.

Amope has four children and she is 38 years old. She lives in Orile-Agege and has been in her business for the past twelve years. Amope is requesting a loan in the amount of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and provision to sell.

loans.name: Tolibjon

texts.ru:
Саломов Толибджон проживает в районе Шахринау. Возраст 28 лет, женат и имеет одного ребенка. Образование среднее.
 Занимается разведением крупно рогатого скота. Покупает, откармливает и продает . ТАким образом и зарабатывает деньги. В данный момент планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы купить дополнительно одного молодого и породистого бычка. В дальнейшем , если бычок вырастет крепким клиент планирует его использовать в качестве производителя.
texts.en:
Tolibjon S. lives in the Shahrinav district. He is 28 years old, married and has a child. He has a secondary education. He is involved in breeding cattle. Tolibjon buys, raises and sells the cattle. This is how he makes a living. Currently, he plans to obtain a loan in order to purchase an additional young purebred bull. Then, if the bull grows to be strong, Tolibjon plans to obtain a purebred breed.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a young purebred bull

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth, 38, sells frozen foods. Ruth is married with three children.  She hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more frozen foods to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Iklim

texts.ru: Иклим Исматова проживает в районе Гиссара. Возраст 27 лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Иклим имеет самбусочную на рынке "Корвон". Она продает самбусу, пирожки, кофе и т.д. Этим видом бизнеса занимется более 7 лет. Муж работает проводником на поезде "Душанбе-Москва". Клиентка хочет взять кредит, чтобы увеличить товараоборот. На полученный доход хочет дать детям хорошее образование.
texts.en:
Iklim I. lives in the vicinity of Gissar. She is 27 years old and is married with 3 children. Iklim has a sambusa shop at the Korvon market. She sells sambusa, pies, coffee, etc. She has been doing it for over 7 years. Her husband is an attendant in the train Dushanbe - Moscow. Iklim would like to use her loan for increasing cash flow and using the profit for providing her children with good education.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Virgen De Cotoca 1 Group

texts.es: El grupo “Virgen de Cotoca I”  esta cursando su primer ciclo, esta conformado por  15 participantes  pertenecientes al barrio santa lidia su  mesa directiva esta conformado por las señoras Felipa que es la presidentas, Elisa tesorera y Heidy Liliana secretaria. A pesar de ser su primera participación en la institución las socias ya estaban juntas en entidades similares a la fundación Agrocapital conociendo la modalidad de trabajo en equipo, y demostrando ser responsables y con ganas de trabajar juntas para salir adelante.  Los miembros de este grupo realizan diferentes actividades como la venta de refrescos, ropa, comida, material escolar, carne y también realizan actividades de soldadura, transporte publico de pasajeros y la agricultura. La competencia en el rubro a la cual se dedican los socios es grande pero las ganas de trabajar y de salir adelante los pone en campaña para ser mas competitivos a través del crédito otorgado con el que podrán contar con un capital de trabajo que ayude a en la adquisición de materiales, insumos y herramientas para generar un mayor ingreso que apoye en el desarrollo de sus pequeños negocios y de sus familias.
texts.en:
The Virgen de Cotoca I group is in their first loan cycle. The group is made up of fifteen members who live in the Santa Lidia neighborhood. Their executive board members are Felipa, the president; Elisa, the treasurer; and Heidy Liliana, the secretary. In spite of this being their first participation in the institution, the members have already been together in similar entities at the Agrocapital foundation. They know the way to work as a team. They demonstrate responsibility and have the desire to work together to get ahead. The group members have different businesses such as selling soft drinks, clothes, meals, school supplies, and meat. They also perform tasks from welding to public transportation of passengers and farming. The competition in the area that the members work is big. But, the desire to work and get ahead puts them on a campaign to be more competitive. They do this via the loan, which they count on for working capital to acquire materials, supplies and tools to generate greater income. This will support the development of their small businesses and their families.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Erdenebayar

texts.en:
Erdenebayar N. lives with his wife and two teenage sons in Ovorhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Erdenebayar had worked for the local army for over a decade. When Mongolia transitioned from the communist regime to the free market economy in 1991, he decided to leave his job and pursue small business for himself.

Today he has a small retail business dealing in unprocessed livestock products such as unprocessed wool, cashmere and animal skins. He purchases these livestock products from herder families in the countryside and sells them at profit at the wholesale markets in the city or sometimes in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running this business for the last 18 years and he is very experienced and well-known in the business. His business capital is currently 3,000,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,450 MNT). He requests a loan to purchase more wool, cashmere, and animal skins from herders.

loans.use: To purchase unprocessed wool, cashmere, and leathers

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es: El grupo “El Progreso” esta representado por la señora Gloria y conformado por 12 miembros dentro D. los cuales se encuentran las hermanas Guadalupe y Maria Laura quienes al igual que sus compañeras poseen negocios pequeños con ingresos independientes como la venta D. cosméticos, comida, zapatos y principalmente ropa para todas  las edad. La competencia en el ámbito comercial es bastante alta pero la dedicación y las ganas D. trabajar son las que prevalecen ante la competencia. El destino del financiamiento es para la  adquisición D. mercadería por cambio D. temporada así como para la mejora y ampliación D. sus puestos D. venta que les permitirá un  mejor ingreso para brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. En general los miembros del grupo cuenta con experiencia gracias a financiamientos en entidades similares a la fundación Agrocapital por lo que conocen la modalidad D. trabajo así como la responsabilidad y compromiso que se requiere para recibir un apoyo económico para sus negocios.
texts.en:
The group "The Progress" is represented by Mrs. Gloria, and comprised of 12 members including two sisters, Guadalupe and Maria Laura. The sisters, like the other group members, have small businesses with individuals incomes. The businesses incluD. cosmetic sales, food sales, shoes and clothing sales. The business competition in the commercial atmosphere is quite high, but the dedication and drive to work help these women exceed the competition. The final destination of this financing is for the acquisition of merchandise for the new season, and to improve and expand their sales stands. This will allow them to proviD. their families with a higher standard of living. In general, all of the group members have experience, thanks to previous financing from similar organizations like Agrocapital Foundation, who know about the responsibility and compromise required to receive economic support for businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: Манзура

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Манзура женщина –кредитор в организации более шести лет. Она жительница Костакоза, занимается продажей нижнего белья, детской одежды и обуви на рынке Костакоза. Для завоза школьного ассортимента детской одежды она планирует  съездить в Бишкек. На снимке Манзура на месте деятельности.

loans.use: продажа  детской одежды

loans.name: Karla Estebana

texts.es: La señora Karla Rodríguez de 48 años de edad, reside en el barrio Villa Reconciliación en la capital de Managua, su negocio es una pulpería que desde hace nueve años administra la cual logro poner con ayuda de su esposo, ahorros y luego con prestamos, procreo seis hijos tres de ellos mayores y casados y los otros estudian, su esposo trabaja en una ferretería como conductor, doña Karla desde horas temprana  se levanta para preparar el desayuno de su familia y para dar un buen servicios a sus clientes ya que abre la pulpería bien temprano, tiene la ventaja que sus hijos le ayudan ya que en horas de la mañana las ventas son buenas. Con este préstamo comprara granos básicos, productos lácteos, y carnes, para ofertar a sus clientes, y brindarle un mejor servicio. Agradece a la institución ya que a través de este financiamiento incrementa su inventario, lo cual genera mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Karla Rodríguez is 48, and she lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood in the capital of Managua. She has a mini market that she established nine years ago. She was able to do this with help from her husband, savings, and then with loans. She has six children. Three are grown and married, the others are in school. Her husband works as a driver in for a hardware store. Karla gets up very early to make breakfast for her family and to give her customers good service. She opens the mini market very early. She has the advantage of her children helping her; sales are good in the morning hours. She will use the loan to buy basic grains, dairy products, and meat, in order to give her customers better service. She is grateful to the institution because she is able to increase her inventory with this loan. This will generate more earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains, meat, and dairy products

loans.name: Faasao

texts.en:
Faasao T. is a 31 year-old woman living in the town of Mulifanua Fou. She is married and has six school-aged children. Faasao owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting bananas for sale. Faasao has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 350 tala WST a month.

In 2009, Faasao joined Kiva partner SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Faasao's request for a loan of 1000 tala WST, which will be used to purchase harvesting equipment, is her first loan request. Faasao plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."
